review.title: centrally located hotel
review.reviewText: We really liked the staff at the hotel, very professional and helpful.  Our room was extremely clean.  The hotel was close to all  amenities, transit, Chinatown and great shopping.
review.positiveRemarks: Lots of staff at the front desk who were always happy to help.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, North Beach, shopping around Union Square and lots of great restaurants in the infinity.  Cable cars, muni, Bart and F Line all very close.

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much for your review. We are delighted you enjoyed your stay and find our location convenient. Your recommendation is much appreciated. We look forward to welcoming you back in the near future!

review.title: Great location, wonderful room
review.reviewText:
Very central , one block away from Union sq. Great shopping area, niece walk to the warfs, The rooms are spacy and niece hotel decore. Bathroom is as good as the room. Would definitely recommend it.
For work or as a tourist, the place to stay
Not Bad been to better Grand Hyatt I understand that been in a big city the hotel is a little older and not so updated like others Thanks

review.title: Very comfortable hotel by union square
review.reviewText: Very comfortable stay, essentially in union square. Lots of good restaurants close by, Starbucks across the street, Walgreens and 7/11 also about a block away. I stayed there for my first trip to San Francisco for 3 nights to do some sight seeing, I was very satisfied.

photos.caption: Icon of SF great food 2 blocks from hotel on Geary St
Great place for a drink 3 blocks from hotel on O'Farrell St
Powell St cable car on block from hotel

review.title: Great location close BART and great restaurants
review.reviewText: Meet friends in SF that traveled from LA.  We are locals from the Diablo Valley

Great hotel close to the union square and other shopping destination. Very clean hotel. Has kosher food for purchase. Very nice stuff
Hi highly recommend

review.title: Nice hotel, excellent location.
review.reviewText: Good solid choice of hotel in union square, good size rooms, comfortable bed, bay view rooms fantastic view. Both rooms modern and clean, great provision of toiletries, beyond bog standard hotel offerings. Our cases were lost and staff very helpful at offering us other toiletries free of charge. Had couple of drinks in bar, drinks were strong but good, nice atmosphere. My first introduction to Hyatt chain and would defiantly use them again.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, friendliness and efficiency of staff. View. Empty fridge in room for your use.
review.locationRemarks: Union square, market street few steps away, tram cars easily accessible, china town close by.

review.title: Nice Hotel, Right Downtown
review.reviewText: The hotel, facilities and staff were all excellent. The hotel was right downtown and within walking distance to everything from tours, cable car, restaurants, shopping and even the theater district. We stayed two nights and had a great time for our first visit to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and staff were great.
review.negativeRemarks: The room windows/sliding glass doors were thin so street noise even though we were on the 14th floor were excessive. The desk chair was uncomfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Everything seemed close by. Restaurants, theater district, China Town, Little Italy, and the cable car were all within a short walk.

review.title: Complementary Watter
review.reviewText: The check in and reciption were excellent. Room is clean. However you have to go to reciption to get your complementary bottle of water. The fittnies center hiygien is very poor. I got eye infection and some of the machines needs major repair. I visited the center five days and non of the malfunction machines were repaired.

review.title: Good but expensive at the centre of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great location at Union Square giving access to cable car routes, China Town and all the top shops. Typical high quality Hyatt.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
Very nice location! Close to shopping and restaurants.  The rooms were very clean and the bed was super comfortable.
The staff was friendly and will to help us with our questions.

review.title: Nice full service hotel
review.reviewText: Close to restaurants and shopping.  Had drinks and snacks in the bar.  Also drinks, breakfast and snacks in the concierge lounge.  All well done.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping and restaurants close by.  Elway's for dinner was excellent.

review.title: Great stay at Union Square
review.reviewText: Whether you are going for business or personal purpose, the Grand Hyatt is a great place to stay in San Francisco.  There are great restaurants around and lots of shops!  In addition, the theater district is nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff seemed a little 'stiff'.=)  I guess I came in at rush hour
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, shopping, shopping!!

review.title: High end price...low end room.
review.reviewText: Hotel location was perfect for our needs.  Close to the theater area was essential.  The room they gave us was small and ok.  View was great but the windows were nasty dirty so it made for an unpleasant experience.  Room was for handicap person which was fine in general but the bathroom shower had no lip and it flooded with ease on multiple occasions.  Decor was generally clean, but dated.  I swear the leather/vinyl table type stand was direct from the 70's... The rips and gouges would attest to that.  Overall the staff were nice, just wasn't impressed with the room, especially when it was $350 a night.

review.title: Great vacation city!
review.reviewText: Grand Hyatt exceeded our expectations: great room, wonderful staff, next to Union Square for shopping, cable cars nearby & convenient to Fisherman's Wharf & restaurants.

review.title: Nice and convenient
review.reviewText: A decent business hotel but not a big hotel. Not the kind of experience you would have in other Grand Hyatts. Convenient location though.  The restaurant is good.

review.title: Quick visit . . . Good location with friendly staf
review.reviewText: Have stayed here before and received great service,

review.title: So convenient
review.reviewText: We enjoy this hotel because its so central and convenient for everything, The staff are consistently helpful and pleasant. -always obliging.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel itself is well maintained and everything is convenient  in the room. We enjoyed morning paper availability and other personal touch
review.negativeRemarks: We would have liked the possibility of evening dinner in a dining room.
review.locationRemarks: Right by Union Square which means easy access to stores and good restaurants or transportation to Fisherman's Wharf and other points of interest.

review.reviewText: Parking cost $65 if u want to park in the hotel, otherwise, you can park down the street, one block away for $35.  Check in was fast, they help you with your bags.  Hotel has 36 floors!  Super awesome view, of embarcadero/industrial/or union square.  Rooms are small, but ur in the city, what can u expect.  Elevators are speedy.  Their work out room has updated machines and weights.  The staff is superior to any other hotel.  Super clean and spotless, no doubt!  Location was awesome, walking distance to Chinatown/little Italy/shopping mall or designer stores/cable train site.  We had to drive to embacadero, so we saved that trip for after checking out.  AWESOME Hotel, using it again when I go back to sf!

review.title: Overall solid, updated room, excellent staff.
review.reviewText: This property has a great location at Union Square and the rooms have been recently updated very nicely. The staff are very responsive and attentive.
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-fi slowed to dial-up speeds at peak use in the late evening. Not acceptable. The window screen didn't cover up the outside light completely.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your review. We look forward to welcoming you back soon!

review.title: Best in union square
review.reviewText: Staff are great..everything was perfect..i  certainely will stay again
The location of the hotel provided excellent access to surrounding attractions. Parking options were available and convenient. There was a great deal to see/do within walking distance.

review.title: Close to shopping and trolly
review.reviewText: Only one day but went to pier 39 had dinner and ride the trolly

review.title: Good hotel at a central place
review.reviewText:
Good experience. Quite a busy place. 
Only i forgot my favourite magnifying makeup mirror and reported it the other day after check out, but no one had turned it in: i wonder why.
Otherwise, the hotel was comfortable and a nice cosy one.

review.title: Great location, great rooms
review.reviewText: Great stay at the grand Hyatt. Good location by union square. Hotel is set up for business customers but still worth it for a leisure traveller.

review.title: Close to local attractions
review.reviewText:
Union square always had something on the go. Close to China town, up scale shopping, trolley cars etc.

Quietest heating/cooling system I've ever "not heard" in a hotel!

Ultra friendly staff and some have a great sense of humour.

Next time in SF, I won't bother with car rental, this location connects to all surface transportation.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel, staff was very accommodating and friendly, convenient location - walking or cable car.  Clean room, comfortable bed/linens.
Nice place! Beautiful restaurant bar on the second floor. Tiny guest room.

review.title: All over great experience
review.reviewText: Very well located and served ....will come again ...kids loved it completely and the view was very nice ..staff members were very helpful and valet parking although a bit pricy but was worth it ...
Fabulous hotel, perfect downtown location, amazing staff. Can't say anything negative about this hotel.

review.title: Great hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: From start to finish my stay at the Grand Hyatt was fabulous!  The hotel is beautifully modern with a superb staff ready to cater to your every need.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to couples and families.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were always eager to help.  The central location.
review.negativeRemarks: The shower was the only disappointment - very low water pressure.
review.locationRemarks: Situated just steps away from Union Square.  Cable car stop, shopping, and China Town are nearby

review.reviewText: Very friendly staff..very helpful but not overselling themselves.  Nice clean rooms with good service.  Everything close by .  If I go back to San Francisco I will stay there again.

review.title: In the center of downtown. Convenient location.
review.reviewText: Bathroom doors didn't work. Would get locked in. Parking too expensive.

review.title: Great location, helpful staff
review.reviewText: We arrived early after 14 hour flight and were pleasantly surprised that our room was available. This made a huge difference to our day as we were able to freshen up before venturing out. The hotel is in a great location - only a few steps to Union Square and central location enabling easy access to other points of interest. Staff was helpful at all times from reception to concierge to Club Lounge and cleaning staff. Room and bathroom were meticulously clean. Club room was of a good size with sufficient storage and good Bay views.  Club lounge hosted 4th July evening which was great way to view fireworks over fisherman's wharf in comfort. Red, white and blue cupcakes were a nice touch. We would recommend this hotel without hesitation.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff, room size, Club lounge, windows that open, clean, bay views.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf, Nob Hill, Lombard Street, Ghiradelli Square

review.title: Beautiful Hotel In The Middle of Everything
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff are excellent! We stayed after our daughters wedding to see the sights, this hotel is in the perfect location. We flew in from Philadelphia and didn't know what to expect, but everyone was extremely nice and helpful. If your staying in San Francisco I highly recommend this hotel. They even have a nice restaurant on their MZ level where we went to have breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: I really liked everything about this hotel. The rooms are clean with a nice view of the city. no complaints.
review.negativeRemarks: I can't think of anything that needs to be improved upon.
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect. Close to shopping, which I really enjoyed, China town which is really beautiful, and plenty of restaurants.

review.title: Great location above all Pet Friendly
review.reviewText:
We have been coming to the Grand Hyatt on Union Square for many years now. It's location is perfect for us. Their gym is more than adequate. For a woman, I feel safe in the 
gym. With other gyms I question my safety. The gym provides a view of the Bay Bridge. We always love the spaciousness of the rooms, it's view and cleanliness.

I would give this hotel a 5 star rating if they were to change their breakfast and dinner menus with more variety. Luckily, there are a lot of restaurants around the area. Room service is good.

One of the reasons we are loyal to this hotel is due to their pet friendly policy.

Highly recommended.

review.title: almost a home run
review.reviewText: the staff and facilities were very nice but the space of the grand suites for the price I payed were a complete let down.
review.negativeRemarks: the grand suites were everything BUT grand.
review.locationRemarks: great location and easy uber drive away from The Castro district.

review.reviewText: Very nice hotel,location is great,accessible to point of interest.Clean & courteous staff.I will recommend this hotel yo my relatives and friends.

review.title: Downtown SF
review.reviewText: RÃ©ception staff super! Luigi set is up in a room on 28th flood where we had incredible view. And inviting is to drinks and appetizer...talk about customer service! Concierge very good too.
Convenient hotel to SF attractions including CHinatown, old St. Mary's, and SFMOMA. CONCIERGE at door always helpful for getting taxi.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Handy for shops restaurants and transport! Hotel is lovely, staff are great, room was upgraded we had a lovely view! Only dissapointment we could hear noise from neighbouring rooms! Even how many times the toilet flushed overnight?
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from nearby rooms
review.locationRemarks: Close to union square

review.title: worst room
review.reviewText: this is the first time I've had a bad experience with a Hyatt hotel, I wrote when booking I had 2 toddlers with me and yet somehow I got booked to the worst connecting room ever! made loud noises until 2am, hot water kept going on and off, hair dryer was broken when I told the front desk guy he was like I'm sorry?! seriously?! never staying here again!

review.title: Nice hotel close to union square.
review.reviewText: Very convenient location. Nice rooms amd staff was very nice. Overall a great hotel. Would definitely stay here again

review.title: Great location for a ballgame.
review.reviewText: We had a large group, a great experience. Not a lot to say other than everything was as good or better than expected.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost.
review.locationRemarks: Ballpark is nearby

review.title: Good value, great location
review.reviewText:
We loved the hotel location, right on Union Square. The room was nice but seemed to have odd noises (i.e. Water pipes, creaky ceilings) when the HVAC was not on.

Also, we had horrible neighbors that woke us up at 3:00am. The hotel staff sent security personnel as soon as we called them.

review.title: A Great Choice
review.reviewText: This was a perfect place to stay for shopping and site seeing since it was in walking distance of the Westfield Mall and other great stores plus restaurants. There is a great restaurant in the hotel as well. We were able to store our vehicle with the hotel while we went to the Giants game and it made the experience very enjoyable with no stress. Great helpful staff. The room was very comfortable as well. Highly recommended.
Great room with fantastic view and plenty of space

review.title: Great hotel and location.
review.reviewText:
Was celebrating my husband's birthday so they gave me a checklist at checkin to select a complimentary
beverage and food to be sent to my room at my desired time.  Opted for a bottle of chardonnay and chocolate
with strawberries--yum!.  They were delivered to my room promptly.  Bed is very comfortable; and we had a beautiful view of the bay.

There is construction going on outside of the hotel but we were on the 25th floor so it did not bother us.
review.positiveRemarks: Location; walking distance to many sites.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, shopping, and more shopping.

review.reviewText: The bathtub made a lot of noise when you stood inside of it and the room door had a huge gap under it. The room we had was shared with another room by a door in between and we could hear them through the walls, not enough privacy especially spending the amount of money that we did. Overall it was really nice, but these are some changes that can be made for future guests.
review.positiveRemarks: the location, the staff were wonderful, overall cleanliness of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: door gaps and privacy
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: Nice hotel right on Union Square.
review.reviewText:
My experience was pleasant since this hotel has all the basic elegant features.
It has been recently renovated and I did not like some of the changes that were made.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the location best, along with efficient and friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks:
The new restaurant, bar and lounge area at One Up was a huge disappointment!  
The one that was formerly on the top floor was exceedingly better.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping on Union Square is a huge plus. There are many excellent restaurants close by.

review.title: Very well located above Union Square.
review.reviewText: A good,  comfortable hotel. Excellent staff. The only issue was that there were major roadworks near the hotel and these were noisy, spometimes even in the early morning.

review.title: Good location. Room with view
review.reviewText:
All went well. Nice room clean and what you expect from Hyatt.


Only thing I did not like that there was no complimentary water in the room or even for sale.
review.negativeRemarks: Also my room was next to a staff room which generated quite a bit of noise with cleaning personnel going in and out slamming the door

review.title: Close to restaurants
review.reviewText:
Staff are very nice, cleanliness of the room was a bit disapointing, floor corners were not vacuumed properly. And also around the bed, the carpet didn't look too clean.
They only offer coffee and some kind of black tea, no evening tea was available.
This was a great hotel in the center of Union Sq.

review.title: Great Access!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the heart of San Francisco. Close to shopping, restaurants and entertainment.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean Room, Great Bar and Restaurant.

review.title: Location and great staff
review.reviewText: Located next to Union Square in downtown SF. Staff was very helpful,  friendly and attentive. We've stayed there three years running. 36th floor, with great panoramic views was closed but a friendly staffer took my grandson and I up there for a tour.

review.title: Great location aside from construction
review.reviewText: Great service, they welcome you in, call you by name, grab your bags, greet you, open the doors, fast check in, coffee makers in room, free water via coolers next to ice machines and the rooms have a sliding balcony door that opens a couple inches allowing for fresh city air. The only negatives were the construction going on right outside the lobby which impacts the valet service and overall appearance once you walk outside. It's noisy and unattractive. The other negative is the crazy expensive parking and valet fees. I rarely rent a car but with an infant and two seniors to  travel with I needed one this time and valet was almost $70 a night with a parking garage across the street with In/out privelages for almost $50 a night per an agreement with the hotel. Obviously parking across the street was good for me at $20 less since i could just retrieve the car for everyone and bring the car up front but that would likely deter me from booking here again if I have a rental car.

review.title: Central to the areas we wanted to visit
review.reviewText: I would stay there again. They just need a rooftop bar and it would be an amazing hotel.

review.title: Friendly, Accommodating, & very chic!
review.reviewText: The Hyatt was a great hotel perfectly located to do everything you want to do in San Francisco!  Staff was so friendly, and the bar was fun and relaxing and had great food.  Rooms were fully equipped and stylish with very comfortable beds and pillows!
review.positiveRemarks: Friendliness and the location, plus the obvious attention to comfort in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to cable cars, Chinatown, driving Lombard curves, Fisherman's Wharf, Ferry to Alcatraz, Bay boat tours, seafood galore, shopping!

review.reviewText: No on site parking, valet way too expensive.  Excellent staff at one up restaurant.

review.title: Too Noisy!
review.reviewText: Happy at check in when they said I had a Union view.  Construction start early but I was on the 19th floor so not too bad.  The first night was "windy" so when I called to complain about the dripping noise in the celing they said it was trapped wind.  The engineer came up 30 minutes (1:00 am) after the call to tell me that this was only the wind, nothing he could take care of .  At this point there were people making loud noise talking in the hall.  That required another person to come up and talk to them.  The next day they offered to move us to the 3rd floor same view which was directly over the kitchen and on top of the construction.  turned those option down so they offered a humidifier (as white noise )  to muffle the sound.  I had to approach the manager next day and since I had booked through expedia she offered some points for my inconvenience!  Not and enjoyable stay
review.negativeRemarks: If they are aware certain rooms are noisy they should inform the guest on check in
review.locationRemarks: Union square is a mess with all the construction.  Stay outside the main area

review.reviewText: It was very nice experience. Very friendly staff.

review.title: game day
review.reviewText: Needed a room overnight for a Giants game. This location was perfect- close to park but also in the heart of Union Square- we walked to dinner and did some shopping. Great overall experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and the rooms were quiet despite the hotel being very full.

review.title: Nice hotel centrally located
review.reviewText: Rooms are small and older, but nice. Staff was good.

review.title: wonderful art, terrific rooms, perfect location
review.reviewText: Love the wonderful hotel.  Nice staff, beautiful rooms and view.

review.title: Great location no pool.
review.reviewText:
Clean right in the heart of the city. 
Perfect location.

We haven't been to SF for awhile and have always stayed at the Hyatt.  It's recently been remodeled and it looks great!    Food at the restaurant, One Up, is delicious! And the staff is still as generous as I remember.

review.title: Very convenient location close to everything.
review.reviewText: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Grand Hyatt.  The location was perfect and the room was very clean.  I actually arrived prior to check in and there was a room ready.  The check in was very fast and seamless.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was the best!  I chose not to rent a car and it proved a perfect decision due to proximity of shops and local restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: There is a great deal of construction going on right outside of the hotel although it did not affect my trip. And I felt the TV cable system was poor.
review.locationRemarks: The cable car is a block away on Powell street which takes you to Fisherman's Wharf.  And any imaginable clothing store is within walking distance.

review.title: Nice clean hotel. Good location
review.reviewText: Excellent experience. I would stay there again. Clean rooms. Good food. Good bar.

review.title: Lovely view!
review.reviewText: We stayed in this hotel just this past week. We loved the view, and the room was quite comfortable. The one drawback was the noise from the outside construction. However, the staff did provide earplugs so that you could rest. The room service was tasty but very pricey. The workout room was well appointed with an amazing view as well.

review.title: Very Well located
review.reviewText: Nice, clean, well located, easy to walk around and safe neighborhood. Close to Union Square

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Check in was quick and easy. Our room was clean, new and modern. Bed was super comfy. Great view of the city. Can't wait for the new Apple store to open. The door men were very sweet and happy to greet all whom enter or exit hotel. I would definitely stay here again. Oh, and, the restaurant and bar serve great food and drinks.
We had an excellent time at the Grand Hyatt and plan to return again.

A great hotel in the center of Downtown, next to Union Square and Chinatown. Clean room with a small fridge and a safe. Microwave ovens are available on request. Has a weird TV/information panel combo but it works OK. On a windy day there's a creaking sound outside higher-floor rooms due to the building movements. The staff are willing to move guests to another room on a lower floor if the sound is bothersome but it wasn't a problem for me. Inside dining is pricy but there are many great eats within 10 min of walking.

review.title: Lovely
review.reviewText: This was a pleasant stay in a nice hotel with a great location in Union Square!
Great Hotel. Close to Chinatown, shopping, great testaurants

review.title: Nice hotel, perfect location
review.reviewText: Small getaway, enjoyed the stay was definitely in my comfort zone and would come back
No free water and no mini bar. Which hotel's mini bar are emptel

review.title: Great location for first visit to SF
review.reviewText: Great location, friendly staff, early checkin provided.

review.title: excellent neighborhood. so easy in and out.
review.reviewText: perfectly located, so convenient to everything, bus, shopping, coffee, street scene, local hangouts. over the top restaurants...even the cable car if that's your fancy.

review.title: Great location, friendly staff, fine place to stay
review.reviewText: Room was clean, efficient and came at a good price. Check in and lobby staff were very helpful and welcoming. Room was small but all we needed. So incredibly well positioned near Union Square, shops, BART and Market Street.
review.positiveRemarks: Very friendly. Great staff. Great location. Room was small but very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking at $67 a night. Wow!
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square, near shops, near restaurants, near BART and Market Street. Great Location. Lots to do.

review.reviewText: Hotel located in the centrum of the city.Cleanless limited.
Very clean room. Great view of Union square foot the Chinese new year.

review.title: Not comfortable
review.reviewText:
Sewer smell coming out of bathroom. 
So much noise coming from hallway with doors slamming that it woke me up all morning.  Must be persistent issue as they provide earplugs in the toiletries.
Great hotel all around, delightful bar on mezz level. Only factor detracting from rating was small gym. Even in the midst of nearby construction, we were very comfortable.
Great place and most Comfortable beds ever! Staff also very friendly and fast with room requests

review.title: Magical experience in Union Square
review.reviewText: Besides the typical rain when I arrived, my stay in the city was wonderful.  The desk agent at check in was extra friendly and comped me a round of drinks when I shared exciting news about a promotion at work. Beautiful room view of the city and Bay and loved the electric shade that lowered over the windows at night. Awesome bathroom - updated and modern decor and feel.  Room service staff was polite and friendly and I was surprised with a bottle of champagne from a friend who knew I was staying at the Grand Hyatt, adding to the experience.  The BarUp bartender was kind and attentive while friendly and personable, too. Great tall ceilings in the restaurant, lounge and main lobby areas.  Down sides would be that my wifi had lots of trouble connecting and I had to call their Tech Support twice and they thought perhaps it was because I was in a corner room at the end of the hallway.  I ended up bringing my laptop down to the lobby to connect.  I'd also would have liked if there was a robe in the room.  Otherwise, great accommodations and service.

review.title: Perfect location in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: The staff makes you feel so special. From the friendly doormen, to the front desk smiles, to the maids who greet you to the amazing staff at Club Level. So wonderful to wake up and go to breakfast without leaving the property. I love this placeð

review.title: decent hotel. Wasn't wowed
review.reviewText: Decent hotel but room is very small and the door would only open halfway due to the closet behind it. So good luck getting large luggage into the room. No wow factors to worthy the cost. Valet parking is $67 a night so be prepared for that which is $20 more than most other hotels

review.title: convenient
review.reviewText: The hotels location was great. The hotel concierge was spectacular. The Lobby was nice.

review.title: A Nice Stay at the Grand Hyatt Union Square Hotel
review.reviewText: We have stayed at the Grand Hyatt Union Square a few times before the hotel completed its renovations. Although we generally check pricing and availability of our favorite hotels situated around Union Square,  the Grand Hyatt Hotel has become one of the those hotels we look at first.   There is still ongoing construction as the city completes its Muni tunnel to Chinatown as well as the completion of the new Apple Store adjacent to the Grand Hyatt Union Square Hotel.   The noise level may be a concern for some travelers desiring a restful sleep.
review.positiveRemarks: The Grand Hyatt is a convenient and centrally located hotel to stay around Union Square.  We also liked their friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Except for the construction noise factor, the Grand Hyatt is a nice hotel to stay while in SF.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Macy's, Westfield Shopping Center, Chinatown, North Beach, etc.   Easy access to taxis, munis and cable cars.

review.title: First impression not good.
review.reviewText: We're a family of four and booked a room with 2 double beds. When we arrived we were told they don't have our room available,but can give us separate rooms! So unfortunately we slept part the first night. The rest of the stay was fine.
review.negativeRemarks: Not having the room I made reservations for and not being able to fix it. I felt if I were paying top dollar they would of found a way.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of everything. Shopping all around.

review.title: Great Union Square location
review.reviewText: Really nice hotel with a great location in Union Square making it real easy to get to everything we wanted to do.

review.title: Excellent stay.
review.reviewText: Staff were amazing right from the moment we drove up.  Parking is pricey but worth the extra to have the valet take care of the car.  Rooms are a little on the small side but extremely clean and comfortable.  Was a perfect central location.
review.positiveRemarks: The helpful staff.  They are eager to assist and give directions or recommendations.  The room cleanliness and comfortable beds.  Great location.
review.negativeRemarks: make sure non guests are not taking up the outside bench waiting area, spitting and leaving garbage strewed around.
review.locationRemarks: Location was one minute walk to union square and all shopping, restaurants and transit.

review.title: nice hotel in downtown SF - great location
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful time, great staff and good food and drinks

review.title: At night people were making noise
review.reviewText: Decent stay in sf. Parking was terribly expensive. Breakfast in dining was excellent

photos.caption: Beautiful view from our room 17th floor.

review.title: The best hotel we could have chosen
review.reviewText: I stayed 6 nights with my parents, who don't speak English, and they didn't have any problem, the staff was always super kind! Delicious and healthy breakfast. Near everywhere. If we go back to SF, we'll definitely stay here again! Thanks!

review.title: Earplugs w/ the amenities = bad sign
review.reviewText: Great location, excellent staff and terrific club room evening appetizers that can easily make a meal BUT the street noise was unbearable. My room was on the 31st floor facing west and the street noise was unbelievably loud day and night. Sirens, construction, horn honks, etc.  I live in midtown in NYC and am used to urban sounds but I really can't figure out how such a cacophony of noise echoed up to my room height. The sliding glass door didn't look very solid and all they had was a fashionable but flimsy shade, no attempt to muffle the noise with a heavy curtain. Instead the hotel's solution was to offer 2 sets of disposable ear plugs next to the toiletry amenities. Really?  A first in my many years of business travel...and a last for me at this particular property, I'm afraid.

Room was good...needs more outlets in the room. 
Staff was great and location is wonderful for shopping and kicking it around the city.

review.title: Excellent Stay
review.reviewText: Hotel is in  a great central location, modern feel, comfortable room and great staff

review.title: Very Nice Hotel and close to all shopping center.
review.reviewText: I love to stay in Grand Hyatt Hotel. Room is very clean, bed comfortable. and Staff is very friendly. Hotel is close to all shopping center and the restaurants. I will stay in this hotel again.

review.title: Weekend Getaway
review.reviewText: I'm a SF native and my GF is from the East Bay so we decided to spend the weekend in Union Square. We were able to watch the Christmas tree lighting ceremony from our room which was great. Check-in was fast and the front desk hotel staff was very helpful. Later in the evening, we went to the bar next to OneUp for a night cap. There wasn't a lot of people in the lounge or the bar area but there were around 4-5 bartenders behind the bar chit chatting among each other. We sat at the bar for about 5-10 minutes before one decided to pay any attention to us. The one bartender who did pay attention didn't appear to be over joyed to serve us and seemed to me we were bothering him. Customer service could definitely use some improvement. Otherwise, the hotel is nice and good location.
review.negativeRemarks: The plastic shades were dusty when moved. Would be great if they were cleaned on a regular basis.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great and central to a lot of SF tourist spots.

review.title: The problem, my friend, is blowing in the wind.
review.reviewText:
First experience arriving was valet charging $68.  Bad enough until you realize that the parking lot *literally across the street* is available for $11 overnight (in my case).  The room was nice enough but during the night there was a constant creaking noise (think wooden sailing ship) that was loud enough to wake me from sleep and keep me awake.  Having reported it I was told that it's a common complaint and "it's the wind making the hotel sway".  Ridiculous - particularly if that's true.   I was initially offered ear plugs and also noticed that there were ear plugs in the bathroom.  I ended up changing rooms to a lower floor ("it's usually better on the lower floors") which still had the creaking but at a lower volume.
If this is a known problem then it should be made clear at the time of booking.
There are many better options for lower prices in the area.
review.negativeRemarks:
Lack of any customer care regarding parking fees or room noise.
Lack of a decent bar (we were advised to go to the Marriot View bar)

review.title: Great location

Staffs are pretty good, but they pushed little hard to use their limo service even though I said I won't. Other than that, it was pretty good experience staying there. Only thing to be aware would be that there were some street people near that hotel and they are pretty aggressive to ask for money.

The only negative...shared by so many other hotels...is over $60 a day valet parking.

review.title: Why Would They Do This To Anyone
review.reviewText: Great location, although lots of construction going on right now in Union Square and a new building being build right next door. Check in was easy and staff was nice.  Room was clean but the lighting was strange, small bathrooms with very loud flushing toilet, so if you went during the night, you would wake up anyone else in the room.  On our 2nd night while sleeping in the middle of the night, we heard noise in the room, investigated and couldn't figure out what it was, without getting much sleep all night, we finally got the hotel engineer to the room to check it out.  He knew exactly what it was, this building was built with stabilizing rods/bars and during windy times, they make noises.  The hotel front desk and office didn't seem to know about this issue but they had to. Certain rooms in the hotel have this happen all the time, this came from the building engineer himself.  Yes, they did change our room at 7am the next morning but we lost a night of sleep which affect our entire next day.

review.title: Great location, fantastic staff!
review.reviewText:
This hotel was fantastic!  Excellent location right next to Union Square with shopping and dining minutes away!  I have stayed on Fisherman's Wharf on all of my previous trips to San Fransisco, however I enjoyed this location so much more!!

The staff were very kind and accommodating as well.  I arrived at the hotel at 10am expecting to drop off my bags until the official check-in time but they had a room ready and allowed me to check-in right away.  They were having problems with their key machine so I was not able to get a working room key right away, however, they apologized profusely and a manager accompanied me to my room to let me in.  I left the hotel to do some shopping and when I returned, I simply went to the front desk, showed a piece of photo ID and they were then able to get me a key.  Amazing customer service!

The hotel itself was very modern and the gym on the 35th floor had beautiful views of the city, not to mention, state of the art equipment!

I talked to the concierge briefly and he was very informative.  He gave me very accurate walking directions to my morning meeting and provided me with a free map.  The door men were also very friendly and arranged a car to take me to the airport after my stay.

I cannot rave about this hotel enough!  It was the most pleasant hotel experience I've ever had and I will be sure to stay here again and recommend it to my friends and family.

review.title: Nice hotel in great location

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Great location, walking distance to all the must see places! Staff was great, lots of food options in the area. Rooms are small but nice. Would stay there again!

review.title: Fantastic Hotel
review.reviewText: I tend to be partial to Hyatt's in general but this is one of my favorites. Fantastic central location and truly wonderful service. Absolutely consistent as well. Every time I am here I enjoy the same great experience.

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much for your feedback. We are delighted you enjoyed your stay with us and find our location ideal and convenient. I do apologize for the unwanted noise. Thank you again for staying with us and we hope to see you again soon.

review.title: Perfect location and atomosphere!!
review.reviewText:
The location is very convenient for any activity in San Francisco.
The favility is very stylish and clean.
The size of the room is not so spacious, but still good size in downtown area.

Breakfast buffet was also nice with eggs, fruit, sausages and bacon, good coffee and fresh juice. 

Only problem I had was noise in the room.
Emergency vehiecle and construction was causing quite loud noise during the night. 
I hope this was happening only the night I stay. 

But overall, my experience was very good.

review.title: Great hotel in great location
review.reviewText: We take one of our grandchildren each year to this  hotel in downtown SF. The staff is friendly, the location is perfect.
review.positiveRemarks: Extra-ordinarily friendly and helpful staff. Rooms with great views.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast buffet is great but restaurant menu could be improved for lunch and dinner.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything in downtown San Francisco.

review.reviewText: Very good, excelent location, good beds, staff friendly. I liked the bar.

review.title: Nice hotel with great view of city
review.reviewText: Hard to rate on just one night's stay, but overall it was nice. A little pricey for the size of the room, though.
review.locationRemarks: Located on Union Square, lots of shops. Fairly close to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: Good location, no parking garage, though.  Parking is a block away in City parking lot.  Road construction makes it hard to pull into front.  Double beads comfy, but queens would be better for 2 persons per bed.  No in room coffee or complementary coffee in lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Queen beds not fulls

review.title: Nice place in the center of the city
review.reviewText: Good location, very friendly staff, liked the room
This is my go to place to stay in SF. Great location...nice clean rooms.

Bad service. Called front desk and they said they will send someone to fix the Internet problem and never did. Called again later that night and another girl picked up and didn't even care to say sorry.

review.title: San Francisco is a great city
review.reviewText:
Great location for city exploring and shopping.
Elegant urban life-style and great people watching precinct.
Expensive and hard to get to.
A long way from the airport, which causes anxiety about flight schedules.
review.negativeRemarks: An escalator to the dining and bar level.
review.locationRemarks: Other than shopping, not much. Need to be able to get around on foot to get to the sites of interest; taxis are not cheap.

review.title: Great location awesome views
review.reviewText: I love hyatt hotels.  This one is one of my favorites.  I've stayed here many times and always enjoy it.  The rooms are great not boring at all and very clean.  The staff is funny and helpful.

review.title: Very good location.
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time.  We were close to shopping, restaurants and China town.  The hotel was very clean and the staff very pleasant and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Our room seemed a bit cool.  We couldn't get the heater to work correctly, it would only blow out cool airl
review.locationRemarks: There are many restaurants and a lot of clothing stores to shop at.  You are also close to China Town.  The Cable cars are also close by.

review.title: Lovely Hotel on Union Square. Bright & Cheerful.
review.reviewText: I needed to book a hotel at the last minute and so I chose this location based upon the pictures of the rooms. Really the room exceeded my expectations. It was the cleanest hotel room by a wide margin I'd ever stayed in. The materials used in their last renovations - namely tiles, carpet, furniture were in pristine condition. The bed I would only give a 4 out of 5. It was a little hard and felt cheap. But it was comfortable enough for me to fall asleep and get a good rest. Free wi-fi was a plus except it was spotty and often booted me out causing me to re-log into a lot. This is a techie town - can't you get that one right?
review.positiveRemarks: Room decor and bright windows. Love to have lots of light in my room.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds, linens, pillows and Wi-fi.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to walk to Union Square and Market Street, China Town. Great central location to many fun tourist attractions and world class shopping.

review.title: No room cleaning in the 2 days I stayed.
review.reviewText: I stayed for two days.  I was able to checked in at 2pm. I asked for a room that was away from the construction noise.  I was being satisfied with my request.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location.  The price was good for this location.  The front desk was very professional and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: But the room service was slow.  There was no bottle water available in the room.  Some basic things such as bath wrap, slippers, etc. were available u
review.locationRemarks: Great for shopping!

review.title: Nice view, good location.
review.reviewText: Staff was nice and the room was spacious, bright, and functional. Would stay again at this price.

The location of the hotel was great! It was close to the mall and to our function. The construction around the hotel was a  bit of an inconvenience but its wasn't too bad. All staff we encountered were nice & friendly.

review.title: Great location Great hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent facilities, comfortable beds, everything you need close by at walking distance.
Close to many stores. Nice hotel. Stayed for 2 nights. Hotel staff was friendly

review.title: Great location, facility and price
review.reviewText: Staff was accommodating in getting us room on the opposite side of the building from the construction that went on all day and night all the time. The noise was lessened but by no means eliminated. Construction also limited access to Union Sq (inconvenience only) for walking and taxis. Hotel services and staff were superb. Gym equipment was in great condition and sufficient to handle the guests. Nice appetizer/bar menu for snack and before dinner drinks and had a pleasant atmosphere. Concierge desk was helpful and available.
review.positiveRemarks: Location excellent, nice facility and good price for prime site in Union Sq.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise from construction next door (7 days a week and almost all night long) was annoying.
review.locationRemarks: Not far from Ferry Bldg and Embarcadero for walking along the bay. Walking distance to BART and MUNI to get to other city locations.

review.title: Construction noise is very irritating.
review.reviewText:
My window was facing a noisy construction site with 24 h activity. I arrived at midnight with no additional room to switch. So I have to endure the first night. However, the staff is nice enough to assign me a different room the next day. 
Overall, it was a pleasant stay in an ideal location.
hotel was nice. staff at checkin and in lounge were indifferent and didn't seem to care we were there. maybe it the san fran attitude but won't stay there again
review.negativeRemarks: attitude of employees other than 1 person in lounge ( Boa) who actually seemed to sare

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Perfect place for our valentines days. Definitely we'll come back soon ;)

review.title: Nice hotel but services are slow
review.reviewText:
Overall I enjoyed my stay here . The only thing I didn't like about their service is about room services , it took forever for someone to pick up my laundry bag , they didn't clean my room when I requested in advance . Waited for 2 hours , and called again , then they showed up . 
They didn't bring more laundry bag and laundry form on my 2nd night . I had to call again and request for it .

review.title: Excelled location, very nice hotel!
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel! The room was very very nice! The bathroom was gorgeous! I loved the mirror and the back light! the Shower and bathtub was very classy. Our view of union square was so nice! The location was perfect! close to all the shopping around union square. This hotel made our stay in San Francisco so nice! Only thing the Valet parking guy was so pushy! I guess its because parking on the street is few and far between and he wanted our car off the street as soon as possible, still it was pushy. Other than that it was great!

review.title: Nice hotel central to everything.
review.reviewText: Close to union squre. Perfect location, to walk right where u need to go.

We had a great visit to the Grand Hyatt San Francisco at Union Square. The staff was extremely nice and  helpful. When checking in we were upgraded to a room with a nicer view because it was our first time visiting. We had a fantastic trip and I hope to come back again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Walking distance to so many attractions and restaurants.  Great staff, very helpful, wonderful suggestions for restaurants in area.

review.title: Great hotel in the heart of Union Square.
review.reviewText: Thoroughly enjoyed our four night stay at the Grand Hyatt.  Our room on the 10th floor was modern, comfortable, quiet and extremely clean. Would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent location. Staff were friendly and helpful. Appreciated having a fridge in the room, water cooler on each floor and Starbucks in the foyer.
review.locationRemarks: Great for shopping. Close to China town, North Beach and other main attractions.

review.title: It was ok...
review.reviewText: My stay was ok.  It was nothing amazing.  They did close there amazing bar that was on the top level which is too bad.  It was one of the best views in San Francisco.  So the hotel really does not offer many amenities that are special.
review.locationRemarks: It is very centrally localized and close to Union Square.

review.title: Good stay.

The lobby setting a bit weird for Hyatt, where the escalator in the middle of the entrance which breaks the view of lobby. And the check in staions make you feel that you are at some quicky stay cheap hotels although check in was quick.

review.title: Nice location

review.title: Nice hotel on Union Square

review.title: Grand Hyatt SF

review.title: Ask for a corner room
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful holiday staff at the Grand Hyatt. Staff was very nice. Workout area was wonderful and well equipped. Never ate at the hotel because there are too many fun places to go and try. The hotel is close to BART and mass transit took us everywhere we had to go.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to all the places we wanted to go . . . museums, restaurants.

review.title: Hotel close to Union Square

Found small pieces of garbage on the carpet and the toilet seat had dirty brown spots. Only 1 elevator was working one of the mornings and after waiting for 15 minutes we gave up and took the stairs.

review.title: San francisco tour

review.negativeRemarks: Cleaning

review.title: Perfect location for Christmas shopping-Union Sq.

review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to Union Square and China Town.  Cool lounge on second floor.  Excellent views from 23rd floor.
review.negativeRemarks: Surface mount sinks too large in bathrooms. Room ventilation lacking-could not get it cool and not sure fan was even working.
review.locationRemarks: Starbucks across street.Toured China Town with Linda Lee-All About Chinatown WalkingTours; she was fantastic.  Best tour we have been on; great lunch.

Hotel stuff are friendly.  The housekeeper provided my dog an extra pillow during our stay.
review.locationRemarks: Union square.  Shopping.  Cable car.  Chinatown.

review.reviewText: Delightful stay. The room was clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Toilet flush is too loud.

review.reviewText: Comfortable inner city hotel -  convenient to Union Square prime shopping. Great  views from higher floors.

review.title: A great hotel next to Union Square and shopping

Had a great time at the hotel.The view of Union Square  with the lighted christmas tree was 
spectacular.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was close to shopping stores,restaurants and transportations.

review.title: Hotel is close to the shopping centres
review.reviewText: Hotel is close to the shopping centres and restaurants, very convenient. We have asked for early check in at 11 am and they obliged and we were thankful for that. We experienced a blackout for the entire City and we could only access to our room at 8pm, thought the hotel could have provided torch lights for the guests or provide free breakfast as a gesture for the inconvience caused to us.

review.title: Good, affordable hotel next to Union Square

review.title: Location

review.positiveRemarks: Room was ready upon our arrival.  Upon our arrival front desk was busy; however, line moved very quickly and efficiently.

review.reviewText: Our stay was very convenient, comfortable, and enjoyable. Thank you

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your review. It is always great to hear compliments on our staffs and I'll be sure to share your comment with the team. Individual cup coffee machine and tea bags are placed inside each of our guest room and they are located in the cabinet underneath the TV. Please accept our apologies if those were not replaced during your stay.

review.title: Great Union square location

review.negativeRemarks: Would have appreciated complimentary morning coffee, given the fact that this is an upscale and expensive. Valet Parking cost was outrageous

review.title: Great hotel in great location

review.title: Great option but needs a littlemaintenance

review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is very well located in the facilities relatively new
review.negativeRemarks: General maintenance

review.reviewText: Friendly and helpful staff from check in to check out. Will stay at this hotel again.
review.locationRemarks: Everything close by

review.reviewText: When I checked in I was offered an upgrade to a room on the 30th floor with a view of Union Square at no extra charge.  Spectacular view!  Very comfortable room with nice linens and bath supplies.  The staff was super friendly and even offered me an umbrella on my way out the door into the rain.  Perfect location for exploring the city as it's in the center of it all.  Will definitely be staying here again in the future.

review.title: Good hotel next to Union Square

review.title: Great service & great location

Room, food & service were excellent! 
Plus great location for shopping, restaurant & visiting famous sights.
We will be back again!

review.title: Disorganized and impersonal.
review.reviewText: Staff members seemed overwhelmed, overworked and like even they didn't "believe" in their hotel's ability to deliver a personalized positive experience.  This place was a revolving door for guests.  The bartender in the restaurant was downright rude.

review.title: Grand Hyatt San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Everyone and everything was wonderful during the 3 days that we stayed.
location is amazing

review.title: Gorgeous hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was beautiful and conveniently located to all the shops. Loved it!

I checked in around 9:40 PM, but the front desk told me there was no double bed room available. The lady asked me to wait for 30 minutes to get the room, and I really got upset. Although she offered me $50 hotel credit and late check out, I still feel very upset comparing to the great rating about this hotel on the website. My reservation said my room is glide of the sqaure, but the front desk gave me the room at 3rd floor without any view.
Positive experience. They went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: I had wished there were self-serve laundry facilities on site. The valet parking is only affordable if work is paying for it anyway. ;-)
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location.

review.title: San Francisco getaway
review.reviewText: Nov 2014:  Hyatt accommodated our early arrival with a fantastic room (2505).  Everything was is perfect condition.
review.positiveRemarks: LOCATION LOCATION.  Staff very professional, concierge services great, overall conditions were top notch.  Wifi throughout hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located to all...great neighborhood; Union Square

review.title: Very enjoyable stay.
review.reviewText: The front line staff were friendly and very helpful. All areas we encountered were clean and comfortable. Our room and atmosphere were quiet for a good rest. Other than a long bus tour, we walked to our destinations.
review.positiveRemarks: Efficient staff. Close to all amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: A larger pick-up / drop-off area would be beneficial.
review.locationRemarks: A lot of the San Francisco 'Hot Spots' are within walking distance.

review.title: special birthday celebration
review.reviewText: Everything was top notch from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. Highly recommend this place.

review.title: Nice hotel, friendly doormen, nice amenities.
review.reviewText: Good experience, decent price. Good amenities, has an far-eastern vibe to it. If you select city view, you'll get some really nice views.

review.title: Great, central hotel with free Wi-Fi
review.reviewText: We only had two days in San Francisco, so wanted a central hotel from which we could easily access shops and sights. I actually chose the Grand Hyatt at Union Square because it has free Wi-Fi (well, it is included in the price!) and this was a better deal than other hotels in the vicinity that charge around $15 a day, which is ridiculous in my opinion. The hotel is modern, comfortable and has friendly staff. We didn't use many of the services, or even eat or drink in the restaurant/bar, as there are so many cafes and Starbucks close by, so can't comment on those. Nevertheless, staff at front desk were helpful and polite. We had a problem with the blind in our room, mentioned it to the concierge and it was fixed with a friendly note left by the time we returned. The hotel is close to all the shops, and it's a pleasant walk (flat!) down Market Street to the Ferry Building, from where you can walk along Embarcadero and the various piers. We had booked tickets for Alcatraz in advance, and it was a 30-minute walk to Pier 33 from the hotel. You could have taken a street car or bus, but we chose to walk. It's easy to take the tram or no.30 bus up to Fisherman's Wharf from the hotel, so a great choice in our opinion.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your feedback. Please accept our apologies for the less than ideal experience. We offer an amenity list for our guests ranging from bath ropes to slippers and everything in between and we are truly sorry that this was not properly communicated to you. Your comment about the internet connection and food trays is much appreciated and will be shared with the appropriate departments to review.

review.title: Great views--bad service and dated rooms
review.reviewText: Crazy noisy heating system--no bathrobes or mattes--uncomfortable furniture--horrible internet connection and food trays that sat on the floor in the hallway for days at a time without being picked up.
review.positiveRemarks: the Views facing the bay are wonderful if you are above the 13th floor.  The ladies who run the concierrege are great.

review.title: Great location near Union Square.
review.reviewText: The hotel is located near shopping, restaurants and transportation.  Whether you want to walk, take the cable car, the MUNI, subway or street car, they are all close by.  The concierge was very helpful arranging several tours, giving directions and recommending places to eat.  They have an awesome happy hour that is from 3 p.m. to 7 p.m. each day.  We did not eat in the hotel's restaurant, but tried several appetizers in the bar area.  They were fine.  I was there during the World Series and everywhere you went they were cheering for the Giants.  It was great to see such enthusiasm for the hometown team.  Our room had an awesome view of the city, which was a nice surprise.  I enjoyed the view, especially at night.  The housekeeping staff forgot the replenish our coffee one day.  When I called for some they delivered in within minutes.  I would definitely recommend and would stay there again if I were to return.
review.positiveRemarks: The location of the hotel was a definite plus.
review.negativeRemarks: My main observation was the last of restrooms on the first several floors.  The only restroom was for one person off of the bar area.
review.locationRemarks: RIght on Union Square.  Plenty of shopping, restaurants and transportation options.

review.title: nice hotel close to union square
review.reviewText: nice view nice hotel close to union square nice view nice hotel close to union square nice view nice hotel close to union square nice view nice hotel close to union square nice view nice hotel close to union square

review.title: Nice hotel in BEST location!
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel but does not have many frills. If you are just looking for a clean hotel near good shopping and great food, this will work. If you want something luxurious this is not the place. It is basic but clean. Staff was usually helpful and friendly.  Several of the doormen could use some better manners.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness and location, also the beds were great and very soft linens.
review.negativeRemarks: Need to update the rooms. Need to leave more towels in room on daily basis. There were 2 of us and we only had 3 towels. Don't skimp!
review.locationRemarks: The very best thing about the location is being near Market Street and Union Square where all of the great shopping is located!

review.reviewText: Hotel stay experience was fine; not in room much, except to sleep.  Bathroom shower could have been cleaner and air conditioner had a rattle.
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness of bathroom and air conditioner

review.title: Grand Hyatt SF Union Square Experience
review.reviewText: Only had 1 night in SF and we were very happy with this paticular Hyatt ( more than one in SF ) It is located in the best part of the city. There are so many great places to eat and shop within a few minutes walk. We stayed on the 34th floor and the views in the morning and at night were amazing! We will never stay any place but here when we return to SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Views and overall style, very modern.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are attached by an inside door for families I guess but you can hear a little too much between the rooms, not terrible but noticable for sure.
review.locationRemarks: That`s the best part other than the views. When you walk out of the lobby it`s non stop shopping and food everywhere you look, awesome choices!!

review.title: Nike half marathon
review.reviewText: Awesome service ... Great food and very comfortable /clean rooms ... I will definitely stay there again next year :)

review.title: Great hotel. Centrally located.
review.reviewText: This hotel was excellent.  The room was very clean, extremely comfortable beds, and a fabulous view of the bay.  The staff was very gracious and helpful in every way.  I'd definitely recommend it and will stay there again.

review.title: next door to union square

excellent location, moderately priced.
5 nights, excellent weather, all tours were appropriately serviced although Yosemite is  a big day out.
