review.reviewText: We were there during a big local event and the hotel was very well prepared.

review.title: Very Nice Place
review.reviewText: The rooms were really clean and up to date. This is my new favorite hotel in San Francisco.

review.title: Centralized hotel with modern room
review.reviewText: Nice washroom and automated blinds were a nice touch.  Free wifi is a nice perk since most 4+ star hotels rip you off with $15+ a day wifi charges.
review.negativeRemarks: The cleaners were vacuuming at 8am which is insane and rude.

review.title: Perfect Union Square location
review.reviewText: If you want to be able to walk around the Union Square area, the location of the Grand Hyatt is perfect.  Check-in and check-out were a breeze, as was valet parking.  The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet and clean.  What else do you need?

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We loved having the Grand room available to us and the staff were great!!

review.title: Hotel stay
review.reviewText: We were excited to go to San Francisco for the very first time.  We were told by many people to stay down in Union Square.  My husband loves the Hyatt chain, so he booked our stay there.  The first night was fine.  The second night we did not get any sleep.  The heater or ac unit kept rattling all night long.  We called down early in the morning and mentioned it to them.  They said they could send someone up but it would be a few hours.  We didn't see anyone.  We went down to check out and told my husband told the lady that there had been a problem.  She apologized and said she could give us a "little discount" off of our valet parking.  I asked, what are you going to do for us?  She said I can give you a little discount for your inconvenience.  I said I am sorry but it was not a little convenience.  We did not get ANY sleep!  She then offered to take off both nights charges of the valet parking.  I was too tired to mess with her or it.  I just walked away.  If that is all the hotel was willing to do was just to give us a discount off of our parking, not a comp for a room that did not allow us any sleep.  We will not be a Hyatt a customer again.  We did go down to San Antonio the following week end and started to stay out the Hyatt on the river walk, but changed and went to the Westin Marriott.  We loved Hyatt but not sure if you will get our business again.
review.negativeRemarks: When there is a problem and an unhappy tired customer, the staff needs to seek a Manager to make the right decision to accommodate them.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of food and shopping

review.title: Nice hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: We had a pleasant two night stay as the room was spacious, clean and the bed was super comfortable! Great hotel located in Union Square, that's walking distance to many shops, malls and restaurants. Loved it! Big plus were the essentials the hotel provides to guests for free, such as toothbrushes and toothpaste etc, as the 4-star hotel we stayed at in Las Vegas prior to our arrival in San Fran didn't have that.

review.title: City centre hotel
review.reviewText: very convenient, the room is comfortable with nice city view but the hotel facilities under expectation.
review.positiveRemarks: the room service system is easy to be controlled on TV
review.negativeRemarks: add swimming pool
review.locationRemarks: union square , brunch

review.title: Great downtown location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the heart of the action.  Close to China Town and all the shopping any human could want!  The room was fanatastic and the staff extremely helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Largest Macy's maybe in the world

review.reviewText: I stayed over the weekend to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday. We both love SF and wanted to make this a fun and memorable weekend. We arrived hours ahead of check in time and we were able to check in and get a room. The front desk staff were very nice, efficient and check in was a cinch! The hotel overall, was decorated beautifully and the room was comfortable. The only thing that amazed me was that there was no complimentary bathrobe. We had a great view of O'Farrell St. and Sbux was just across the street. Union Square was a short half block away and China Town was up about 2 blocks. Centrally located. The breakfast buffet was great. The eggs with the goat cheese, tomatoes and asparagus and the roasted potatoes was delicious. Our waiter was super attentive and light-hearted. I would probably suggest to change out the hotel lobby couches. They are comfortable but low, it's OK. The art installation was dramatic and perfect for SF culture. A complete ceiling to floor art sculpture was built around a red and white vanity. Overall, we were happy with our stay and will be back!

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Valet and curbside staff gave erroneous information about parking.  Much less expensive to self-park at Stockton-Sutter garage than stated while trying to sell me on the $62 per night valet parking.

review.title: Great hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Superb fast check in, very friendly staff, room extremely comfortable overlooking Union Square with two beds as requested.  Noisy roadworks 24/7 outside, we were told about them at check in, and advised if they bothered us they would move us to opposite side of hotel.  The noise certainly didnt keep us awake, and we enjoyed the fantastic view, so didnt want to move.  So close to shopping, restaurants, cable cars, etc.  Restaurant was very nice, couldnt fault the hotel, and for 2 females felt very safe.
review.positiveRemarks: Closeness to everything San Francisco has to offer.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Cable Cars, Restaurants, Shops, Hop On Hop Off buses.

review.title: Well located in heart of San Fran
review.reviewText:
Well located...surrounded by good restos, shopping
Use their car for airport shuttle - $50 and much more comfortable
review.positiveRemarks: Perfectly located next to Union Square and shopping/financial district
review.negativeRemarks: as much as room seemed clean, there was a few long hairs on bathroom counter and definitely not mine or my wife's

review.title: Location,location
review.reviewText: Don't bring u car or park at other inexpensive parking lot around the block. Valet parking will cost u $65 per day. Everything is accessible by foot or take public transportation.

LOVE this hotel and its location.  However, and I will say, this is not your typical Grand Hyatt as compared to others around the world.  Nonetheless, its a great hotel, wonderful staff and fantastic location.  You can walk nearly everywhere.

review.title: Right in the center of the city
review.reviewText: Overall it was a good stay! We stayed at room 2614,the view was amazing,but in my opinion i think we payed to much for this hotel. there is a Starbucks across the street so you don't have to walk to far,all the shopping stores and restaurants are down the street.it was a good experience but would not pay that much money again for this hotel
Great hotel and great location. We stayed at a club room. Only thing is the room was a little bit small for 3 adults with 2 double beds
It was a great hotel clean and elegant very good location and the staff was absolutely wonderful

review.title: Nice hotel which is close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Great and very comfy environment which suites my purpose of staying

review.title: Wine country tour
review.reviewText: After a harrowing trip from the Oakland airport on a friday evening via a independant shuttle, we entered the Hotel with the staff help, and once at the desk were greeted with two cold glasses of champagne and a welcome . It doesn't get any better.  .
review.positiveRemarks: Very updated and bathroom fixtures amazing. Starbucks type coffee available in lobby in the morning.
review.negativeRemarks: A chocolate on the pillow would be nice.. seriously though they exceeded our expectations.
review.locationRemarks: People watching, Fishermans wharf, Giardellii chocolate factory. The wine tour and the wine train was amazing.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your review. We are thrilled you had such a great experience with us. Your recommendation is our biggest compliment! We hope to see you come back and celebrate many more special occasions with us in the future!

review.title: Wedding anniversary
review.reviewText: We were very pleased by the staff and hotel location! We got a free upgrade and made it a pleasurable experience! I would recommend this hotel to anybody! I have stayed at several hotels in the San Francisco area and so far this one beats them all!

review.title: Great location and a great hotel over all
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a perfect location near union square. Love the design of the hotel (very modern). Rooms are great, offers great restaurant and bar as well.
review.locationRemarks: Great shopping and restaurants

review.title: Beautiful hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel & the rms were lovely but on the 2nd flr, where the bar and restaurant are, only have one bathroom stall for both men & women. For both the bar & restaurant !!!!

review.title: Great great hotel!!
review.reviewText: Super comfy beds. Great location right in union square! Rooms are very modern. Bathroom was a good size. Nothing negative to say about this hotel.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel and Excellent Staff
review.reviewText: Title says it all! One thing needs to be pointed out. There is a lot of construction going on which is not the fault of the hotel. That being said, the staff is fully aware of the noise and does a great job accommodating for it as much as they can.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff is second to none! Cleanliness and aesthetics.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I had considered hotels in the fishermans wharf or financial district. but glad I chosen Union Sq at the end. It's close to all the shops restaurants, and breakfast cafe's, and is always crowded enough to feel safe. The hotel property is right next to Union Sq, and is very slick, modern and clean, as you would expect  from a Grand Hyatt!
Traffic was terrible but the hotel is centrally located for walking.

review.title: Great staff and location
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel right at Union Square. The staff went out of their way to be helpful. The whole experience was fantastic

review.title: Great Hotel, but...
review.reviewText: We had a great experience with the hotel and that staff, but I would not recommend the hotel restaurant or bar (OneUp Restaurant and Bar).  Very expensive, and food not that great.  Go out, it's much better, and you get more bang for the buck.

review.title: Well located in Union square.
review.reviewText: One night stay. Very quick check-in and check-out and friendly staff at the desk. Valet parking efficient with speedy return of car the next day. Room comfortable and very clean although not huge. Decent city view.

review.title: Very central in down town. Close to shops.
review.reviewText: We found the hotel to be in excellent location very central to transport and shops . Hotel staff were very courteous and helpful.

review.title: A Pleasant Week
review.reviewText: We had a very nice experience at the Hyatt.  The staff were friendly and helpful and the room was clean, quiet, and comfortable.  We had a nice view of Union Square from our window on the 15th floor.

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much for your review! We are glad you thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us! Your recommendation is our biggest compliment. Please come back and see us again!

review.title: Convenient location!
review.reviewText: Very classy place, lots of room. Hotel staff so helpful. Nice electric shades block out light!! Loves the separate vanity area for hair and makeup, etc. coffee stocked in room along with a refrigerator. We stayed 4 nights and I didn't want to leave!! Highly recommended.
Excellent location. Right in the center of the city. The staff very accomodatibg. Great selection of hot and cold breakfast items. I recommend this hotel

cozy and clean room, need to pay attention on the dust. Nice city view and perfect location. Price is readonable. For me, I will rate 4.7 out of 5.0
Really enjoyed the stay there.

review.title: Our favourite hotel in SF
review.reviewText: Excellent as always. Staff pleasant and obliging.  The club lounge on floor 32 provides an very high standard of food and service to match a spectacular view of SF. Our club room this time was somewhat disappointing lacking a bath tub and airconditioning difficult to control.  But we had a very good time.
review.negativeRemarks: See above
review.locationRemarks: Excellent shopping and we had a great harbour dinner cruise.

review.reviewText: Overall a wonderful experience. I will stay here again and recommend the Grand Hyatt to my friends.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: The staff bends over backwards to assist guests. Our room was on the 27th floor and we could hear street noises. Shower could use a better shower head. TV volume would not go over 40 to keep down the level of noise meanwhile we could barely hear it.
review.negativeRemarks: Double or triple  pane windows to keep out street noises. Shower head had a weak flow. TV volume should not be controlled.

review.title: Very comfy, upscale hotel close to Chinatown.
review.reviewText: This was our first trip to San Fran and we were just passing through so we only stayed 1 night. The bed and room was super comfortable and they have these darking shades that was very helpful for us to sleep on our jetlagged time. Location was decent, although you had to cab everywhere, nothing was walking distance. Only thing we had hope for was a pool but overall, great hotel.

review.title: Very good
review.reviewText: Great location, room, staff. Everything is as advertised
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Excellent location with basic comfort
review.reviewText:
The lobby for the reception and concierge is a beautiful setting, it gives the San Franciscan style for free and easy atmosphere.  The location is so convenience, close to cable car, major shopping areas.  If you do not plan to rent a car and want to do a shopping trip to San Francisco, this is a good location.

The pillows are not comfortable.  Unlike the other Grand Hyatt I have stayed, the toilet amenities are very basic and limited to bath gel, soap, shampoo and conditioner only.  The room doesn't give the 5 stars feeling.
review.negativeRemarks: up grade the pillows and provide full toilet amenities.
review.locationRemarks: Shop, eat, union square and cable car

review.title: Potentially Pleasing/Excellent IF...
review.reviewText: The aesthetics of the hotel & location are great.  The issue I had was probably room specific and not the whole hotel so I would actually rate higher if not for the A/C was blasting the whole time - could not adjust or turn off. The tech had to come at 1:30am to finally yank the thermostat off the wall (I could have done that) - KUDOS that he DID show up fast though. Also I was in room 1209 (view of Starbucks @ Stockton & Post) and the room had a constant odor of what I would describe as similar to cheeseburgers w/grilled onions the WHOLE time I was there. I thought it was just the room next door had ordered room service right before my arrival - but noâ¦it was a constant odor that drove me nuts. When i went to open the sliding door to get fresh air, the odor was stronger - so perhaps it was wafting upward from below so they need to secure that door & weatherstrip it if it can't be opened anyway. I WOULD stay there again - I would just make sure not to stay on that side of the hotel. Thankfully it wasn't a hot weekend so I didn't bother with the A/C.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The best service I  have ever experienced at a hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located next to Union Square

review.title: Upscale hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: We were able to book this hotel at a very discounted rate, maybe because there is major construction going on in the street below.  However, when we checked in, we were given a complimentary upgrade to a higher floor, and from there (floor 31), we couldn't really hear it--although they begin very early (I think even 6am), and continue well into the evening (possibly as late as 10pm).  But for us, it didn't affect our stay, and we had a lovely time.  The hotel seems to have pretty much any amenity you could want available either in the room or by request.  It is a good location near Union Square, the Powell Street cable cars and Chinatown.

review.title: Lovely Hotel at Union Square
review.reviewText:
On arrival at the hotel we were met by welcoming staff who checked us in.  The trip was a special occasion as my wife and I were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary.  The staff were already aware of this and sent a bottle of wine up to our room with a couple of cup cakes.  A lovely gesture and very much appreciated.

We ate only once at One Up which is the hotel restaurant but it was delicious and not over priced.  The rooms were very spacious and comfortable with coffee making facilities available.  The TV was incredibly and was interactive which allowed you to review the area to find attractions, restaurants etc.

On a couple of occasions we asked for items that we didn't have with us and they were delivered free of charge to the room a short time later.

All in all it was a fantastic experience at a hotel which was nearby the bustling Union Square and shopping malls.  Would definitely recommend and hope to return some time soon.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything was fantastic and customer service was excellent
review.locationRemarks: It was right at Union Square and nearby shops, chinatown and theatre district.  There is also a cable car which starts at nearby Powell Street.

review.title: Very noisy.  Very Poor bar service.  Indifferent
review.reviewText:
The room was ok.  Clean and comfortable beds.  The room was very noisy due to crowd noise from the street.  It sounded like New Years Eve.  Around 2AM the drunks went away but the construction noise from the new subway kept you awake the rest of the night.  

The bar service was poor at best.  I ordered a specific drink.  After a 10 minute wait in a not crowded bar the waiter brought  my drink and informed me that it was a different drink than I had ordered.  He wanted to know if I wanted this drink or another drink that I had not ordered.  When I told him I did not want either drink and I wanted something else he seemed put out by may request.  After another 10 minute wait I finally received my drink.  I thought you were supposed to get what you ordered not what the waiter or bartender wants to serve you.
review.positiveRemarks: Not much.  It was close to a meeting I had to attend.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.  See above comments.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Walking distance from everything . 
Cable car 1 block
Overall good value, close to all main attractions.

review.title: Central Union Square Location
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Grand Hyatt was excellent! Chinatown, Union Square, BART stations were all steps away. The staff were incredibly welcoming and accommodated all of our needs. We will definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the fine amenities make the Grand Hyatt a great place to stay.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown is two blocks away. Union Square is outside the hotel. BART is just blocks away.

review.title: satisfaction
review.reviewText: i can not say anything, because everything were fantastic, all the personnel were very accommodating, i can only say thank you very much for all the personnel of grand hyatt.
review.positiveRemarks: very clean, and personnel are polite and accommodating

review.reviewText: awesome location with walking access to shopping, Chinatown, downtown, and trolley line!! loved it
great experience, staff was friendly and pleasant, helpful.  room was clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: expensive room service.  are charges necessary?

review.title: Clean and Nice, But Not Exceptional
review.reviewText: Pricey for the size of the room, the accomodations in the room, and the decor. The room way way smaller than I expected for two queen size beds. The decor looked cheap. The bathroom was less than impressive. The trough sink was not easy to access for two people at once, and the plastic covered wood for the vanity and in other places was ugly and looked just plain cheap. Also, the sofas and chairs in the lobby were totally uncomfortable and lacked color appeal.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were helpful in every way, and the food was delicious in the restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Redecorate the room I stayed in with some class. Get rid of the plastic that is supposed to look like wood.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great and made it easy to access the cable cars, as well as great places to shop and to eat.

review.title: Great hotel, great view, great staff
review.reviewText: Great everything... Room, Staff, Food, Location and everything else

review.title: Nice hotel, shame about the staff
review.reviewText: I love San Francisco, and have enjoyed many trip to that city. I work in sales and spend far too much time in hotels. My room was very clean and comfortable. The hotel is nicely layout out and very clean and modern. In short it does look like the pictures on-line, but the staff are cold and lacking in customer service. The doormen, are welcoming, but the desk staff are not. I found them to be officious.
review.positiveRemarks: Its clean and modern, and the room look like the pictures online.
review.negativeRemarks: your desk staff could use some lesson on customer service. They could be welcoming. Less fake, more warmth.

review.reviewText: Stay and staff was wonderful. Location was great.

review.title: Great hotel but noisy
review.reviewText:
Great hotel and lovely rooms but due to poor windows sound comes through too easily and all night roadworks meant not great sleeping did complain and got free meals etc but expected at least double glazing from a hotel of this quality.

Staff were all great
review.negativeRemarks: Double Glazing

review.title: Excellent Value
review.reviewText: The room had a view of Union Square and was very modern in style. Couldn't not hear any other guests but did hear street noises which is pretty typical.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, modern amenities, luxurious beds and large bathrooms. For an older hotel everything was up to date and first class.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, within walking distance of Chinatown, many restaurants and quick coffee places. Also easy walk to shopping.

review.title: Nice Room, Easy to Find! Quiet and Relaxing
review.reviewText: Definitely would recommend and stay here again. Easy check in. Easy parking. Friendly staff. Great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Bottled Water in Rooms
review.locationRemarks: Right new to Union Square, Near AT&T Park

review.title: Mother daughter girls night out
review.reviewText: From the moment we walked in the door 'til room service delivered a pizza at 11PM our stay was fantastic. We were able to return to the room with our shopping bags before heading out to the theatre. It was awesome

review.title: Home away from home.
review.reviewText: Very pleased with the room. The furniture was comfortable and that I could open the huge window without a screen made me feel connected to the city. The room decorations were perfect. I loved the pretty and functional lighting. I wanted to just stay in the room and enjoy but there was to much to do. The fact that I was able see my car parked in the Sutter Stockton garage was amazing. I looked around at other hotels nearby and was quite pleased that I had chosen the Hyatt. The safe was ideal, very useful.
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing that wasn't right was the refrigerator. It was barely cool and had ice on the coil.
review.locationRemarks: What wasn't around!

review.title: In the middle of everything !
review.reviewText: It looks like they just remodeled the place. Very close to Chinatown, right in the middle of Union Square within all the shops.

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much for the 5-star review! We are delighted you enjoyed the comfort of our guestroom and the free internet service. We appreciate your business and we certainly look forward to welcoming you back soon!

review.title: Modern hotel right at Union Square
review.reviewText: A couple nights stay in downtown San Francisco @ Union Square. Couldn't ask for more. Staff were great, rooms very comfy, free high speed internet. We could have use a better view of Union Square, but it wasn't really needed.
review.negativeRemarks: A few more options available on the in-room service monitor. Directions on how to get to the Freeway?
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown. Union Square.

review.title: Nice close to Union square
review.reviewText: Liked it very much. Really centric and clean. New facilities and near to key areas. Easy ti get to restaurants and shops by walk.

review.title: Superb location in the heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: Large clean room with full length windows. Staff are really helpful and friendly. Prefect place to explore the city, shop and eat out.
review.positiveRemarks: Such a great place to catch the cable cars and for shopping in Macys and Bloomingdales!
review.negativeRemarks: Be great if the hotel had a pool

review.title: Nice place near Union Square
review.reviewText: Great location at as reasonable price as one could expect at that location. Only complaint was that the water in the shower couldn't get hot enough for me.
review.negativeRemarks: raise the temperature on the mixing valve in the shower
review.locationRemarks: Union Square San Francisco -shopping, dining, clubs, business.

review.title: Family friendly hotel near cable cars
review.reviewText: Nicely upgraded modern looking hotel near major attractions like China town and cable car routes. The folks at concierge are amazing and help you with a smile with all the things that can make your trip memorable. The nice gentleman who took our bags to the room offered an excellent orientation with information on restaurants and best options for city tours. This made it all easier with a two year old.
review.positiveRemarks: Attention to little things like free bottled water coolers on every floor because the hotel wants its guests to stay hydrated. Big plus with 2 yr old.
review.negativeRemarks: Carpet in room showed a little age.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, luxury shopping, cable cars, tour bus stop down the road.

review.title: Nice location, disappointing service.
review.reviewText: I am a frequent traveler and I have been staying in a number of upper class hotel, including Hyatt Hotel. To my surprise, Grant Hyatt in San Francisco is way below my expectation in term of service. The hotel staffs weren't friendly at all, I don't feel the welcoming gesture every time I talk to them. The only good thing about this hotel is location. Serious improvement is needed to educate the hotel staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Service level.

review.title: Great rate on Room, terrible parking fee per day
review.reviewText: Room was fine, nicely remodeled. Parking is a rip though!

review.title: Very nice, great view of Union Square
review.reviewText: Excellent service ~ but please include more washcloths - two is never enough!

review.title: Central Location
review.reviewText: Stayed for 3 nights. An unusual reception area which seemed to work ok. The rooms were clean & offered facilities as stated. Rooms were well soundproofed so minimal traffic noise. Excellent location for centre of the city but a bit further than I expected from Pier 39 etc. Bus tours etc close by. Thought hotel was quite expensive in comparison to others I had booked on my trip (although not in San Francisco city).

review.title: Great hotel in perfect location
review.reviewText: A great hotel with excellent facilities in the heart of San Francisco. Perfect location for acccess to cable cars and trolley buses. Large number of very good cafes and restaurants within easy walking distance,
review.positiveRemarks: Everything you could want available in a spacious room. Great gym with spectacular views.

review.title: FANTASTIC HOTEL
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel , location is amaZing close to union square which u can find any attractions uu want , staff polite , concierge very helpful ,

review.title: Union square
review.reviewText:
Check in was at 3 and our keys were not available until 6. The staff offered to store our bags in the meantime. Great offer but we had a long drive and wanted to rest.
The room was nice but considering it was a suite, I was expecting little more. It was nothing special. We were woken up at least 3 times throughout the night by party goers returning to their rooms and having lengthy debates from 3-5. Then, construction sounds of metal hammering woke us up at 7. So, the sleep was not great. We noticed that there is a "quiet" floor that was not advertised anywhere. Might be something to look into the next time. The temperature control did not work. Heating resulted in cold air coming out. I would have given it a 4 star rating if the room was not misrepresented as suite. Room plus bathroom does not equal a suite.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was nice. The view of Union Square was outstanding and the room was very clean. Convenient parking garage cross the street. Free internet.
review.negativeRemarks: Timeliness. The noise factor might be difficult to control. I would have liked to have known about the quiet floor. Heat control needs an upgrade.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square- lots of shopping and bars.

review.title: Luxurious hotel
review.reviewText: Amazing location and amazing hotel. You can really tell the difference going to a 'grand' hyatt, rooms of a very high standard with breathtaking views of the city. The facilities are a little lacking, gym and health facilities are a little basic, but for a city hotel it is excellent. Would highly recommend staying here if you are planning to go to San Francisco.

review.title: Luxurious hotel
review.reviewText: Amazing location and amazing hotel. You can really tell the difference going to a 'grand' hyatt, rooms of a very high standard with breathtaking views of the city. The facilities are a little lacking, gym and health facilities are a little basic, but for a city hotel it is excellent. Would highly recommend staying here if you are planning to go to San Francisco.

review.title: Good location, good accommodation
review.reviewText: Great location close to Times Square, shopping, public transport. Rooms very nice, modern and spacious. Great staff, overall very nice hotel and would stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, next to Times Square, shopping, public transport

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, good service, nuce view! Love it. A good choice

review.title: Great Hotel & location, beds just to soft.
review.reviewText:
Overall this Hotel is one of the best I have stayed during my traveler experience.

Hotel registration was a pleasant experience, fast and staff very nice. Our room view was great, modern room and great amenities. The only thing we just didn't like, was the bed, maybe for a two night stay its ok to have a super soft bed, but we stayed 6 nights, so by the third night and after walking to get to know the city the bed becomes hard to sleep on it. Other than that if you are used to sleep on super soft beds, you will have a great time.

This is our first Grand Hyatt experience and I can tell, that it worth the price.
review.negativeRemarks: Car parking its a bit expensive, but you can park across the street for 12 dlls.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel Location is one of the best, Muni and Bart is just 1 block Away. A few restaurants just 1 block. Starbucks is in front of the hotel.

review.title: Convenient Union Square location!
review.reviewText: Great staff, great view and location! Starbucks in hotel a plus! Would stay here again!

managementResponses.response: Wow! Thanks so much for the 5-star review! It is always great to hear our guests enjoyed the amenities offered in our guestrooms and compliments on our staffs! Your positive feedback is much appreciated and I'll be sure to share your comment with the team! Please come back and see us again soon.

review.title: Brand new facilities. Excellent Staff.
review.reviewText:
Outstanding hotel experience. Looks like the entire hotel (including the room we stayed in) had just been renovated.
All staff check-in, concierge, breakfast staff and house-keeping were wonderful and helpful.
Comprehensive complimentary toiletries for items you have forgotten (shaving cream, nail polish remover) or if you wanted a firmer foam pillow to borrow.
Great gym facilities. Healthy, tasty breakfast (which was included in our room rate). WiFi in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Union Square. Easy 20-25 cab trip to/from the airport.

review.title: Clean modern room with a view.
review.reviewText: Girls night out with my nine-year old daughter. Great location in heart of city. Beautiful modern decor and great customer service.

review.title: Amazing service
review.reviewText: The service of all the staff, from valet to front desk to housekeeping, was outstanding! I have never experienced such a staff full of people to do the very best they can to accommodate you. This hotel is very customer oriented. The hotel is also in a great location, close to Union Square and lots of shopping. I have no desire to explore any other hotel on our next visit-I will be staying here again.

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much for your review! We are thrilled you had such a great experience at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco! I'm glad to hear our staffs were able to assist you with your needs. Your recommendation is our biggest compliment. Look forward to welcoming you back again!

review.title: Great accommodations
review.reviewText: This hotel was so wonderful. It felt like a 5 star hotel. We have stayed at the Fairmont in the past and loved it of course, but the hills really were a huge obstacle for me if I wanted to walk around. The grand Hyatt is so centrally located. Beautiful restaurants all around it and Sacks fifth Ave store is just a block or so away. It was just heaven on earth. I loved that staff so helpful all the time when dealing with my wheelchair each time I called for my car. I felt like a queen. I so recommend this great hotel and will definitely go back next time I visit this city.

review.title: Great accommodations
review.reviewText: This hotel was so wonderful. It felt like a 5 star hotel. We have stayed at the Fairmont in the past and loved it of course, but the hills really were a huge obstacle for me if I wanted to walk around. The grand Hyatt is so centrally located. review.title: Family Trip
review.reviewText: We were pleased with the room and amenities. Our check-in was made easier by the laptops the staff was using. They were not behind a desk but out in the room on a table. Check-in was very efficient. They remembered to ask for my travel rewards number as well.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is great and the hotel is top-drawer
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice to have two queen beds vs. two double beds. Better for family travel.

review.title: Clean, contemporary hotel- parking is a rip off.
review.reviewText:
This hotel was clean and comfortable but very basic for the price. Parking is $64 a night which is a total rip off, so we parked in the lot across the street for two nights and it only cost $20/night. The Intercontinental doesn't charge for parking.

I would have expected the rooms to have robes and slippers and would have expected it to have a pool and jacuzzi, but it doesn't. These things would have made my stay better.

The location is ideal, a block from union square and walking distance or a short cab ride to many other attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of parking, no pool or jacuzzi. The bed was too soft.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, walking distance or a short cab ride to most attractions.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Would definitely stay here again. Great location, great staff, great views.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel. Everything went perfect.

The only problem was the showerhead. It too close to the wall.

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much for your 5-star review! We are thrilled you had a great time exploring the Union Square neighborhood. We look forward to welcoming you back soon!

review.title: Great hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: Walking distance to shopping, great restaurants etc. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Very nice, clean and conveniently located.

review.title: Right in Union Square!
review.reviewText: Fantastic location, beautiful room, amazing view, wonderful staff. One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at!
review.negativeRemarks: Cheaper parking, the unload and loading area is tiny and crazy! The staff does their best, but getting in and out of the hotel is an adventure.
review.locationRemarks: Tons of shopping!

review.title: Nice hotel and close to shopping
review.reviewText: I have a great time staying in d hotel. Perfect for shoppers

review.title: hotel location is ideal.

review.positiveRemarks: its decor suits my design sensibility.

review.title: Location!!
review.reviewText:
Excellent service! The location of the hotel is the best if you go for business or pleasure is perfect, one block from Union square, close to public transit. Lots of stores and restaurants and even Chinatown is on a short walk distance.

The room was perfect! Comfy bed and was worth more than we paid
If you forget Toiletries they have a list of things they can provide you.

review.title: great for city exploration
review.reviewText:
this is almost a boutique Hotel in the middle of downtown San Francisco, within just a couple of blocks walking distance you find excellent food as well as great shopping opportunities
the hotel also has a very nice restaurant with reasonable prices,as well as a comfortable bar /lounge with live music in the evening
good meeting facility
review.negativeRemarks: since it is in downtown, it can be quite nosy so the rooms need better insulation

review.title: Nice Hotel perfect position in City.

review.positiveRemarks: Close to fantastic shopping and restaurants

review.title: Great central location. Love the lobby design.
review.reviewText: It has a boutique hotel feel. High standard typically Hyatt and rooms are nice. Location is central if that's what you want.
review.negativeRemarks: vending machine is non existence in the hotel. you need to walk across to Walgreen
review.locationRemarks: this is the heart of SF.

review.title: Lots of staff but not very good service
review.reviewText: Generally good experience with great location but staff seemed to be preoccupied with talking amongst themselves - seemed to be too many not doing anything in particular and not particularly helpful or friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: More welcoming staff
review.locationRemarks: Heaps of things to do nearby with the this great location being so close to Union Square.

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much for your review! Glad you found the Grand Hyatt San Francisco your go-to place in the city. It is great to hear you had such a great experience with us. We look forward to welcoming you back for another city escape soon!

review.title: Weekend in the CIty
review.reviewText: I live in the peninsula and take a room in the SF whenever I want a night out without having to drive half an hour back home. I've stayed at various hotels and apartments (through airbnb) in the city for this reason, and the Grand Hyatt is my favorite so far! Everyone at the Grand Hyatt was so nice to us! The staff was both professional and warm, from the doormen, to the folks checking us in and out, to staff in the lounge. This is my new favorite go-to place. Got a good rate from Expedia, too, so wasn't too pricey!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff - 100%. Felt like a queen while paying budget rate.
review.locationRemarks: So central! Right off on union square, union square garage is nearby. Walking to chinatown, shopping, everything!

review.title: I won't come back again, or recommend
review.reviewText:
location is good in Union Square, but this is it. hotel design, ok; staff attitude, ok. But the parking is terrible.
I've seen other comments about parking before but didn't pay too much attention. My personal experience is terrible. First of all, when we called, we were told there is ONLY one choice is Valet parking, cost $60. When we were checking in, the receptionist told us there is another option is that they have a parking building, it cost $45 for 24 hours.
But the reality is that the Union Square underground parking is also available, we parked from 8pm to next day 11am, it cost us only $35.
Basically, the parking issue killed our mood. Never feel so strong that I dislike this union square area.
And I have had stayed so much better hotels, this one really doesn't have good security system. anyone can just walk in to the elevator and reach any floors.

review.title: Glass Bathroom Doors
review.reviewText: If it weren't for the glass bathroom door in the hotel room, I would have given this hotel a 4 stars. Too much light in the room during the night when sleeping and the other person has to go in there. Just doesn't have the feel of privacy I like when I gotta go either! if it weren't for that, I would highly recommend it.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great and centrally located with easy access to public transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Trade out the glass bathroom door for regular doors. Design looks great, not practical.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Modern, nice amenities, clean. Enjoyed our stay. Good location in San Francisco.

review.title: I can't believe it
review.reviewText: I am long standing and loyal Hyatt Hotel chain customer. I am astounded that they do not have the BBC on their television channel listing.
review.negativeRemarks: Their TV channel selection range.

review.title: Great location near Union Square!
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful experience! The staff was nice and helpful! The location was perfect and close to just about everything! I would recommend this hotel!

review.title: Nice location close to beautiful union square.
review.reviewText: Wonderful staff and our room got upgraded to 30th floor. Beautiful bay and city view. Only complaint is tempature in room was a little cold even heater was turned up to 78F*, parking was expensive.

review.title: central location
review.reviewText: all good. the only surprise was that they closed the bar at the top and coverted it into conference rooms. it's nicely remodeled and hotel and rooms are in excellent condition.

review.title: Standard king room on 27th floor
review.reviewText:
We had a room with a breakfast package included.

The breakfast was amazing - there was a buffet with pretty much anything you could wish for - the waiting staff were out of this world - they couldn't do enough for you. For instance if your orange juice was slightly empty they would be with you in an instant to offer you more. Likewise with the coffee or whatever else you were drinking.

There could be some improvement with the door staff... They could be quite unapproachable sometimes. Often looking rather miserable and annoyed that they were there. Perhaps they were only interested in receiving tips from carrying luggage to the cabs?

The reception staff were hit and miss, some are amazing, some are similar to the door staff.

The bar staff upstairs seem to be similar to the door staff, they don't treat you very well and are clearly there for a tip - even with poor service.

The location of the hotel is very impressive. You can stumble across Chinatown accidentally as it's so close. Seconds away from shops such as H&M, Macy's etc etc.

Some very nice bars and restaurants closeby.

Walgreens all over the place and a Starbucks literally on every corner.

Use gray line tours for trips to Alcatraz and muir woods - they're excellent.

Be sure to walk on down to pier 39... It's about 40 mins walk and the sea lions are hilarious.

review.title: weekend getaway
review.reviewText: pretty good overall, except that someone was smoking next to our room
review.negativeRemarks: nothing i can think about
review.locationRemarks: by Union square, great shopping and restaurants near by

review.title: Nice big-city hotel, very busy location
review.reviewText:
My husband, son and I enjoyed our hotel stay, but because we're not familiar with San Francisco, we were surprised at how busy this part of town is. If you like shopping at chain stores (think Niketown, Old Navy, Macy's, Banana Republic, etc.), this location is for you. For my family, it was a little overwhelming. The lobby was teaming with people constantly, but once we were up in our room it was very relaxing and quiet, and the city view was stunning. The woman who checked us in gave us a complimentary $100 breakfast credit without any prompting, which was so lovely.

We did have to switch rooms, however, as there was some (ahem) random hairs on the bathroom floor and towels (which are housed in open cubbies under the sink). But we called housekeeping and they moved us to a room seven floors up immediately and were very apologetic that the room had not been properly cleaned. This incident would not deter me from staying here again, though the crazy-busy location might.

Lastly, DO NOT pay for the $62 valet parking. There is a city lot across the street. We parked there (they have hourly rates, 24 hours a day) and paid only $27 for the day.
review.positiveRemarks: Decor, view, friendliness of staff, very comfy beds. My son loved the remote-control curtains.
review.locationRemarks: It's a VERY BUSY area -- tons of shopping and I believe you can walk to AT&T Park.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Great location right on union square. Very close to public transport including cable car if you want to brave the tourist-y thing. Tons of shops and close to China Town. Facilities were pleasant and comfortable. Staff very nice. Appreciate the remote controlled opaque shade over the window (great view by the way) since the sunrise would have been very bright. An opaque door to the bathroom would have been nice since anyone turning on the light floods the entire hotel room with light in the middle of the night. Price VERY reasonable for middle of downtown SF. Would go back again.
review.negativeRemarks: Opaque door to bathroom. Air conditioner/heater a bit loud.
review.locationRemarks: See above

review.title: Bad room. No view. Had to pay $125 to park car
review.reviewText: Was not a nice hotel. No one mentioned extra $65.00 a day to park car. Bad view. Bath room had no privates. Safe in room didn't work. Ended up spending $125.00 which no one mentioned for my car which was outrage charge. Would not recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: Better service

review.title: 20 minute wait for elevators
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, great view, terrific staff. However the elevators sucked 15-20 minute wait each time.

review.title: Awesome service
review.reviewText: I took my family to visit San Fran over the holidays and was very impressed with the service at this hotel at every level.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great for walking or public transportation

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Perfect location overlooking Union square. Close proximity to all public transportation (BART, Trolly, F train). Great staff, large and cleans rooms. Only complaint was the noise from the hallways was very loud but this would definitely be our hotel of choice for our next trip.

review.title: Small room with spartan furnishings
review.reviewText: Staff was very nice and service good. The room was quite small and lacked any comfortable seating. The only chair in the room was a desk chair that was not designed for humans. Other than a fancy bath tub-shaped sink, the bathroom was not much more than a standard two-star hotel. I expected more from a "Grand Hyatt."

review.title: Great location, steps from Union Square.
review.reviewText: The hotel has great location, steps from Union square. The renovation has a modern design makes the hotel even better. Overall it was a great experience, most staffs are very friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: location, newly renovation room, comfort beds
review.negativeRemarks: My only complain is the room service staff needs to improve her attitude over the phone! She should have more patient and not yell at customer.
review.locationRemarks: Steps from union square, Chinatown, restaurants, and shops

review.title: Nice and clean and in a perfect location
review.reviewText: Went to s.F for just one night and wanted to be close to Union square. The Hotel location was very convenient and the room was nicely updated and clean.

review.title: DIRTY
review.reviewText: There was hair on the bathroom floor, it smelled slightly like sewage and there was hair on the extra blanket in the closet we wanted to put on the bed for more warmth. We called for new blankets and it took about 15 minutes to receive them. The staff was very polite but the hotel itself is terrible. We were on the 29 the floor and still were woke up by garbage trucks and the heater vent rattled the whole time the heat was on, and can hear everything in the surrounding rooms. Will not recommend this hotel or will ever stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: The cleanliness and insulation of the walls
review.locationRemarks: Great location, union square

review.title: Nice hotel, staff...not so nice
review.reviewText: We ended up having this hotel set us up at a different hotel because we were so disappointed with their staff. We ended up at the Westin nearby instead which was wonderful!
review.negativeRemarks: The decorative curtains in the rooms are made of an awful sharp metal and they scratch you. The actual shade got stuck every time we brought it down
review.locationRemarks: Location is great, close to downtown union square w/ lots of shopping and restaurants

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to write us a review! We are delighted you enjoyed our ideal location and our guest room. At Hyatt, we offer a list of amenities for guests to choose from and one of the selections is complimentary slippers. We apologize for the inconvenience caused at checked in. Your comment is truly appreciated and we hope to see you again in the near future!

review.title: Amazing location, great service and super clean!
review.reviewText:
We changed our mind at the last minute to stay at the Hyatt and boy was it a good decision! The rooms were very clean and comfortable (although complimentary slippers would have been a nicer touch). The buffet breakfast was pricey at $25pp (plus tax & tip) but it was quite delicious and had the best hotcakes I have ever tried!
The location could not have been more central - right by Union Square, the BART train, Macy's, the Christmas tree lights, countless shops etc. There's also a Thai restaurant across the street that is great for a quick and cheap eat, a Starbucks, a Walgreens on the other side of the block, a Chipotle two blocks away and a 24/7 parking complex opposite. The check-in counter was a little unconventional as they have self-check-in services which we were ushered to use but this ended up being counter-intuitive as soon as any minor customization is required beyond spitting out a room key. So we ended up back in the normal "speak to a human" queue after the self-check in because we wanted to know if there was another room available.

managementResponses.response: Wow! Thank you so much for your 5-star review. We are delighted you enjoyed your stay with us and took advantage of our ideal location. The public transportation in San Francisco is definitely one of the most easy and convenient to use. Chatting with the locals is the best way to explore all the fun and cool places in the Bay Area! Your recommendation is truly appreciated and we hope to see you come back again soon!

review.title: Close to Shopping!
review.reviewText: This was my first visit to San Fran and absolutely loved it!!!! The hotel stay was wonderful. Beautiful views from my room. Close to all different types of shops and restaurants, which were walking distance. Very easy to get around with their public transportation. I took their bus transportation to Golden Gate Bridge and the Cliff House. And let me tell you, The Cliff House views were breathtaking! Hopped on the trolley to Fisherman's Wharf. Everywhere you went the scenery was amazing. The people in San Fran were friendly and eager to help you. I ran down the Marina towards Golden Gate and a gentleman who lived there his whole life was helpful to lead me to some cool places to check out. I would definitely go back and would love to stay again at the Grand Hyatt. It was just the perfect spot! The Grand Hyatt made my stay in San Fran much more pleasurable. I would definitely recommend this place to all friends and family who are planning to visit.
review.positiveRemarks: The proximity to shops, restaurants, trolley, bars, etc.
review.locationRemarks: You can take their public transportation everywhere! So easy to understand, and the people are eager to help you find your way.

review.title: Grand Hyatt San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice hotel located in Union Square. Staff was pleasant and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great to get around San Francisco
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is a good location with easy access to downtown attractions, convention center, Market St, etc.

review.title: Location...
review.reviewText: Great view in the room, great location and we loved the purified room. We didn't care for the parking situation. My advice is spring for the valet service.
review.negativeRemarks: Bring back the Grandviews lounge.......I missed it.

review.title: Great location, nice hotel.
review.reviewText: We spend 5 nights at Grand Hyatt, beautiful hotel. Great service in excellent area. This was my first time in San Francisco and I loved it! Good places to eat walking distance as for some shopping!

review.title: Nice hotel, good staff
review.reviewText:
After staying in Marriot, Shereton and Hilton during my recent visit to NY, I decided to try out Hyatt in SF. I must say, my experience in Hyatt was the best among these 4 hotels.
This hotel is right in the union square - market is at a walking distance, public transport available just outside hotel. Staff is very nice. Free internet in room was awesome with great speed.
Overall, if I come again to SF, I will stay here.
review.locationRemarks: Market, shopping. Public transport.

review.title: Hyatt is always good

The Only bad experiencie were two Things: we were sleeping at 12 and they were vacoomimg the room in front, we understood but next morning at 9am they were vacoomimg again it was too noisy we wake up doing a big jump. And in the night at 1.30am we were sleeping cause next day we had our flight And someome put something trough our door doing lot of noise..it was the parking bill..... Weird, nice we fall sleep easy....we were tired.

review.title: Fantastic location - staff is top notch - the best

review.reviewText: The walls are paper thin at this hotel we could hear everything our next door neighbor was doing. I also cannot belief that they charged us $62.50 for overnight parking a night. It is ridiculous after paying more than $400 a night. Horrible deal!

review.title: Great modern hotel.
review.reviewText: We only stayed for 1 night, but the room was clean, modern and comfortable. Check in was quick and the staff was friendly. The view from our room on the 31st floor was spectacular overlooking the city with the bay in the background. We ate dinner at the restaurant in the hotel. The service was good, the food was avaege. I would definately stay again at this hotel.

review.title: CLEAN, GREAT LOCATION
review.reviewText:
Everything was great except check-in. At check-in they told us they didn't have a King bed with a Bay view which we had reserved months in advance. After a big hassle, we called Expedia, and suddenly they had a room with a Bay view and a King bed. Don't give up if this happens to you at any hotel.

Thank you, Expedia.
review.positiveRemarks: Very nice, clean, friendly staff, great concierge service
review.negativeRemarks: Reservation staff
review.locationRemarks: Great location, one block from the cable cars, two blocks from trolley to the wharf, great restaurants nearby, no need to rent a car

photos.caption: View from our room on the 14th floor.

review.title: All you need is $$.
review.reviewText:
The room was very comfortable and everything was great. There was a long list of items you could get if needed (anything from toothbrushes to shavers to coffee & condiments). Small items were at no extra charge.

What I found shocking was the price of meals. Breakfast for two cost us $60. While it was delicious, I was expecting to pay about half that for what we got. As a result, we ate elsewhere for the rest of our meals.

review.title: Great Location - Great Staff
review.reviewText:
We spent a quick night at the Grand Hyatt and would definitely stay there again.
The room was wonderful, bathroom beautiful and beds comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: It is right near the best shopping and easy to get to.

review.title: Thanks
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was clean and well-supplied with accessories. It would have been great to have a sheet under the comforter, which was lovely and fluffy but too warm for us northerners. And the bathroom door didn't close all the way; there was a gap at the side, plus it lit the room with the bathroom door closed; we would have liked the door to be solid instead of opaque. The elevators were fast and the room was quiet, with a great view. Thank you.
review.negativeRemarks: see above

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your review. Sounds like check in was a breeze and we are glad you found our location convenient and close to all shopping. We do want to apologize for the lack of comfort of our bed and the unwanted noise from the street. Your comment is much appreciated and we look forward to welcoming you back soon!

review.title: Fantastic staff.

review.title: Positively Impressed
review.reviewText: I stay in a fair number of hotels, so I'm rarely impressed. I must say that the staff was excellent. They clearly have some good training. Everything else was very good too. The hotel took the time to warn me about getting a cab to airport. It was the morning of half marathon, and streets were blocked off. AND BART strike.

review.title: Nice update

review.title: Nice facility, great location, clean & friendly...
review.reviewText: Overall the Grand Hyatt Union Square (Stockton St./San Fran) is a very good hotel. I was on a business trip and would stay here again. The staff is super attentive and my room was clean. It is in a good location- you can walk to local restaurants & shopping. Very small issues 1) my room had a slightly worn carpet and 2) ice machine on my floor was broken. When I informed the hotel staff that the ice machine was not working, they had it repaired within 4 hours!!! Why am I concerned with ice... I am into fitness and frequently need to ice down after working out. The Hyatt's fitness room was equipped with treadmills, LifeFitness machines and dumbbells up to 50 lbs. Although there is enough equipment to get a good workout, the fitness room is small & it gets over crowded if you go early. I opted for 24-Hour Fitness down the street- I paid daily for this. If you want a healthy meal, the Hyatt restaurant has a chicken & veggie dish that is devoid of sauce and cheese- a reasonable good & healthy meal for a hotel. I had a mini fridge in my room so I could bring in food and chill my shakes.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly, attentive, well trained and knowledgeable staff. Good location. Clean facilities & room. Option for free internet (a little slow but OK).
review.negativeRemarks: Small issues 1) my room had a slightly worn carpet & 2) ice machine on my floor was broken. They fixed the ice machine within 4 hours of notification!
review.locationRemarks: It is within walking to shopping & restaurants. 15 min walk (if you stride fast) to Moscone Convention Center. Super Target & movies 10 min walk.

review.title: Quick one night stay
review.reviewText: My wife and I were staying in the city for one night before heading off to Sonoma for a wedding. Our original room (bay view w/ 1 bed) wasn't available despite my having booked it weeks in advance. Thankfully we were upgraded at no charge to different room w/ a partial view and access to the club on the 32nd floor. Great bar/restaurant on the mezzanine and great views from our room.
review.positiveRemarks: Never had hardwood floors in a hotel before .. that was pretty cool.
review.negativeRemarks: The sliding bathroom door (at least in the one we were in, 3311) was kind of difficult to open if closed all the way. Almost got stuck a few times.
review.locationRemarks: SF isn't that big .. everything is nearby. Just pop downstairs and grab a cab and your set. (Biggest Nordstrom I've ever seen is nearby)

managementResponses.response: Thanks so much for the 5-star review! We are thrilled you had such a great experience! I must agree with you our convenient location is ideal for both business and pleasure. Your compliment is truly appreciated and we sure look forward to welcoming you back soon!

review.title: My favorite hotel in San Francisco!

review.title: Great hotel in union square!
review.reviewText: Everything was great! We especially loved the club level experience with wonderful service from David. He made our nightly cocktails, snacks and desserts special.
review.locationRemarks: Great access to cable cars, unions square and muni. No cabs needed for any part of our trip and we dined in various neighborhoods during our stay.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: My son and I were on a business trip with this hotel being the last hotel on our excusion. We got a room on the 30th floor facing San Francisco. It was quite a view. The room was well appointed with a modern bathroom that had a very unusual sink. The staff couldn't have been nicer. They went out of their way to make our visit very nice. The restaurants were very enjoyable partcularly the lounge with the gorgeous bar. I have to say that the Old Fashioned I had was one of the best ever! I would definately come back to this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The room, the bar/lounge, the service, the location in Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing that was odd was the sliding door for the bathroom. There was a 2" gap. It didn't feel very private.

review.title: Hotel in the heart of shopping and food.
review.reviewText: Had a great time on our 25th anniversary trip. Well worth it.
review.positiveRemarks: Newly renovated and modern rooms. Great view of Union Square.
review.locationRemarks: San Fransisco is a "walking " city. Wherever you go there is something to do. It is truely a diverse city.

review.title: San Francisco Vacation
review.reviewText:
Hotel was as good as it gets. Staff was
the best-always there with genuine concern
to help way they could. You pay a "royal"
price & it's worth every penny because
they treat you like royalty. We loved it!

review.title: Perfect Location at Union Square
review.reviewText: Big double Queen bed room on 29th floor. Beautiful view of Union Square. Everything needed in Walking distance. Not used facilities or Restaurant.

review.title: Grand hyatt
review.reviewText: Paid for a bayview room and got a view of adjacent builing and a parking garage. I understand they cant all be bayview rooms but if it doesnt have one than dont sell it as one and charge extra.. Other than that, its what youd expect at a Hyatt.. Check in was kinda weird with no desk just a bunch of computer keiosks. Took a while to get checked in and out..

review.title: Close to shopping and mini access!

review.title: San Francisco Visit
review.reviewText: Good Hotel, logistic access to city main centre is good

review.title: Okay hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: The overall stay was okay. It was difficult at first to find self-parking as there were no signs. However, the valet people quickly helped direct us to the proper direction. They were a delight. In contrast, the receptionist was okay. We weren't greeted very well and in no way navigated to our room. (e.g. take the elevator to floor etcetera....). The bathroom was a bit small, towels felt old, and our bed creaked on one side. If it wasn't for the nice valet people, I am not sure if I would've liked this stay as much.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service.
review.locationRemarks: There is plenty of shopping and eating places nearby.

review.title: Nice hotel

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Hotel in a great location. Very good staff. Highly recommended

review.title: Nice hotel close to many attractions.
review.reviewText: It was a Very good experience. The hotel was fantastic they have provided all our needs for a good stay. The interior design of the hotel was very modern and I enjoyed it. The breakfast buffet was good and very clean. It was kids friendly, our kids liked it very much. I wish they had a swimming pool though, this is the only thing we missed. One more thing the parking in front of the hotel, to check in and get our bags in and out was not convenient, there was not enough space for the cars that were coming in and out, although the valet people try to do their best to keep this under control but that space it too limited for the traffic that was coming and going. The good thing is the hotel is with in walking distance to many attractions, restaurants, stores, transportation needs and a block away from the union square. Overall it was a very good experience and I would definitely use this hotel again.
review.negativeRemarks: The way they print their bills... it is not clear or detailed.

review.title: FABULOUS
review.reviewText: I CAN'T EVEN BEGIN TO EXPLAIN HOW WONDERFUL MY STAY WAS AT THIS HOTEL, FROM THE ROOM, FOOD AND SERVICE IMPECCABLE.
review.negativeRemarks: NOTHING
review.locationRemarks: WELL WHEN YOUR IN SAN FRANCISCO, YOU NEVER RUN OUT OF THINGS TO DO.

review.title: Get what you pay for.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, I was looking for a cheaper one in the city but was not dissapointed for paying a little extra. Everything was very comfortable and clean.

review.title: FIVE STARS!
review.reviewText: Clean rooms, well lit bathroom, comfortable beds, plenty of USB outlets to charge phones/gadgets. Check in was fast. All staff helpful.

review.title: Great Hotel In The Heart Of Union Square
review.reviewText: Can't Beat The Hyatt Brand Hotels. Very Clean and comfortable rooms, very nice staff that have your best interest in mind. The door man gave us bits of advise that saved us a few dollars and time getting to the ballpark....... Sounds minor but it shows the quality of people working at this hotel. We will make it a priority to stay hear again on the next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Great hotel in a great central location
review.reviewText: Great hotel, pleasant helpful staff. Cable cars are around the corner, in the middle of tons of shopping, and only a mile or so from AT&T park. Fishermans wharf easily accessed by cable cars or tour buses that boarded at union square next door. Fitness center had plenty of great equipment and an awesome view while you worked out. Can't say enough good stuff, we will definitely stay here on our return.
review.positiveRemarks: Extremely helpful and professional staff goes above and beyond
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant could have more selections

review.title: central location

review.negativeRemarks: none

review.title: Nice at first glance but issues lurk below surface
review.reviewText:
Rooms looked nice but special feature in the toilets leave a noisy, constant water running/flush noise. Water pressure was terrible and the sinks looked modern but the functional space was limited. Easy to see the maids did not regularly wash the floor in the bathroom. The a/c was very noisy and there were a lot of "mechanical" noises throughout the evening. Very hard to sleep comfortably.

The other amenities were very cheap - in-room coffee maker was a small, single cup that was very cheap and for all the money spent on the room, I would have expected liquid creamer, not powdered. They didn't even offer free coffee downstairs, instead it was more expensive than the Starbucks across the street.

Finally, upon checking out, they never once asked me how my stay was. In fact, they overcharged me for an extra breakfast buffet even after the girl told me I would only be charged for one. Had I not looked at the math, they would have overcharged me by more than $30. When I told then girl I was disappointed she never even asked how my stay was and listed my complaints she really didn't have an answer. No offer to make amends, comp me anything or offer any kind of coupon for a future stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was great - right in the heart of downtown.
review.negativeRemarks: See above comments
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, shopping, Fisherman's Wharf and the Embarcadero area by the Piers.

review.title: Very nice hotel well located with excellent servic
review.reviewText:
Stayed at the Fremont and moved to the Hyatt due to my paying for the hotel myself. The location of the hotel is excellent near all the shops and good restaurants. Excellent service and attention from all the staff.
Will go back and recommend this hotel as outstanding.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location, helpful staff and nice hotel. I would definitely stay there again

review.title: Fantastic prime location in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
A disappointing start at this hotel due to our room being dusty upon our arrival, turned into a very pleasant stay after they made efforts to clean up our room after our request. Breakfast was excellent every day (of course we chose pancakes every day!) and a lovely bayside view (worth asking for when you book). The location was absolutely superb, easy to get to from the airport via BART and 1 minute walking distance to many of the local MUNI transport you need to get around San Francisco.
Staff were very friendly and welcoming. We would and plan to stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaniness
review.locationRemarks: Excellent, very central

review.title: Wonderful Location!!!!
review.reviewText:
The location was great. There were always staff in the lobby for assistance.
Everyone was very kind and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks:
The only discomfort was the furniture in the lobby area. The sofas and chairs were so
low, (I know that is a contemporary style.) Hard for oldsters.

review.title: Great location and Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: Early check-in was very much appreciated and convenient.

review.title: Nicely updated.
review.reviewText:
Great location, near public transport, restaurants and entertainment. Hotel is clean, modern and recently updated. Beds are very nice, rooms are bright and air conditioned.
Doors to bathroom are sliding doors and do not close off completely, resulting in quite a large air gap. Which leaves privacy a bit to desire. Therefore rooms are not recommended for sharing with colleges or others not closely related.
Rooms get surprisingly amounts of street noise. For a modern hotel with double pane windows more isolation would be expected. Opt for higher floors, if possible.
review.positiveRemarks: Fast elevators, efficient, clean. Pleasant atmosphere.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom doors, street noise isolation.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, everything is nearby or easy to reach with public transportation.

review.title: Company Meeting / Family Weekend Trip
review.reviewText: My family loves to visit SF when we get the chance. This past weekend offered the opportunity to attend a company business function and bring my family along to enjoy the weekend running around China Town, North Beach, Union Square and the Ferry Building Marketplace. We really enjoyed our hotel stay and the weather was perfect. The Grand Hyatt is located smack in the middle of Union Sqare and offers great access to all of the locations mentioned. The rooms are nice and the staff is great. The hotel location makes it easy to get around town without a car because you can easily walk or take advantage of all the public transportaion options. Curbside Cab or Private Car fares to and from SFO are reasonable and a Major BART Station is only a quick walk away.
review.positiveRemarks: the hotel is perfectly located in the middle of Union Square which offers great access for short or long term visits. Rooms are comfortable and clean
review.negativeRemarks: Slightly larger mini fride for longer than 3 day stays, especially for families.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for everything. Central to China Town, North Beach, Union Square and Market. Close to shopping, dining, touring, markets & night life.

review.title: super nice hotel

review.reviewText: Please pass on to the Hyatt that the way they have arranged registration/check-in is offputting. The computer check-in islands remind me of the self-checkin at airports. It's too familiar for this type of Grand Hotel. However, the warm interactive check-in receptionist made up for the initial impression. There is a line no matter what system is used and demands a lobby receptionist to explain the process.

review.title: Just average
review.reviewText:
Everything about this place is depressingly average, from the surly welcome, to the lobby that is devoid of atmosphere, to breakfast, to the fittings in the room (for a newly renovated place, everything is very Holiday Inn circa 1995...) etc etc.

Oh, and dont bother booking a package including breakfast - it took three requests for the hotel to acknowledge it was in my package, and the restaurant is way too small given the size of the hotel. And the food is 3-star buffet quality.

There are plenty of other choices in the city, so I wont be rushing back...

The rooms are lovely, it's located right on Union Square so all of the major stores are within close proximity. Transport is close by. The service is impressive, everyone is so helpful from check in staff, to bell boys, doormen, housekeeping, room service. I could not fault my stay.

review.title: Great business hotel

review.title: Location location location
review.reviewText:
Excellent location, walking distance to Chinatown, and shopping areas. As we didn't have a car, the central location was definitely a big plus.
All the staff were friendly and helpful.
The room was adequate, the lighting were not great, I found it too dark. We could hear the next door guests talking as our room had a wooden door connected to the next room. Fortunately it only happened in the first night, all was quiet the next two nights. Our double bed was too soft, it sank towards the middle.
It was good to have complimentary ice and filtered water in a room along the corridor.
review.negativeRemarks: The lighting in the room and the soft bed
review.locationRemarks: Next to Union Square on one side, and Chinatown on the other side

review.title: Hotel's in good condition, service could be better
review.reviewText: Quality of hotel is relatively good for San Francisco (where service and upkeep of hotels isn't generally great). Room is well furnished and modern. Service was a bit lacking though. My room originally didn't have shampoo or soap when I first arrived and I really wanted to take a shower after a long trip. I called the front desk to get this but didn't have it delivered for almost an hour. The house keeping staff was texting on his phone while he brought me the shampoo and soap, definitely not a sign of great service.
review.negativeRemarks: Service was disappointing
review.locationRemarks: Location is around union square, should be fine for tourists.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: Have been coming to SF annually for the past 5 years and this is my new favorite place to stay. Everything is remodeled, new, and clean, clean, clean which I really appreciate because with all the traffic that comes through SF hotels things can look worn down rather easily. If you can, try their club level for just a bit more-breakfast, drinks, snacks--very convenient with kids. Friendly and helpful staff. Nakita at the front desk was very sweet and accomodating when the expedia agent booked the wrong room for us. Great views of the bay. For the price, I prefer this hotel over Ritz-Carlton club level. I would recommend this hotel and will definitely be returning!
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is pricey but average rate for all SF hotels. Save $20 and choose self- park over hotel valet.
review.locationRemarks: Can't get any better than this.

review.title: Grand Hyatt makes for a Grand Trip
review.reviewText: The Grand Hyatt was superb. The perfect location, great room at an affordable price, and terrific service. You couldn't ask for more!
review.positiveRemarks: The bath amenities. They were fabulous! What a wonderful finishing touch
review.negativeRemarks: The uniforms of the workers.
review.locationRemarks: Perfection. Just a block up from Union Station and all the action!
