review.title: great location
review.reviewText: The location is great. It is in the middle of downtown. If you stay here for any amount of time you really don't need a car. The rooms are very nice and updated. The hotel is very nice, quiet, and the staff is helpful. Overall it was a very nice stay.
review.negativeRemarks: pay for parking
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Great location and finally free Wi-Fi!
review.reviewText:
Our room was very modern and clean. We especially appreciated the motorized roll-down screen for the window; it made sleeping-in much easier!

The concierge was very knowledgable with regard to the buses and trains we would need to get us in and around San Francisco (and also areas to avoid). The location is perfect! One block away from Union Square and all the shopping centres.

We are also glad to see more North American hotels offering complimentary Wi-Fi... very helpful for researching places to see or restaurants to dine at.

Our only complaint would be that our room was situated by the ice machine so, when booking or checking in, we recommend requesting a room away from it.
review.positiveRemarks: Room size was very good, modern bathroom, great view and friendly concierge and helpful staff! Oh, and free Wi-Fi!
review.negativeRemarks: Proximity of the ice machine to our particular room.
review.locationRemarks: One block away from Union Square - perfect for shopping excursions! Also one block away from a street-car stop.

photos.caption: Beautiful view of the city and the ocean

review.title: Perfect play to stay for a night out on the town!
review.reviewText:
The staff was awesome and our stay was fantastic!
Your walking distance from tons 5 star resteraunt's and shopping!
The valet parking was great! No problem getting a taxi!

review.title: Look No Further than this Hotel
review.reviewText:
Completely refurbished hotel right on Union Square. It was spotlessly clean and tastefully decorated, excellent staff who could not have been more helpful. Perfect in every way.

It took us a while to pick a Hotel for our holiday and we are so pleased we decided on this one. Some of the others we had looked at looked tired and grubby by comparison and also not in such good areas.

There was nothing we could fault in this Hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: 2 minute walk to Union Square

review.title: Wonderful hotel!
review.reviewText: Fabulous hotel in a superb location. Gorgeously redone with pan-asian decor, sleek modern finishes, very comfortable bed and pillows. Dined in OneUp restaurant and my husband remarked that it was the best salmon he has ever had in his life! Staff were pleasant,courteous,enthusiastic and helpful. I highly recommend staying at this hotel.

review.title: Location! Location!
review.reviewText:
A great hotel in a SUPERB location - just a few steps from Union Square where there are plenty of restaurants, bars, diners and high-end shops to choose from.
Our rooms were impressive with two double beds, elegant bathroom and a convenient step-in bath/shower.
Unfortunately, the 36th floor restaurant was closed for renovation when we were there, but there was a perfectly adequate coffee shop on the mezzanine floor. There was aIso a lively bar, where my daughter worked her way through the cocktail menu during our stay! All the hotel staff were very helpful and polite - the receptionist even let me check in for our flight from her computer.
The only niggle I had was that, although we were on the 16th floor, the traffic noise was intrusive in the early hours and the aircon was quite noisy.
review.negativeRemarks: Poor soundproofing of the room windows.
review.locationRemarks: Great - 50 yards from Union Square

review.title: Clean, bright, safe, as expected of a Hyatt.
review.reviewText: Extremely clean and bright after the recent renovations. Great location, safe and we travelled as 2 single ladies. Both of us have allergies and they did not act up at all in the hotel. Rooms are a little small, but we spent very little time in the rooms so that was ok.

review.title: Union Square
review.reviewText: The room was spacious and had amenities which were useful. I would recommend parking in the self-parking garage. The vallet is $55 per day.
review.negativeRemarks: The vallet parking
review.locationRemarks: Great central location.

review.title: Above average
review.reviewText: Staff was outstanding, our room was on 14th floor and wind was entering through gap in sliding door. Hotel is in a great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Wind getting in through sliding door.
review.locationRemarks: Heart of Union square.

review.title: Nice place to visit.

review.title: From the moment we arrived we felt important.
review.reviewText: We had a great experience at the Grand Hyatt. We went for a surprise birthday gift for my daughter. The Concierge helped us get a GREAT table at an impossible to get restaurant and helped arrange for chocolates to be put in our room for her arrival. From the moment we arrived everyone was amazing and thoughtful. The front desk staff was so sweet and they even remembered our names. The view from the room was great and the new rooms are very stylish. Thanks for a great weekend!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff is very kind and thoughtful. The rooms are great.
review.negativeRemarks: I wish there was a comforter on the bed - it was a bit cold.

Friendly staff.

review.locationRemarks: Just off Union Square, very handy for all transport links

review.title: nice place to stay
review.reviewText:
nice rooms, lobby is so so that's all

the hotel is nice but this survey is horrible.

review.title: Great location and everything you need!
review.reviewText: Awesome location and amazing room. We were on 24th floor with a beautiful view. The staff were very nice and the hotel is clean, very well kept. We went to the bar there. Great drinks but very pricey!
review.negativeRemarks: Drinks pricey in bar
review.locationRemarks: Amazing location!!

review.title: Our stay
review.reviewText: We had a problem with a squeaking air conditioner when motor came on, hotel staff happy to move us to new room.

review.title: Best nights sleep we had while in the USA
review.reviewText:
Great location and super comfy beds, free wifi throughout the hotel and carparking across the street make this a great spot in the middle of San Fran. Appeared to be newly renovated - clean, tidy and modern in appearance with a free in-house gym.
They also offer a town car service to the airport for a fixed price that's not much more than a taxi
review.positiveRemarks: The beds are big and very comfortable for sleeping after a long flight
review.negativeRemarks: Shower over bath, just because we prefer a separate shower but it was still a good shower
review.locationRemarks: Handy location to car parking, Union Square and all that SF has to offer.

review.title: Last minute decision - no regrets!
review.reviewText: Outstanding following recent renovations. Would absolutely stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Slow (but complementary) wi-fi
review.locationRemarks: Amazing - right in the Union square

review.title: I recommend you stay on the higher floor.
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the room on 11th floor, and the view from the room was worse than I expected although the comments of this hotel say that the views from any rooms are great.
And, the restaurant on the 36th floor was already closed.

review.title: Comfort and luxury in a superb location
review.reviewText: Comfort and luxury in a superb location. I'm still savoring the feel of the soft cotton sheets and the fluffy down comforters. And our room, on the 21st floor, had a fantastic view of the city, starting with Union Square directly below us. Austere but appealing, slightly Asian design throughout.

review.title: For couples & business travelers
review.reviewText: Stayed in a bay view room on the 24th floor, nice view and worth the extra cost. Room was adequate for a couple on a 3 night stay, bathroom on the small side, and a double sink would have been nice. Location was great as we were easily able to walk to Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf, and of course in and around Union Square. Kudos to the staff that comp'd us with a dinner for not having our room ready by check in time. Had to wait an extra 30 minutes, but the gesture made us feel that our inconvenience was not overlooked. Would stay here again.

review.title: wonderful hotel with great views
review.reviewText: Very clean and the staff were wonderful. No real complaints, world definitely be back. Super convenient to everything.

review.title: Very nice weekend stay.
review.reviewText: A very pleasant hotel in San Fran. Modern decoration and friendly staff. I would stay again.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is recently renovated. Really nice and close to Union square, staff is very friendly, rooms are clean and comfortable
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were really comfortable and rooms are really nice
review.negativeRemarks: The wait for an elevator took a long time.

review.title: One Up Not Up To Snuff
review.reviewText: We have stayed at this hotel several times for our annual Christmas shopping weekend in the city, but not since it had been remodeled. We were upgraded without even asking to a room with a better view, which was nice. The decor was generally comfortable, but we prefer a firmer mattress. One of the features of the hotel prior to the remodel that we especially enjoyed was One Up, the bar on the top floor with spectacular views of the city. Sadly, the bar has been relocated to the mezzanine. This change will factor into future decisions about where we stay in San Franciso. Still, a nice conveniently located hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Relocation of One Up bar following remodel

review.title: Huge Disappointment
review.reviewText:
I have been staying at this and other Hyatt for years. This has always been one of my favorite hotels with it's fantastic location and views. That's why I was so very disappointed to find that they have done away with the front desk! Yes, no front desk. There were randomly placed laptops with staff milling around. To check in we were told to stand here, at random spot in the lobby area until we were called. Who thought of this, a seventeen year old? Is it an I Phone store? It didn't feel luxurious at all.
There were also food trays left in the hallway with half eaten food all day and night. Gross to look at. The Grandview restaurant was closed as well. All so disappointing.

review.title: Required
review.reviewText: we stay there at that time was rain & windy a lot noise in the room,we were not slept well all 3 night . We got 4 persons stay in the room included 2 kids,I suggest 2 double beds were too small these day at lease 2 queens will be better but the rooms was too small,Only suite for 2 persons stay.Just big disappointment other than that the service was good.
review.locationRemarks: perfact

review.title: EXCELLENT PLACE ALL AROUND!
review.reviewText:
we have stayed i a lot of hotels, but this one has surpassed all others. Everyone was helpful, welcoming and friendly.
It is evident that management puts a lot of enphasis in customer service.

WE WOULD DEFINETLY STAY HERE AGAIN.!

THANKS EXPEDIA FOR THE EXCELLETN DEAL YOU GOT US!

review.title: Great hotel and would stay again!!
review.reviewText: This hotel was renovated and looks fantastic. The service was excellent and the restaurant was very nice. I would definitely stay there again!!

review.title: Thanksgiving in SF - Nov 21 to 25, 2012
review.reviewText: We stayed here last year in October, and, this year, we were quite impressed with all the renovations that are now complete. The check-in area is inviting and open, and the staff were very friendly. We had a great view of the financial district from the 25th floor, and everything in our room was immaculate. The Grand Hyatt is central to absolutely everything ... short walks to Chinatown, to shopping and to many restaurants ... plus there are 2 Starbucks in the vicinity. Very convenient for us coffee addicts! When we requested for some items to be replenished in the room, they were promptly brought up to us. We appreciated that there was a water dispenser (hot and cold) by the ice machine, as we do not remember that being there last year (better for the environment than us buying bottled water). We had a wonderful thanksgiving with our cousins, and a wonderful, comfortable stay in downtown San Francisco! We will come again to SF and most likely will stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: Location! 5 star hotel within walking distance to so many places.
review.negativeRemarks: Any chance of the room coffee changing to Starbucks???? That would be the best!
review.locationRemarks: Nothing beats the central location of the Grand Hyatt! It was great to be able to walk everywhere!

review.title: Great!! City view room on the 28th floor is FTW
review.reviewText: From the very start we were impressed with the hotel. Very modern look and feel. Went right to OneUp and had a few drinks. During this time we were staying at the Hilton in the Finansual district (which we were not too happy with and will not stay there again) after we finished our drinks we made plans to move to the Hyatt the very next day and complete our San Francisco stay in a hotel that seemed to offer a level of luxury set higher then what we were currently dealing with. I drive a yellow 350z show car that is heavily modded. The valet took extra care of the car and everyone at the hotel was extra friendly. Giving this the best hotel experience I have had in a LONG TIME. I will for sure stay again. The Hilton will never see us again lol
review.positiveRemarks: The room was amazing and decorated with a modern touch of style
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing at all
review.locationRemarks: Right near union and a short walk from West Field mall

review.title: Veterans day weekend
review.reviewText: Great. Friendly Staff. Amazing location. Near many amazing sights.
review.negativeRemarks: Maintenance being done at 8 am.
review.locationRemarks: Amazing

review.title: Nice hotel in a great location
review.reviewText:
Nicely renovated rooms and great location. Friendly and well-trained staff.

Soundproofing could be better though, and I had an impression that the hotel had more rooms with twin beds than with king beds.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location, well-trained staff, spacious, newly-renovated rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Poor soundproofing

review.title: great location !
review.reviewText: traveling with my wife. excellent room, breakfast & Location!!

review.title: Not the best hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel was under construction, but I was never told that. The staff was so UNFRIENDLY I couldn't believe it. Every time I would ask a question I felt like I was putting them out.
The room needs to be updated. The window lock was broken, the housekeeping wasn't the best.
I think other hotels are a better value for your money.
review.negativeRemarks: The Staff
review.locationRemarks: Great location, right at Union Square. Close to shopping and restaurants

review.title: Our visit to San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was under construction but, they still took care of us very well. The rooms were newly finished and very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: The shower head was too close to the wall. It was not easy to get wet while taking a shower unless you held the nozzle over your head.
review.locationRemarks: The location was perfect. We were within walking distance of great restaurants and shopping.

review.title: "Great location for shopping"
review.reviewText: It is going under construction so it was cold and dusty in the lobby. There is parking across the street, but due to so much construction around those streets that it got really confusing where to park. We had to pay $39, it would be better if there was some validated parking for hotel patrons. The room was beautiful, clean, and it had all the enemities. The buffet dinner was delicious, great in price, and a great view.
review.positiveRemarks: My favorite was the spacious room and the night time view.
review.negativeRemarks: The construction in the hotel and all the blocked streets causing lots of traffic.
review.locationRemarks: It is located right in the center of all the shops, so as you walk out everything is within walking distance.

review.title: Great location, poor communication.
review.reviewText:
We arrived at around 11:30, which was too early to check in so the hotel looked after our bags and we hit the streets for lunch and sight-seeing. They were going to call when our room was available, but we returned around 2:00 (with no phone call) to find that our room was ready (good timing?). We were on the 26th floor, with a spectacular view across the bay, including Alcatraz.
Our room had 2 double beds because there were no king rooms available. I had requested one bed in my reservation, however I understand that requests can't always be fulfilled. So we squeezed into one double bed - bit of a change after king beds!!
The room was overall clean and in good condition, however there was a bandaid stuck to the floor in the bathroom. It was in a hard to notice spot (I just happened to see it), and it was gone after our next room clean.
Location-wise, this hotel is in a brilliant position, within very close proximity to shopping, food, cable cars and buses. Couldn't have asked for a better spot.
We stayed for three nights, and didn't realise until after we had checked-out that breakfast was included in the price we had paid. I would have thought that the check-in staff would have mentioned that to us, and pointed out the location of the restaurant,which they did not. When our bags were brought to our room, that staff member mentioned that the view from the restaurant on the 36th floor was amazing. This is the only reason we knew where the restaurant was.
review.positiveRemarks: Wonderful location, close to Union Square shops and Market St public transport.
review.negativeRemarks: Check-in staff weren't very helpful and didn't remind us that breakfast was included in our tarriff, two double beds weren't ideal.
review.locationRemarks: Very central location.

review.title: Snap Holiday
review.reviewText: Receptio staff were all first class, very impressive and the check in and check out seemless
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast restaurant moving from the 36 floor to the 2nd floor
review.locationRemarks: great central location

review.title: Great hotel in Union Square.
review.reviewText: LOVED this hotel! Everyone that worked there was so friendly and helpful. I wasn't that impressed with their hotel restaurant. Great location and views. I would definitely go back.

review.title: Very central hotel.
review.reviewText: This hotel provided everything we needed for our first stay in San Francisco and all staff were very helpful. We received excellent help from the concierge desk ( airport transfer was arranged quickly and efficiently, advised about city tours and about printing boarding passes). As this was a very busy weekend in the city, the dining room was very, very busy on Sun morning but all went quite well considering the challenge.
review.positiveRemarks: Ease of access to the city, wonderful views, friendly staff
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location

review.title: Great downtown hotel.
review.reviewText: They have a great breakfast on the 36th floor with an amazing view overlooking the city. The rooms have just been updated, but the lobby is still under construction.

review.title: Friendly and helpful
review.reviewText: Hotel rooms were slightly smaller than expected but still roomy enough for friends to meet up and go out. Very clean rooms. Staff was friendly and helpful even though it was a crazy hectic weekend with fleet week, the failing regatta and all the sports games. Also helped that they treated my group with respect, we are in our early 20s and there for a birthday but no sobbiness or condescending tones were used, which was so nice! Only complaint was the crowdedness of the lobby, but thats due to construction. Great location and can't wait to stay there again once the lobby is finished!
review.locationRemarks: Close enough to Union square for walking to activities and restaurants, but far enough away that you don't feel like you're stuck in the middle of it!

review.title: Birthday weekend
review.reviewText: We stayed here last weekend for my birthday. Very comfortable hotel. I only had one complaint. We paid for a city view room and the shade was broken so we couldn't enjoy the view. Reported it and no one ever came to fix it. Overall good experience though.

review.title: lovely modern hotel on union square
review.reviewText: Lovely modern hotel (partially still being completed) right on union square. short stroll to the cable car to fishermans warf. Great rooftop bar and restaurant although the queue for breakfast on Sunday can be a but long. Friendly staff and squeaky clean.. Overall very happy and would definitely recommend to others.

review.title: Great stay if you want a well located hotel.
review.reviewText:
Great Hotel and Comfortable Stay.
Has good gym and exercise equipment.
View from restaurant is fantastic.
Need to work on access as you are dropped fron Taxis and you have to goa around the hotel from the outside.
I was in 10th floor and could here all the noise on the street. Could hve better noise reducing technology.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise outside
review.locationRemarks: Great location in Union Square

review.title: Fantastic place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The room and location were excellent. The only complaint I had was the breakfast, which was complimentary to guests. Just about all of the food was cool, if not, cold. We didn't return for any more breakfasts during our stay.
Otherwise, a great place and I wouldn't hesitate to return.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything. Subway, trams, cablecars, etc.

review.title: Great for travelling
review.reviewText: Under going construction otherwise great hotel rooms are a little smaller than the parc 55, view and service from top restaurant excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Construction
review.locationRemarks: Excellent, shopping, muni,Bart, trolleys,

review.title: Good position; check on construction progress.
review.reviewText: had not been warned of major construction of lobby and no rest open on sunday evg!

review.title: Great overall experience
review.reviewText: Great experience overall. My only complaint is that noise on the street was audible from the 11th floor where my room was.

review.title: Lovely building, location, restaurant, top service
review.reviewText: We went to SF for a conference and vacation and the Grand Hyatt Union Square exceeded our expectations. Super-clean and lovely decor (the books in the room and the lobby are a welcoming extra). The location is perfectly situated for our meetings and for shopping in our free time. The restaurant is unmatched - beautiful panoramic views of the city, the Golden Gate Bridge, and the bay, lovely decor, and not priced out of competition; we enjoyed not only breakfast but the lounge and dinner. Above all these wonderful and positive experiences is the service at this hotel. Every single staff member we met up with, from room service to the concierge, to the restaurant staff, to the valets, was more than knowledgeable and friendly - each one extended themselves to be friendly, warm, and do everything they could to take care of our needs. We were exceedingly impressed.
review.positiveRemarks: The Grandviews restaurant - great food, great service, incomparable views!
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing I was unhappy about was having to pay for Internet and not getting great connectivity.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco Union Square is vibrant with wonderful shopping, and it's not far to beautiful wine country. The concierges are super-helpful.

review.title: Birthday Weekend Away
review.reviewText: The hotel is currently going thru some renovations so the lobby is tough to find and a little akward at check-in. We stayed on the 34th floor with awesome views of the bridge and the city. Service was amazing all around it started with check-in extended to room service and the staff in the restaurant on the 36th floor was wonderful. Kudos to everyone! Celebrating a birthday there was perfect and the highlight of the stay....watching the shuttle Endeavor fly by!! We couldn't have asked for more!! Thanks and we'll be back!

review.title: Good location, great view.
review.reviewText: we stopped in San fran for a few days, the hotel was being renovated but the rooms were already finished. Great city views over breakfast (when its not foggy that is :) ) and the staff were very helpful. Take advantage of the concierge for chinatown resteraunt options!!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Had a wonderful stay here.Great central location to access all San Francisco has to offer.
My only tiny complaint would be ,we had a room with two double beds for my family.It would have been a more comfortable stay with Queen beds.The double was just a bit small for me and my husband of 6ft.Apart from that,perfect!We were on the 20th floor with good views.The views were fantastic from the restaurant and bar on the 36th floor.Parking was adjacent to the hotel and 36dollars per night.Expensive but going rate for city hotel parking.With breakfast included at 25dollars each a day,we felt it was worth it.Breakfast was great!
review.negativeRemarks: Small double beds
review.locationRemarks: Central and perfect

review.title: New but disappointing.
review.reviewText: There was not enough staff or should I say the staff was not prepared on welcoming guests during renovation and giving directions on entering the hotel. Very poor execution at valet and no doormen upon entering the hotel. Bringing in luggage and trying to open heavy doors was a nuisance. No sitting area in lobby or at valet while waiting for car or taxi. I really did not care for the contemporay design of the rooms. bath & shower were small and the shower head should have been designed to flow from ceiling. Understanding the hotel was under renovation but the welcome & warmth was missing from my other trips.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great

review.title: A great 3-day trip.
review.reviewText:
A thoroughly enjoyable stay. Rooms were great - clean and comfortable. Electric shades to block out morning sun was so much easier to use than manual ones found in most hotels. Bathroom was clean and well-appointed.

Food was top quality. Excellent variety for buffet breakfast. Clam chowder at dinner was of highest quality.

The bargain of the third day free made the stay a real bargain. The $25 breakfast per person included in the cost of the room was a surprise bonus.

Made the trip extra special.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to shopping, Chinatown and the cable car to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Poor customer service
review.reviewText: Hotel in good location, overall poor customer service however.

review.title: Best hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: This hotel is worth the price, location is perfect and rooms are brand new.
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby under renovation
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: the staff were extemely curtious. The room was immaculate and comfortable. The city view was as promised.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
Very Nice location for tourist
Close to restaurants And shops
Room are not too big but clean and design
Service is very good and everybody very kind
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby(it was on fixing)
review.locationRemarks: Very good

review.title: Perfect hotel in SF
review.reviewText: New, clean, nicely designed rooms. Will stay here everytime in SF.

review.title: Great hotel for our SF Honeymoon
review.reviewText: My wife and I recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt on our honeymoon in San Francisco. The room was awesome and the staff was great. The room was well appointed with all of the amenities. It is ideally located as a launching point for trips to Coit Tower near Washington Square, Fisherman's Wharf, the Orpheum and many more attractions. The restaurant and lounge on the 36th floor provides great views of the city and bay as you get ready for your day. Definitely would recommend this hotel to anyone.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location. Comfy bed. Luxurious stay.
review.negativeRemarks: I would replace the shower heads. They don't spray out into the shower very far.
review.locationRemarks: Great location and launching point for all areas of the city.

review.title: Left Disappointed....
review.reviewText: I was somewhat disappointed by the dark atmoshpere. The lobby is small and very uninviting. The view was left to be desired and we paid extra for a view. The location was good but again updates are needed to feel comfortable. Biggest plus was price, but then again I guess you get what you pay for.

review.title: Nice Hotel, Good Location
review.reviewText: Overall hotel was very nice and in a good location and new refurbished. Top floor offered great view of city and food was decent. Gym was also ok. However, a few shortcuts prevented this hotel from being superb given its price level. 1) Being in the city, the room was somewhat noisy as the main window was a door style and not fully sealed or double glass and loud trucks and garbage collectors could be heard early in the a.m., 2) the door to the bathroom is a sliding door and there is a large gap at one end that also reduced privacy in the bathroom, and 3) Staff friendly but not of the level of a 5 star hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise in room and from bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Very central and convenient

review.title: Great 1 night experience
review.reviewText: Only there for a night but hotel staff did an excellent job. Recommendation of concierge for dinner was great. Rooms were recently updated and had a very modern feel. Lobby is still being worked on but was still adequate.

review.title: Superb . . . but . . .
review.reviewText:
The registration went smoothly and courteously. Everything was nice and clean, the room was quality and quiet (30th floor - city view).
The only disappointment was the bathroom counter. I'm not sure why this seems to be a trend, but who doesn't need counter space, even when you're traveling alone, much less with another person?

review.title: A Lobby Full of Family Tourists
review.reviewText: When I first entered the main entrance I was totally put off by the small guest check in area and all of the Families camped out all over the lobby. This was quite consistant everytime I entered or exited. Groups of people sitting on luggage while waiting sends a message that the quality level of the property is below target. I went to the bar on my first evening for a cocktail and light dinner. I sat (alone) at one of the View Bar seats and waited to be served. I waited, and waited, and waited. Finally, I got up and went back to my room and ordered room service.
review.negativeRemarks: The unwelcome lobby area
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: San Francisco Vacation
review.reviewText: It was a great, reasonably priced hotel for the location. We were comfortable there and staff at the desk was very helpful. Service in the bar/restaurant could be improved, but a minor detail. No vending machines was a little strange --- but we walked to the Walgreens down the street for pop and water, so no harm done.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic! Right in the middle of everything.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: We came into San Francisco for a wedding. We were pleasantly surprised with the hotel accommodations all weekend. Although when we checked out, we were shocked at the cost of the parking fee for our rental car. Had we known that it was $56 a day, we might have not rented a car for the trip. Other than that, everything was great! Especially the location. Very convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: The water coolers in the lobby. Basil infused water......really good!
review.negativeRemarks: The cost of parking our car.....$56 a day......way too much!

review.title: Great Hotel for Location & Amenities
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed the location & the staff was fantastic. We ate in the dining room 3 times & were impressed with the service and the meals. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: Once the construction is done it will be a great h
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby and first floor are under construction. Normal amenities were absent. Customers should be informed of this before they reserve a room.

review.title: GOLD PASSPORT HOLDER
review.reviewText: As a Gold Passport holder for a number of years, I would have expected a complimentary wi fi connection.
review.negativeRemarks: More friendly staff would help
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: Very confortable and well located
review.reviewText: Hotel looks like new. All rooms are renovated and carries nice bed and furniture. Very modern style.

review.title: Great for everyone!
review.reviewText:
My husband and I recently visited the Grand Hyatt for our 21st anniversary! We really enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

The hotel is currently under renovation, but it didn't bother us at all. We booked through Expedia and would highly recommend the Bed and Breakfast special. The breakfast each morning at the top floor restaurant was fabulous! The room was clean and we had a great view of the Bay. The hotel is a great location for seeing everything in the city!

The most impressive thing about our stay were our encounters with the staff, especially Elaine at the Concierge desk. She was AMAZING! She gave us fabulous recommendations for restaurants and sights to see in the city! Thank you SO much Elaine! And the staff in the restaurant were equally wonderful. Overall, the staff made our first trip to San Fran even more enjoyable!
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for tourists to easily get around without a car

review.title: Great clean spacious hotel
review.reviewText:
Pros:
* Excellent location just off from Union Square.
* Great views of the city (stayed on the 34th floor out of 36).
* Hardwood floors give the room a clean feeling versus carpets.
* Comfortable bed, nice decor.
* Expedia had a deal which included breakfast and valet.
* Good breakfast (buffet style with cereals, eggs, etc)
* Numerous restaurants, bars, etc nearby.
* TV and phone have hookups to connect MP3 players etc.

Cons:
* None really. To be really picky, never dined in the hotel but bar menu was very limited for food. Drinks were however good.

review.title: Great view from Top floor restaurant and lounge.
review.reviewText: As a Grand Hyatt, this hotel may be a smaller, boutique hotel-like. However, it eliminates all unnecessary movement, and it will make you feel comfortable when you come back to your room either on business or pleasure.
review.negativeRemarks: Variety of restaurant menu could be expanded.
review.locationRemarks: Right by Union Square, China Town, and many shopping places.

review.title: Stay at the Wharf
review.reviewText: Stayed for the 2012 US Open. The staff was great. The hotel and location were not, even though ESPN Announcers and professional golfers stayed there as well. Very good fitness center and restaurant with great views. There are high end stores nearby, but I got hit up by multiple beggars everyday, and once by a hooker. Transients urinated on the sidewalks in front of you and I witnessed three road rage incidents. Not a location for women to be around or walking. The shower pressure was the worst ever. Spray was about 6 to 7 inches, that's it. Frig broke and replaced with another broken one. The two local Starbucks were packed and dirty and the bums hung out in there and use the same creamers and counters you do. The local restaurants were just OK and the BART was filthy with more transients and people with mental illness. The trolleys take an hour wait to get on. Was on 15th floor but heard street noise all day. The hotel flexes loudly when there is wind due to earthquake design. That woke me up at 2:30 AM. I went to the Wharf and should have stayed there. It was cleaner with more restaurants and variety and views. The tourists were more interesting than the bums downtown and better to get to ATT Park for a game. Take taxis to and from airport at $42.00, its worth it not to ride BART for $8.10. Hyatt does a great job but I would not recommend this location. Stay at the Wharf for a better experience, views, sights, sounds and smells and most of all safety.
review.positiveRemarks: Gym and lounge and restaurant. Great views and quality food. Had the best burger there. Ordered room service to avoid street level for food.
review.negativeRemarks: Location, loud flexing during windy days and horrible shower pressure. Was on the 15th floor but heard street noise all day.
review.locationRemarks: Too many transients, streets/sidewalks filthy, crowded, loud, unsafe and unsanitary.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: The Hotel was excellent, everybody was really helpful and friendly from the front desk, the concierge, the grandview staff, the ladies who cleaned the room, just excellent, I would definetly stay there again if I go back to San Francisco. (which I would love to do)
review.positiveRemarks: I cant fault it on my experience
review.negativeRemarks: I would have liked a mirror near the plug in the bedroom.
review.locationRemarks: The location was very good it was very central for buses etc.

review.title: Great Stay!
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was one of the best in San Francisco. Although complimentary water bottles would be appreciated. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Especially enjoyed the clean and spacious bathroom. We will definitely stay at this hotel next time we visit San Francisco in the near future.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: Nice location. Fabulous view
review.reviewText: The only negative was the hum of the elevators constantly. The 36th floor bar/restaurant had an amazing view. The hotel was in a great location for we were there for (bay to breakers run) and the rooms were updated and extremely clean.

review.title: Great place!
review.reviewText: Out of all the hotels I've stayed in while in San Fran, this has been the nicest! Really enjoyed my stay at Grand Hyatt. They even had an air purifier in my room! Location was great too - close to Chinatown, Moscone Center, Union Square, etc.

review.title: Great Place to get away to!
review.reviewText: Arrived here for our Anniversary/ Mother's Day Celebration over the weekend. Our stay here was very pleasant. Nice, modern, clean room was awaiting us. Bed & pillows were super comftarble.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect Location for shopping, dinning.

review.title: Quality!
review.reviewText: Quality stay. Great accomodations and location! Nothing more to say!

review.title: Great city - Watch out for Parking Fee's
review.reviewText: Valet parking is about $50.00 per day. No need to rent car in San Francisco. Wish I would have know since parking cost added about $400.00 to cost of trip.
review.positiveRemarks: Reading the newspaper on the 36th floor in the morning overlooking the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking Fees
review.locationRemarks: Union Center

review.title: We look forward to going back
review.reviewText: The location was perfect! Right in the center of all the shopping and great cafe's. The staff was wonderful in getting us a cab (or car) right outside of the hotel. The 36 floor cocktail lounge had a beautiful view of the city and the bay. I would definitely stay here again. Thank you!
review.negativeRemarks: The sink in the bathroom was just a little too big so there wasn't enough space on the counter to put my stuff.
review.locationRemarks: In the center of all the best shopping (Union Square), central location to almost every place we visited around town.

review.title: Great location & views
review.reviewText: Great location near Union Square and public transportation. The Grandview restaurant was a bit pricey for breakfast, but we were able to get 2 free breakfasts (there were 4 of us) each day thru Expedia booking. Amazing city views from the restaurant on the 36th floor as well as from our room (23rd floor). We would definitely stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Smallish room size
review.locationRemarks: One block from Union Square.

review.title: I liked it.
review.reviewText: Excellent location, good price compared to similar surrounding hotel. Nice view on the 36th floor.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Our experience of Grand Hyatt, San Fransisco
review.reviewText: Our budget usually means that we stay in motor inn/ travalodge type hotels so we were thrilled to be able to stay at the Grand Hyatt. Our only other experience of a Hyatt was in SIngapore when we went forn a champagne brunch. We were completely satisfied with our experience, right from first arriving through to getting our Lincoln Town Car back to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: To nitpick, the water came out a bit slow into the hand basin in the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Fabulous

review.title: Great for couples, not for families.
review.reviewText: The room was too small for two adults and two children. The wait staff in the upstairs bar acted like they couldn't have cared less that we were there.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was almost too minimalist to be comfortable and unfriendly staff.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic!

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was very good. Staff were friendly and helpful. The roomservice was fast and the food was tasty. The room was clean and set up well each day. The only complaint is that because of rennovations I could not walk down stairs from the 4th floor to the lobby. We had to use the elevator.
review.negativeRemarks: I was not able to use the stairs and had to take the elevator to walk from the fourth floor to the lobby. If there had been a fire what would happen?

review.title: Downtown's Finest!
review.reviewText: Best experience ever in SF! I was so suprised! What a phenomenal hotel! Loved it here, and can NOT wait to stay here again in the future.

review.title: Great place but pricy
review.reviewText: Great location, stylish and chic, overpriced. No free internet. Great service.
review.negativeRemarks: Price
review.locationRemarks: Perfect downtown. Easy walk to chinatown, union square.

review.title: Happy with place!
review.reviewText: My only mark against the room is the shower head. It needs to have the option to locate it farther from the wall so that you can stand directly under it. You must hold the detachable shower head over your head and the rest of your body for that matter in order to fully rinse. Otherwise, great place.

review.title: Hyatt Union Square
review.reviewText: great location, good experience. Clean rooms, good service. Staff always helpful

review.title: Grand Hyatt - Great Stay
review.reviewText: I spent 6 nights at the Grand Hyatt with my adult daughter recently. The rooms have recently been refurbished and are very stylish with probably the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in. We were on the 29th floor with superb views. All staff were very accomodating and check in was quick and efficient. The view from the restaurant is amazing although we found the food to be average- the in room service food was better than the restaurant. All in all a great hotel in a great position.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast selection and Restaurant food
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location in the heart of Union Square

review.title: Loved it...
review.reviewText: Very clean, great service, great staff. Location is good too.
review.negativeRemarks: cant think of anything
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: Would certainly stay again.
review.reviewText: Easy 4-block walk from Powell St BART station. Attractive hotel. Helpful staff - facilitated early check-in and handled overnight dry cleaning. Comfortable room. Nice fitness center on 35th floor.

review.title: Great hotel close to Union Square and shopping
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel with spectacular views from the room. We paid a little extra for a room on a higher level and were rewarded with the spectacular views both day and night. Well owrth it. The staff were all friendly and courteous and most helpful and approachable. The room was modern and comfortable. We had dinner one night at the Grandview Restaurant on the 36th floor and the service and food was again excellent. We were able to get a late check out for only $40 which we thought was good value and well worth it. We had a great stay!
review.negativeRemarks: The refurbishment going on in the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently loctaed adjacent to Union Square with great shopping all around.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Fresh and modern feel at this hotel. The location was 10/10. The only issue for me was that the two double beds in our room were too soft.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds
review.locationRemarks: Great

photos.caption: Fogged up window due to no working bathroom fan.
Our wonderful view of the Union Square.

review.title: Room for Improvement
review.reviewText: Our room had a wonderful view Union Square below. The room was small but we expected that in the city. We came to San Francisco to visit the city and had a wonderful time. But we had several issues with the hotel experience. First my 4 year old daughter brought me a shard of gold glass from the bed, next the ice machine didn't work on our floor, next the fan and heat lamp didn't turn on in the bathroom, then the remote to the TV didn't work (batteries were dead). When we went to check out, we found that the garage was charging us for an extra day. The cleaning staff sent us a bottle of wine because of the glass and since it took 2 hours for them to come change the bedding. The bottle of wine was nice but we don't drink. The front desk person ended up comping 1 day of parking for us, which was also nice. I have stayed in hotels in the city before with my parents. None of them were very clean. I sprang for the more expensive hotel for my own family but really wasn't all that impressed. It was cleaner then the cheaper hotels.
review.positiveRemarks: By far, the view from our room. Spectacular!
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of attention to the room for general maintanence and cleaning items.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location.Couple blocks from Chinatown. Easy access to Muni system. Those tour bus don't run after 5pm so watch out.

review.title: Grand Hyatt is amazing!
review.reviewText: Loved the location, the staff,and the room. The concierge was extremely helpful. We were right next to shopping, restaurants, and the ice skating rink.
review.positiveRemarks: restaurant and bar on TOP LEVEL
review.negativeRemarks: PARKING FEE!!!
review.locationRemarks: AMAZING! RIGHT DOWNTOWN

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: Renovated rooms are very nice. Lovely view from ours, though we paid a bit extra for it. Lobby space kinda cramped, but we heard that it will be renovated soon. Located very close to Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy heater/AC fan, slow TV menu system
review.locationRemarks: Nearly adjacent to Union Square -- very convenient.

review.title: Fair
review.reviewText: Could not find slippers, hairdryer, and toothbrush in the room. Have to request it at the front desk.

review.title: Great and convenient location next to Union Square.
review.reviewText: The interior decoration is modern and beautiful. The double beds and linens are very comfy. The bathroom is very clean. The room size is decent for double full size beds. Staffs are friendly and coutreous. Suggestion: Have a valet parking sign in front of the hotel curbside so out-of-town guests don't have to drive the car around looking for the parking entrance like I did. other than that, that's a great and enjoyable experience staying at Grand Hyatt.

review.title: Prime Location/ Nice room
review.reviewText: Very happy with our stay at the Hyatt. The hotel looks like its been recently remodeled the room was modern and very clean. The staff was all very friendly and helpful. The location is great, right in the heart of all the great shops and everything is within walking distance. Only complain was that I could hear all the footsteps coming from floor above, luckily they weren't having a raging party otherwise it would have been a problem. Other than that I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText:
We got a complementary upgrade from the 4th to the 30th floor without even requesting it. The view was phenomenal, the room recently updated was very comfortable. Even on the 30th floor it was a little noisy so I can only imagine how it must have been on the lower floors. Do not turn the TV on, there is a $14 fee, I am assuming per day that the TV was turned on. We only listened to the music for 5 minutes and nowhere did it ever say there was a charge for it before we got the bill at the end of our stay. The room was clean, except for an empty pack of cigarettes left behind. It did not smell of cigarettes at all.

The restaurant on the 36th floor was great for breakfast. It offers a $25 buffet (note that you can request anything from the a la carte menu as well when ordering the buffet). The service was excellent and the panoramic view was amazing.

The concierges were very nice, patient and knowledgeable. They made sure we made the most of our stay.

It is very well located, with many restaurants and shopping all around. It is at the edge of Chinatown, on Union Square.

I strongly recommend this hotel and would stay there again myself.

review.title: very nice indeed
review.reviewText: very nice

review.title: High Class Hyatt
review.reviewText: From entry to exit a fantastic experience - clean, classy and convenient: concierge service was outstanding, the Rooftop Lounge was a hoot and our room was spacious and very modern.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: Rooms clean comfortable staff helpfull. Would stay here aagin when in San Francisco. Great location on union square.

review.title: LOVED IT!!!!
review.reviewText: This was my 1st visit to SF and the Hyatt made our trip that much better. We stayed at the Hyatt the 1st half of our visit and another competing hotel in the same area the last part. We will definitely return to SF soon & will stay at the Hyatt the entire visit.

review.title: Nice Stay
review.reviewText:
We spent 5 days at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco with my husband and my daughter.

It is a well located hotel in the Union Square area. You have a couple of Starbucks nearby. A Walgreens and a couple of 7-11 as well. Right in front you have a Macy's, Cheesecake Factory and a lot of luxurious stores such as Louis Vuitton, Gucci, Chanel, Prada, Burberry.

The personnel is very helpful and can meet any of your requirement. The cafeteria located in the upper floor has a wonderful view.

Would stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Fisherman's Wharf, Little Italy

review.title: Location Not What We Were Looking For ...
review.reviewText: We were looking for a hotel more in the midst of late night bars and restaurants open beyond 10 pm. This area was not conducive to that idea. We were told by the concierge that San Fran is not a late night place?! What?! do you mean to tell me that our hometown of DC has more cool places than this area?!

review.title: GREAT CHOICE!
review.reviewText: I searched and found a great deal and was confused as to why it was only as much as the lesser looking hotels. To my suprise and relief there was no catch, it was great. If you see prices for this place the same as some of those boutique hotels stay here! It was great! Great view cause we got lucky, we got the respire room just to be safe and man was it clean, tv and internet great, nice king bed, bar and restaurant on top floor with beautiful view. The location can't be beat! we calculated that this, with a couple of other hotels a lot more expensive when we searched, is the best possible cental location regardless of where you wanna go and in a nice area. Check the map and find the tourist spots, restaurants, train and bus stops and you'll see, by the way forget taxis friday and sat night so pay hundreds on paking or get on the bus! They also hav a great door man service and perfect spot to flag cabs. Couldn't of chosen better with out spending almost double.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown, close to everything. Shopping, restaurants, sights, etc....

review.title: Great Hotel and Location
review.reviewText:
Great hotel and location. A block from China town and walking distance to the piers.
The hotel also has a bar and restaurant on the top floor which must have one of the best views in San Francisco , overlooking the bay and Alcatraz.

review.title: Great Spot
review.reviewText: Definitely a great location near Union Square. Quiet except when the wind blows.

review.title: Very central hotel, great rooms
review.reviewText: Room lovely and new ,great bathroom comfy beds and lovely view. Only downside was had breakfast in grand views on 36 th floor and quite dated and musty not in keeping at all with the rooms of the hotel.

review.title: Will Book This Place Again If They Have At Least Same Discounted Rate
review.reviewText: We stayed in a room on the 16th floor; the room and bathroom were the recently renovated ones, which I read about before booking the room. I liked the automated shades in the room and the wide tub shaped sink in the bathroom. The porters and the reception staff were friendly and helpful, even during the busy labor day holiday weekend. The only negative comment that I can say from this experience is the location of the hotel is about 4 blocks going up hill from the closest BART Powell Street station if you want to take the BART from the airport.

review.title: Loved San Francisco!
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with my stay at the hotel. The decor was modern, the view was beautiful and the location was perfect. My only issue is that cleaning could have been a little better. I'm very particular about hotel cleaniness - the room was very clean, in general, but certain corners were dusty, there were crumbs in the the cushion of the desk chair, and the shower curtain had some stains on it. Other than that the room was clean. These small issues would not prevent me from staying there again - I just hope that the hotel reads this review and addresses them. Housekeeping really needs to be excellent in a hotel of this quality (and price).

review.title: Good location to explore SFO
review.reviewText:
Good service and great rooms with fantastic view.

Breakfast is poor - small choice and small room, so we had always wait up to 15 Minutes to be seated. But understand that people want to stay longer in breakfast room: 36th floor with impressive view

review.title: very nice hotel
review.reviewText: great

review.title: Don't eat at the restaurant
review.reviewText: My wife and I both got food sick from their restaurant on the 36th floor. Don't eat their fresh prawn spring roll. Also ordered medium filet mignon, came out well done and salty. Ended up vomiting everything the following day. Safety box were not operating. Almost missed our dinner reservation because it took them 15 minutes to send their engineer. Don't expect good services unless you can tip them good.

review.title: Breakfast is Awesome!
review.reviewText:
I generally enjoyed my stay here. The rooms are beautiful and well-maintained. Lots of food and entertainment options within a short walk from the hotel. And breakfast in the hotel restaurant is simply wonderful. The pancakes are worth going back all by themselves!

Some of the elevators were broken when I stayed, so it could take 10 minutes to get anywhere in the hotel (or to exit). This was plainly a fiasco. I would definitely call them to ask if their elevators are all working before I stayed again. But if they fix the elevators, this is an excellent choice of lodging.

review.title: New modern hotel for decent price
review.reviewText: Hotel is new, stylish and very clean. Great service from the conierge during our stay! Breakfast at the oniste restaurant on top florr was ok but pretty expensive. The view is outstanding. I would definitely stay here as it is conveniently located and a great deal. Would recommend a shuttle to airport if needed, it would be a pretty long cab ride.

review.title: :"One of the best I've stayed in"
review.reviewText: Everything was fine in this hotel, the staff was very nice and more than helpful the food and service in the Grandview restaurant was excellent. Probably the only thing I didn't like were the selections the piano player chose. When you're out trying to have a romantic dinner, "Benny and Jets" and "The hotel California" just doesn't cut it for me! A little Cole Porter or Johnny Mercer would have been fine LOL, however he did play something from "The Phantom of the opera" before the dinner was over. Overall we had a wonderful time, I think I'll send that piano play a little note.

review.title: Great location, quality hotel
review.reviewText: We recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt and were satisfied with the overall stay. It is centrally located to most of San Francisco's major attractions and great shopping and restaurants. The rooms are very nice! Small refrigerator and coffee maker available.

review.title: Great location, newly remodeled rooms
review.reviewText:
Location is very convenient to explore the city-
Room is nice and clean, recently remodeled in a modern, sleek style-
Breakfast at the hotel's restaurant (included in our package) was good (buffet).
We just had the bad surprise to return to our room after dinner one night to find our bathroom flooded (some toilet flush trouble it seems), and it took them some time to come fix it. The maintenance guy apologized for the trouble, but we didn't hear from the front desk.

review.title: Great View
review.reviewText:
The hotel is remodeling and the smell of the carpet or something smelled like burned rubber, as soon as the elevator dor opens on to the florr. It even came into the room. It was not pleasant.
The remodeled rooms look very nice but the pull drapes were coming off the track already.
The food in the restaurant is outstanding. We shared the steak and crab dinner and salad and it was very good. Same thing for appetizers in the bar and breakfast in the morning. Food is very good.

review.title: Way too loud
review.reviewText: The overall hotel was fine and the location was good, but bring ear plugs because the walls are paper thin and there is a lot of street noise if you are on the lower levels.

review.title: Modern and Comfortable
review.reviewText: We were highly impressed with the Grand Hyatt. The room was very modern and updated with comfortable beds and a very nice bathroom. We especially loved the beds! The Hyatt is located in easy walking distance to shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Exceptional staff
review.reviewText: At check-in our receptionist learned that it was our anniversary and proceeded to upgrade our room AND have us select a generous "treat" to be delivered to our room at the time we chose. Our room and bath were very spacious, absolutely spotless, quite modern, and included floor to ceiling windows with views of the city and the bay. Outstanding! We used the concierge services daily and their recommendations for restaurants, sights, and transportation were always excellent. The location was perfect for walking to restaurants, galleries, theatres, shopping, and public transportation. We have been to San Francisco several times before, but the Grand Hyatt was by far our best hotel experience. We will return!

review.title: Home away from home
review.reviewText: The location of where the Grand Hyatt Hotel on Union Square is makes it an ideal and excellent hotel choice to stay in San Francisco. We felt the features of our hotel room made it feel like home. The hotel staff were also very friendly and helpful. We definitely will return back to San Francisco and hopefully, to the Grand Hyatt Hotel on Union Square. Much of our decision as to whether to stay at the Grand Hyatt rests with the cost of the air and hotel packages though.

review.title: Wonderful Experience
review.reviewText: Great

review.title: terrible!
review.reviewText: Their bed was terrible! also, if you wanna drink a water you can't? there wasn't a water .. In fact, i changed the hotel after the first night to another Hotel.

review.title: love san fran
review.reviewText: great views

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Very satisfied

review.title: Great location at a great price
review.reviewText: This hotel is close to everything we wanted to see and do. We stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms and were impressed by the style and comfort. We will definately stay here again.

review.title: Perfect Location & Lovely Renovated Room
review.reviewText: I was so happy with the newly renovated room with luxurious bedding and modern lighting. My aging eyes could actually read with the eco-friendly bed lights and the bathroom had updated features with a vessel sink. My husband and I have stayed at a hotel on Nob Hill before, but the Grand Hyatt is the only hotel we will stay in now because you can go shopping in the Union Square neighborhood or walk to the Embarcadero or the Pier without climbing the arduous hills. The only criticism (and a trivial one) is the alt-rock music playing in the elevator. Why is music needed in the elevator at all?

review.title: We will visit again.
review.reviewText: Great location, it is close to all the name brand stores, restaurants, and transportation make it very convenient.

review.title: great location and concierge services
review.reviewText: Hotel location is probably the best, at the heart of the city, close to China Town and Little Italy. A big discount off the self-assisted parking is a great value if you rent a car and stay in this place for many days. I must mention the concierge service staff who are so knowledgeable about the city's attractions, food, entertainment.

review.title: Great Location, Remodeled and Updated
review.reviewText: Location is great. Many public transportation options in the area. Lots of excitement within walking distance. The place was clean. New & updated furniture, finishes, fixtures etc. The threshold under the doors are a little too wide. Grandviews Lounge is a nice place to grab a cocktail before heading out for the night. The view is great before the fog rolls in.

review.title: Best Hotel in SF.
review.reviewText: I went to San Francisco and stayed at the Grand Hyatt for a leisure trip. First of all, the hotel staff was EXTREMELY helpful and friendly. Also, the concierge helped me with resturants, activities, etc. And she was SUPER nice. Also, I was put on the 21st floor with a new remodeled room and it sure was amazing. Electronic blinds, amazing modern bathroom (a bit on the small side), flat screen TV, lots of work space, cord and cordless phones and super comfy beds. The view from my room also was fabulous. The one thing i did not like was the room was a bit on the small side and there was not much space to store things. But for me it was plenty. Also the location I think is the best in San Francisco, 2 minutes from shopping, across the street from Starbucks and right in downtown. I completely recommend this hotel for couples, singles, or travelers on business, but for families, they should either get a suite or a conjoining room which the Grand Hyatt both has. Overall, this hotel blew my mind, and it was much better than I was expecting.

review.title: great hotel, perfect location
review.reviewText: great hotel, perfect location

review.title: Perfect Hotel for Moscone
review.reviewText: We attended a conference at Moscone West. The Hyatt was perfectly located. A short walk right down Stockton to the conference. Conveniently located across the street from a Starbucks and one block from a 24 hour Walgreens. We ate breakfast every morning at Sears Fine Foods -- excellent breakfast. Union square is just a few minutes away as is the Powell St BART stop. I took the train from SFO and walked to the hotel in just a few minutes. The rooms have been renovated with floor to ceiling windows and a cool bed-side control for the shade. The view from the Grandviews restaurant and bar on the 36th floor is breathtaking. The gym on the 35th floor is fully stocked -- possibly the best hotel gym I have seen. I would definitely stay there again. On top of it all, the Hyatt was the cheapest hotel in the area that we could find and we were there during Apple's WWDC 2011.

review.title: terrible to their labor!
review.reviewText: I was shocked to discover that the Hyatts in SF have not signed a contract with their workers so that they've been working without a contract since August 2009. Perhaps reviews have said this. I should have read them. I travel to SF a lot but wouldn't consider staying there again until they settle with their labor!

review.title: Find Somewhere else to stay! Worst Hotel Ever
review.reviewText:
Arrived and waited 10 minutes for the girl behind the desk to stop chatting with her coworker about nonsense.

Arrived back to our room in the evening to find that the heater didn't work and of course, no other room on the same floor was available, so we had to pack all of our things again, and move to another floor, where the heater in that room worked, but made a god awful sound for 10 minutes after turning off .

Will never stay in this hotel ever again.

review.title: Grand Hyatt is grand!
review.reviewText: The Grand Hyatt will not disappoint. I had stopped coming to this location years ago due to service and amenities, but I am hooked since they have remodeled! The rooms are plush with a modern feel and decor. The best thing about the Hyatt is their fitness facility!! It is super clean, well maintained, great equipment, and a great view. Unlike comparable hotels in the area, they do not charge to use the facility. I highly recommend this facility. However, if you need a taxi, walk a block to Union Square; due to construction on the street, taxis are avoiding the hotel. I waited 45 minutes for a cab, even though the doorman was trying.

review.title: I was sorry we were only staying one night. The remodeled rooms are beautiful.
review.reviewText: I would definitely stay here again. Great gym and good location to DT SF.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: I love this hotel's service, cleanliness and location.

review.title: clean and comfortable
review.reviewText: After reading many reviews I decided on the Hyatt @ union square. It was very clean and comfortable and also the location/neighborhood was nice. I am a some what picky traveler, I would gladly stay here again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel is half a block from Union Square and 1 block to cable car line. Lots of resturants within walking distance. Great views from wall of windows, we saw the Bay Bridge, Coit Tower, China Town, just wonderful

review.title: SF Business trip
review.reviewText: Excellent remodeled rooms

review.title: No View of the City
review.reviewText: I paid for a "CITY VIEW" room and got a view of an electrical box for my daughter's birthday. I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco before and everything was great. The location is excellent for shopping and dining. I am sad that when my daughter was passing through San Fran on her cross country tour that this was her San Fran experience. She was very excited about making it to San Fran on her 23rd birthday so I thought I would make it special and put her up at The Grand Hyatt. Next time I will stress the importance of the view.

review.title: hyatt-sf
review.reviewText: not bad

review.title: the only good thing...location.
review.reviewText: we checked in and since we stay at this hotel about 2 times a year ( we live in monterey peninsula...a couple hours from san francisco) we asked for a upgrade since we were in 4 ( 2 adults and 2 kids)....sorry, no upgrades for you, no bigger room, no suites (i don't believe it...the hotel wasn't full at all), but ok, i will respect what i paid for. next we go to the room....very small room, especially for 4 people; the rooms at the 29th floor, are not remodeled and are very old ( not flat screen tv, old shower and furnitures);ok, let me connect to the internet....you have to pay (90% of the hotels now give free wi-fi internect connection..)....and is not finished...to park the car will cost you more then a third of the hotel room ). but again, i'm not the person that like to complain, it's ok. now for the price that we paid, the extra charges ( i cannot write here the prices ) you can have a lot better hotel and service. by the way, at the end of our stay, we checked out, and the manager (or assistant manager) asked us how was they stay...i told him vey politely my opinion ( he agreed with me that the room was old and small) and with a simple "we are sorry you were a little disappointed"...see you next time, he said by to me. he could at least offer me a free room for another time ( since i leave very close to san francisco and i have family there...so almost every month i go to the city) or an upgrade...but, no problem...in san francisco there are a lot of hotel.

review.title: Love this Hotel
review.reviewText: We especially enjoy going to the bar on the top floor, great view and atmosphere.

review.title: Great Hotel!!!!
review.reviewText: Awesome views...great staff.

review.title: Not so "grand" Hyatt property
review.reviewText: Pretty disappointing for a Hyatt property. The staff at the front desk were confused and slow, there was a ton what sounded like construction noise from neighboring rooms, the bathtub didn't drain and the room was just ok. On the plus side, the beds and pillows were wonderfully comfortable and the room service was fantastic. The Grandview Lounge on the 36th floor also offered fabulous views of the city and bay with great drinks.

review.title: Great location,very good hotel and staff
review.reviewText: Great location. I was on the upper floor with gorgeous city view. Helpful staff, very good hotel.

review.title: Location good, hotel remodel a pain
review.reviewText: Overall, the Hyatt SF was a decent experience. The location was good. We were there during their remodel so we were woken up twice by the hammering noise being done on the 6th floor from our 9th room hotel room. Once during a nap when we landed (Thursday afternoon) and then the next morning (Friday). It was extremely loud and vibrated up the walls. We got a new room on the 16th floor and could still hear the noise. Luckily, we were there through the weekend so the construction was stopped. We had to ask to be comped for something and we thought free internet was the least they could do. They agreed so that was ok. We would have liked a room upgrade but that didn't happen.

review.title: ok
review.reviewText:
was ok, shopping very accessible, online conceirge was helpful, breath taking
views from the grandview restaurant

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: GREAT VACATION

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText:
Check in was easy but the gave us the wrong room. Had to wait for 2 hours
for the new room. Parking was $$.$$ per day. Hotel was centrally located but
We won't be staying downtown SFO again, it's just too crowded. If you want to
get on a cable car, good luck and even that is overpriced. Better off walking.

review.title: Great for staying near Union Square
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great central location if you want to visit Chinatown, union square, and all the shopping you could imagine. The only attraction that wasn't really close was fisherman's wharf and it was a quick ride via street car or cable car. We spent a lot of time at fisherman's wharf so I might consider staying within walking distance of that next time.

review.title: A Central Base in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The location of the Grand Hyatt is very convenient, directly on Union Square with easy access to to some of the city's most popular sights. It is a 20 minute walk or a five minute cab ride to the Ferry Building, convenient to street cars, and a short walk to Chinatown. The staff of the hotel is extremely professional, well trained and well organized. The upgrade to the hypo-allergenic room isn't worth the extra money unless you actually have allergies - the regular rooms are just as well appointed. The rooms are small, but not impossibly so and the hotel is certainly ideal for business traveler or couples planning mainly to be out on the town and not spending a lot of time in the room.

review.title: Prime location but connecting rooms
review.reviewText: Clean and prime location. The staff was very helpful and friendly. However the rooms have doors that connect to the next room. They are locked of course and this was only an issue to me, because Im a woman and I was traveling alone for business. If I were traveling with a group or someone it would have not really mattered that much, but theres no reference about this anywhere on the hotel description, so heads up. You can clearly hear the conversation in the next room, outside of that is was fine.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: nice location, meals are expensive if you eat at hotel but it's expected for a 4 star hotel. Nice view from restaurant. Employees were very helpful and professional.

review.title: Union Squares best hotel location!
review.reviewText:
Best location of any Union Square hotel. Very little pedestrian foot traffic outside main entrance. Less than 1/2 block from center of Union Square. definitely a 4+ star hotel. Great room comfort & floor to ceiling windows w/ great views. Will stay here next SF visit! We were lucky to pick this location!!!
For the first time ever used public transit(Muni) which was superb. Just one block from Powell cable car & four blocks from Powell St station..buy the passes you'll save big!!

review.title: Very fine hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel and staff were very friendly. A great location for walking to all of the transportation services in the city. China Town just a short walk away. The hotel made arrangements for a trip to the Wine Country with small local touring company that picked us up at the hotel. The extra expense of a rental car was not necessary due to the hotel's location and services.
I recommend this hotel.

review.title: Union Square Star
review.reviewText: Great hotel stay right on Union Square. Most hotels around Union Square have the tiniest rooms imaginable but I found this hotel to be size of a regular hotel room.

review.title: Not for business traveler
review.reviewText: I was arriving in a red eye flight from Japan and I wanted to make sure my room was available as soon as I arrived. I paid for the night before my arrival. Before my departure I called the hotel to let them know was arriving ealy in the morning the following day and not that evening. I was very clear that I wanted my room as soon as I arrived. Unfortunately, the room was not available and I was told that they had no rooms to give me. I demaned for my money to be returned for the room that I had paid for and they did not have. A few more words were exchanged and it escalated to a manager finally appeasing us to an upgrade with breakfast included. By that time my blood was boiling.

review.title: Bland but Quiet
review.reviewText: As it being a Hyatt hotel chain, I was expecting the room to be a little more than mediocre. The lobby and building looks luxurious but the room was a little disappontment. I've stayed in some Comfort Inns that look and feel similar at half the price. Although the rooms were clean and quiet, it is a little outdated.

review.title: Would go again. Really liked the hotel and location.
review.reviewText: The view from the 36th floor is spectacular. Wewent to the lounge a couple of times ant truly enjoyed ourselves.

review.title: Loved my stay in SF
review.reviewText: Loved the location to everything we needed to see if San Francisco. The view from the top floor of the city was awesome. Room was great as was the service.I encourage anyone planning on staying in the city stay at the Grand Hyatt

review.title: Perfect location, great service
review.reviewText: Very efficient, friendly check-in and check-out. (You can also print your boarding pass for your return flight in the lobby--very convenient.) Nice rooms, VERY comfy beds. Spectacular views from the bar. Only two nit-picks: extremely limited cable TV channels, and the bathrooms (although nice and shining clean) could use a little updating. But overall, a great hotel experience and I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

review.title: Is possible return
review.reviewText: ....was an interesting experience in a beatifull city, the concierges at the hotel had a very good work explaining options in the city and for Sonoma and napa Valley....

review.title: Great Location with Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: All the right things for a family vacation. Great location, clean, roomy with a friendly staff. Each day of siteseeing began in the small but manageable fitness center and ended in the Lounge on the 35th floor with a cocktail and a stunning view of the city and Bay. We would stay there again.

review.title: hotel needs upgrading
review.reviewText: the room temp difficult to control as well as the hot water in the sink and shower it was either blasting hot water or freezing cold. the towels were old and scratchy Ididn't like the toiletries. the beds were comfortable the staff were very nice.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Very comfortable hotel, and was within walking distance of my conference (Moscone Convention Center). Very helpful and friendly staff - I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Needs updates
review.reviewText: This hotel is in an amazing location. But they need to renovate their rooms. It looks like they have not been changed in over 10 years. A few minor adjustments would make this hotel much better.

review.title: Location, location.
review.reviewText: From airport, to BART, to the hotel was about 55 minutes and $9 bucks. First time in town in years, Union Square was a great central location to everything. I would probably choose Union Square neighborhood at least 1 more time before I ventured to another neighborhood. Hotel was very nice, as expected.

review.title: Too expensive
review.reviewText:
Ok, there was nothing seriously wrong however the price is hard to justify

I have stayed in cheaper hotels (eg best western) where the facilities in the room were about comparable but at 1/3 the price
