The bar and restaurant have great views however the bar isn;t that big and when I was there was too crowded to get a seat. The restaurant was already fully booked when I checked in - however both the bar and restaurant are pricey. The bar serves bar food at posh restaurant prices.

the only parking is selfserve (across street and a pain to get to) for over $30 or valet parking for nearly $50 (and then they have the nerve to hover for a tip)

There are no vending machines in the hotel (again best western beats them on this) and the cash machine has a charge of over $3.

There is a minibar - however I didnt see where the mrotgage application forms were to be able to pay for it.

Rooms were comfortable (although looking out at the roof and side of other buildings - so no view) but no better than any other hotel

mini water fountains on each floor by the lift made even my 9 year old son comment on how cheap and tacky they were

The hotel rests on it position and the amount of marble in the lobby to justify it's prices. My opinion is that anywhere cheaper is unlikely to be a worse decision

review.title: Grand Hyatt - Union Sq. San Fran
review.reviewText: Walking distance to great Sports Bars, Restaurants, shopping, hopping on the Trolley. BART was very easy from the Airport. Highly Recommend.

review.title: Good San Francisco hotel
review.reviewText: Good location, not quiet, old style room.

review.title: Great Location, Will stay here again!!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location of union square for all the shops. Close to chinatown. Every staff member I encountered was courteous, had knowledge of the area and provided excellent service. Stayed for 5 days, Housekeeping was excellent and provided anything I needed very quickly even on XMAS day!! I would definetly recommend this property. The rooms could use sprucing up, but the location and employees made up for it. The head concierge was extremely helpful and knowlegeable. Had XMAS dinner upstairs at Waterviews, was mediocre. The view was great!!. Overall I would definelty stay here again.

review.title: excellent stay
review.reviewText: Super convenient location for our purpose (shopping and dining), and cmfy beds.

review.title: Pretty good, hotel showing it's age
review.reviewText:
Pretty much as expected for a hotel of this price range. The view was pretty stunning overlooking Union Square, and at night with all the buildings lit up it was very pretty.

The hotel is definitely showing it's age however, the washroom & shower, while spacious, had a pretty old shower head. Some CLR or white vinegar would probably cure it.

Other than that we'd probably go back, but since there are so many choices in the area we'd probably find something else next time.

review.title: Worst hotel experience ever
review.reviewText:
Arrived to hotel workers' strike. Unable to get any type of room cleaning. Had to repeatedly beg for clean towels, sheets, and shampoo. We were finally offered a new room during our stay, because we couldn't get any type of housekeeping in our room. Bathrooms at the conference were dirty.
We were repeatedly told how "sorry" everyone was for the inconvience, but I didn't pay for "I'm sorry."
The noise from the strikers went on all day and all night, complete with huge drums that were banged around the clock. The Hyatt did nothing to try to make our stay a little more comfortable or cleaner.
I understand that the strike may have been out of their control, but there was no excuse for the lack of services for which we had paid, or some type of compensation.

review.title: Great San Fran Experience
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel with excellent staff and you can't beat the location! I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Close to Public transportation, cable cars and in close proximity to amazing shopping!

review.title: fine hotel
review.reviewText: delivers on what it should

review.title: Great location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Grand Hyatt is right off of Union Square, with great shopping and restaurants right outside your door. One block from public transportation (cable car). The staff was very helpful and the rooms are clean with wonderful views of the city. Recommend highly.

review.title: Grand Hyatt - Union Square
review.reviewText: great experience - can't wait to go back

review.title: furniture renewal
review.reviewText: The hotel was situated in a very good position on Union Square. The furniture in the room could do with a bit of an upgrade, not really 4 star quality but time is better spent outside rather than sitting looking at it. The staff were friendly and willing to assist with any enquiries. San Francisco itself was wonderful,full of character. We would go back there in a heartbeat, not only did I leave my heart in San Fran but also my feet and liver.....

review.title: lots of dust in the room
review.reviewText: overall, good location but I expected better room condition

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: From the reception clerks to the concierge, this hotel offered exceptional service. The room was okay (not exceptional) in space, but we truly enjoyed out stay, without exception. The bar staff was fabulous and the live music was great with a view from the top of the hotel that is appparently a favorite of many.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The Hyatt Union Square is very convenient to both Union square and public transportation throughout the Bay Area. The concierge staff was exceptionally helpful.

review.title: In the heart of it all
review.reviewText: The hotel was located in an excellent location. Close to shopping, cable cars, good restaurants and the visitor's center. Able to take public transportaiton all over the city with a 3-day Muni pass for buses, F-cars and cable cars. Within walking distance of Chinatown. Concierge gave good recomendations and the front desk was helpful. If I get to go to SF again, I would definitely try to stay @ the Grand Hyatt Union Square.

review.title: location,location,location
review.reviewText: The room price and the location were great. Right in the heart of Union square, with many high end stores nearby. The service was very good and attentive. On the down side my room location could have been higher, (better view) and the parking fee was a bit too high compared to other comparable hotels in the area. All in all I would return and request a higher floor.

review.title: Comfortable Rooms
review.reviewText: The beds and climate of the rooms were extremely comfortable and I slept very well. Didn't care for the scent of the bath products though.

review.title: Pretty good deal
review.reviewText: good location in Union Square with easy access to public transportation (3-4 block walk)

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel, great location, concierge was very helpful. Would definately stay here again!

review.title: Very Comfortable
review.reviewText: Went for a birthday trip and I thought our location was PERFECT! We were maybe a block or two from chinatown. Right Macy's. The hop on/off picked us up and took us around town and the Wine tour recommended by the hotel was fabulous!. Our beds were so comfortable that I was unhappy when i got in my own personal bed(ha!). My only problem was the bathroom toilet OR the toilet in the room next to us. I couldn't really tell. When flushed it made this hammering noise. Other than that our experience was great.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Great location in Union Square but the walls are very thin and you can hear your neighbors at 7:oo in the morning. Service was wonderful and views from thier restaurant are spectacular

review.title: Not a true 4 Star
review.reviewText: I expected much more from Grand Hyatt and have been in many others. Location is great, Concierge and front desk friendly and competent, but it ends there. The room itself was cluttered, old TV, average bathroom products, no robes or shower mat. Didn't change sheets after an obvious coffee spill. Club lounge 'food' selections were marginal. Breakfast average at best. Had to pay (halfprice) for drinks at happy hour. There are much better choices in this price range nearby. (I may just be spoiled by Asian 5 star quality & service at half this price!)

review.title: Grand Hyatt SF - A Nice Place to be Situated
review.reviewText: Right on Union Square; perfect for shopping and high-end restaurants. 3 short blocks from the BART. All around very convenient. Decent lobby and housekeeping staff. Only single serve coffee in room; no tea. No soda vending on floor and no lobby gift shop. You'll have to walk to Walgreens one block away. Only lunch and dinner on 36th floor - fantastic views. We didn't eat here; just cocktails at sunset. You'll have to venture out for breakfast.

review.title: disappointed
review.reviewText: they did not even have the 2 bed room reserved...only one king bed...had to wait a long time to finally get the room. And there were daily mini bar charges which we did not even use and the check out time took over 30 min. just to fix the charges. The breakfast food at the hotel rest. was AWFUL!!!!! Very disappointed!!!

review.title: Not very impressed
review.reviewText: It was not what i expected from Grand Hayat

review.title: recommended!
review.reviewText: nice location, the concierge area so polite... the service perfect. Just the food in the top floor (restaurant) is not enought... need more things.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Although we got a price reduction on our room I was expecting a much higher standard from this hotel. The room was quite small and could have been cleaner. As a frequent visitor to SF I have stayed in more comfortable hotels with lower grades.

review.title: Best location!!! ask for top floor to avoid noises from street
review.reviewText: Best location!!! very noise in the evening (Saturday night) but offered discount when complained about sleepness night...

review.title: Will go back again
review.reviewText: Great hotel/Great location

review.title: Concierge efforts made the hotel
review.reviewText: David on the concierge desk made our visit all the more enjoyable and easy. His willing to help and assist wherever possible was genuinely appreciated and local knowledge recommendations was spot on. Thank you from a couple of Aussie visitors.

review.title: Centralized location to all businesses and Union Square, thus, convenient.
review.reviewText: Hotel services were excellent especially their 24-hr room service. Restaurant in hotel great. Although they had an excellent business room with all business amenities, it was closed on Sunday. Internet access is not free. Location of hotel is central to all businesses and Union Square which had lots of activities and stage shows for the public to see.

review.title: very nice; central location, comfortable; no doubt I'd reccommend it to friends
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel accommodations,The concierge gave us a bad tip regarding purchasing Play tickets but that was the only downside of my stay.

review.title: One of the Best in San Francisco!!!
review.reviewText: An excellent choice in San Francisco, very comfortable and clean roooms, the view from the 36th floor restaurant is very impressive, close to china town, cable car, shopping stores and restaurants.

review.title: cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: my family and me loved the hotel, excelent ubication and very confortable rooms

review.title: Was upset from the beginning
review.reviewText: We arrived and they had overbooked, so we didn't get the room we had booked. They gave us a room with a King bed for 4 people. Expedia got us moved the next day and the hotel then booked someone else after we were in our room, our keys no longer worked and their's did,to OUR room. Then, had a large charge on our checkout and it wasn't ours. Parking fee is outrageous $49 a day no in and out. Would not go back!!!!

review.title: Overbooked and furniture needs an upgrade
review.reviewText: The hotel was overbooked so we ended up in a Parlor Suite (a fancy name for a room with just a pull out sofa). We ended up having to sleep on a pull out sofa instead of a regular bed... It wasn't very comfortable. The furniture in the room was very outdated. Otherwise the location is great. Close to everything.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: nice hotel, friendly staff

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Perfectly located, nice beds, clean.... and a great diner for those 2 am returns to the hotel less than 2 blocks away!

review.title: The best location
review.reviewText: had the best time....great service very helpful ....no need for rental car....the only bad thing is i felt i was in a 3 star becuse of the bathroom but everything else was great...

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: A bit old, but good location with nice people.

review.title: Rooms in urgent need of redecorating.
review.reviewText: For supposedly an upscale hotel, our room was a disgrace. Torn curtains, shoddy carpets, very dated and worn atmosphere. Really had expected much more from the Hyatt name. Location superb. Front desk, concierge friendly and helpful.

review.title: Great location....GREAT staff!
review.reviewText: Loved my stay at the Hyatt. it was central to all the activity of union Square. The staff was extra friendly and went out of thier way to make our stay comfortable. Would def stay here again!

review.title: Reasonable price and good service
review.reviewText: Nice location, although a little distant from the BART or MUNI, the location is just about right. Close to shops, bars and restaurants. Nice room, was staying on 12/F and got a great sea view. And watching the sunset in the bar on the top floor is one thing you should not miss.

review.title: Rooms need freshened up.
review.reviewText: A typical Hyatt Hotel, if a little run down. Rooms nedd a coat of paint. We were promised a city view from every room but all we got was a view of the roofs of the adjoining buildings at the rear of the hotel. No coffee maker in room as promised, and why is there a bottle opener screwed to the bathroom door frame.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay. Friendly staf.

review.title: VERY NICE
review.reviewText: THE DOUBLE BEDS WERE SMALL BUT COMFORTABLE. THE ROOM WAS CLEAN AND WE HAD A GREAT VIEW. EVERYTHING WAS CLOSE TO WALK TO.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: View from room was less than desireable.

review.title: Wonderful Accommodations
review.reviewText: The Grand Hyatt San Francisco was fabulous. The service was perfect. The concierge desk was the most helpful I have ever experienced at any hotel. We were here for 5 nights and wouldn't change a thing.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: If you're planning on shopping and or wandering around downtown, stay here. If you're planning to go out to the suburbs, stay somewhere else.

review.title: A Nice Place...With Reservations
review.reviewText: There are many things to commend the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco, but water pressure at the bathroom sink and flush-ability of the commode are not among them. The bed was wonderful and the pillows comfy, so no complaints about the accomodations over all. We enjoy a soda or snack at night, and it was a huge disappointment to find the honor bar stocked with Diet Pepsi that was at least a month past its expiration date...and it was not all that cold, either. We enjoyed dining at the Grandviews Restaurant on the hotel's 36th floor. The view is indeed grand, the service excellent and the breakfast buffet wonderful. However, on a Sunday morning when the hotel was fairly full (this was Memorial Day weekend, and San Francisco State University had held commencement exercises the day before, which is why we were there) the manager decided not to open the second dining room. As a result, our party of four were kept waiting for nearly 40 minutes for a table. It delayed the start of our day and was not a pleasant experience. In addition, I ordered the smoked salmon/bagel with cream cheese, and the salmon tasted bland, as if it had not even been shown the flame, let alone smoked. It was disgusting, and our waiter never even asked if my good was okay. Our overall stay was very pleasant and the staff capable and friendly. We might stay there again.

review.title: Great hotel with a great location
review.reviewText: The hotels is in a great location right adjacent to Union Square. Make sure to take advantage of the bar on the 36th floor. You will experience some of the best views of San Francisco.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: I consider this probably the best location if you love to shop and don't want to do a lot of walking. It's convenient and the beds are extremely comfortable. Self service check out was easy. They have very friendly staff. Restaurant at the top has a nice view of the city.

review.title: not grand as posted
review.reviewText: the washrooms need to be updated; there were noises from the windows and was told it was due to the wind and some earthquake feature; beds were hard, complained, first person was aloof; night manager was equally the same; last straw was when the room was not done to standard, no response when phoned; finally did aftera w hile; overall poor service, did not seem to care about customers comfort or concerns ;not a 4 star hotel

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Service was great. Location was excellent ... right by Union Square, shopping, BART station, cable cars, etc.. The room was nice but worn, as there were some signs of aging (paint chips, fixtures). The bed was very comfortable. Room service was average. Restaurant on top floor was mediocre, but the view was fantastic ... especially from the bar overlooking the city.

review.title: Will return!
review.reviewText: Excellent in all respects. Conciege staff very helpful!

review.title: Exceeded expectations
review.reviewText: Location great, rooms comfortable(bathrooms alittle plain but adequate) Regency Club upgrade well worth the price food was of excellent quality and very friendly staff

review.title: Great Location; Want To Go Back In Two Months!
review.reviewText: We picked this hotel for our first vacation in San Francisco because of the central location of Union Square. The Cable Cars, Bus And Great eating locations like Lefty ODouls Could not be better. Coffee shop right in Union Square is fun too. The best part of the hotel is the very good information given, so helpful, by the hotel staff.

review.title: Comfortable with a great view
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The view was wonderful both from our room, as well as the restaurant and lounge. We did appreciate having a smoking room with the capability of opening the sliding glass door a small amount. Our only complaint would be not being able to get room service or being waited in the restaurant on Valentine's Day for dinner, and that is somewhat understandable.

review.title: Great area, but not as grand as one would expect.
review.reviewText: The hotel was in an excellent location. The room was clean, quite large for San Francisco and the service was excellent. The lobby was not as grand when compared to the Marriot or the Hilton, but this is minor considering everything else.

review.title: Grewat views and location
review.reviewText: No newsstand or gift shop in hotel-but other hotels nearby have.

review.title: Outstanding Customer Service!
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nice in terms of the room and the central Union Square location is fantastic for tourists. I travel very often, and the customer service provided at this hotel is second to none.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Nice Accomodations

review.title: Great views
review.reviewText: Great hotel, really well situated bang on Union Square. Ask for a room on a high floor for great views of the city and bay.

review.title: Room was not as updated as I would have thought.
review.reviewText: rooms not as updated. small tv

review.title: Very nice location!
review.reviewText: We thought the exhaust fan in the rest room was out of order and left the message on the coofe maker when we went out, and we got response and found a facial tissue sucked on the ceiling proving that the exhaust fan is working quietly when we came back. Nice equipment and service! They offered complimentary luggage storage after we checked out. The business center is small and offers only 10-minutes free internet access per stay (no matter how many days we stay... though we stayed for 7 nights). The best is the location! Union Square, Nob Hill, China Town are all in walk distance.It is convenient to everywhere in San Francisco, but away from the traffic noise while many others are located on cale car passing Powell Street or Market Street.

review.title: Standard Hotel, Nothing Memorable
review.reviewText: There was absolutely nothing wrong, and absolutely nothing special about the Grand Hyatt SFO. It really does blend into the same mold of standard business type hotels. Location is great of course.

review.title: Perfect Place to Stay During My Business Trip
review.reviewText: When I travel on business I look for a hotel that is clean comfortable, convenient to my place of business and of course reasonably priced. This hotel exceeded my expectations in all of those catagories which made my stay away from home enjoyable. I would recommend this hotel to other travelers.

review.title: Grand Hyatt Sadly Outdated
review.reviewText: I was surprised that a Grand Hyatt in such a great location would be so badly outdated. The furniture, decor, and bathrooms have not seen an update since the 80s. The room is not business-friendly at all (even most "leisure" travlers have computers with them these days, Grand Hyatt) -- there is no real desk, the only chairs are lounge chairs, and wifi costs $10 a day. The television was the same 15-year-old one I have at home. The only upgrades are comfy beds, nice bedding, and an ipod dock. The room was very clean, the service was fine, but overall it was a very disappointing experience due to the outdated style of the entire hotel.

review.title: Very nice place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: Hotel service was excellent and the rooms were very clean and comfortable. I would stay there again and recommend this hotel to my friends.

review.title: Already planning my next trip!
review.reviewText: This was an excellent stay. I highly recommend the few extra dollars to upgrade to club level. You are given free breakfast, afternoon snacks, evening desserts, free sodas a plenty and an honor bar that lets you pour your own drinks! The staff treat you like royalty. This is a hotel that makes your stay effortless from hailing cabs to even getting your ice. I am not joking folks, worth the money here!

review.title: Best Stay in the City
review.reviewText: We spent 3 nights at the Hyatt. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and accomodating. We got an early check in and a late check out with no problems, the front desk was super friendly and helpful - helping us navigate the city. The bar on the 36th floor has some great views. We only used the restaurant for breakfast, but it was very good and again, the staff was very attentive. Rooms were small, but very well furnished and comfortable. Room service was fast - and not all that expensive. Overall, it was an excellent stay and we will definitely be coming back.

review.title: Great hotel in Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a convienient location in downtown san fancisco. Had no problems at all with this hotel. Room and staff were great.

review.title: impressed
review.reviewText: I had a wounderful time at Grand Hyatt San Francisco. you should select this hotel

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: nice location

review.title: Awesome Location, Subpar Accomodations
review.reviewText: Overall I enjoyed staying at the Grand Hyatt. My wife and I went for a weekend away from the kids for a few days. You cannot beat the location, especially if you want to shop. It's close to everything and easy to catch a cable car/bus, or theater, movie, etc. However I expected the rooms to be a little bit nicer. The hotel had good staff, the room was clean, etc, but I felt like I was in a ubber expensive Holiday Inn. I was hoping for something a little more luxurious from a hotel on Union Square and called "The GRAND Hyatt". Just my two cents....

review.title: can't wait to go back again.
review.reviewText: Great location to start your sightseeing. very close to everything. good mix of restaurants close by and starbucks across the street. only 4 block walk from the bart station and one block off a cable car stop. we will definately be staying here again. loved it.

review.title: Great Location Too!
review.reviewText: This hotel is awesome. Perfect location to go anywhere, you don't need a car! Staff is top-notch. We even got Champagne and strawberries for our Anniversary!! However, we did have problems with housekeeping. We had a coffee pot, but no coffee or cups...then we got coffee and cups, then next day we had coffee again and no cups...we gave up on having coffee in room and just went to Starbucks across the street. All in all...we'd stay again as it's a great hotel.

review.title: New Year's Eve at the Grand Hyatt
review.reviewText: We checked in about 3pm on New Year's Eve; the staff were all absolutely attentive, and helpful...I had left some clothing and documents in the car (which was in Valet) and they ran and got the items and had them to my room in less than a half hour, is spite of the rush of check-ins. The room was outstanding (Luxury King) and the bed was so comfortable, we check the mattress to see the brand(Sealy Posturepedic Grand Pillowtop) so we could get one for our home...We returned late, after 2am, and our only issue was the lack of food choices at that late hour... We will definitely stay there next time in the City.

review.title: Location and service are the best of the hotel
review.reviewText: As soon as we arrive the front desk employees were very helpful to find a restaurant late at night. Parking is expensive. They have wonderful people at front door, always in a good moood and very attentive. My daughter got sick and they call the doctor, called back to know if we need anything, called and payed taxi for us to go to the hospital. WONDERFUL SERVICE!!!

review.title: Great Location: nice but not great rooms
review.reviewText: Had a problem with heating system but it was fixed. Bathroom needs to be spiffed up a bit given the hotel's location and the Grand Hyatt label. But the room was safe and comfortable, the location superb, so it's a good choice when the tariff is favorable.

review.title: Not very Grand
review.reviewText: I've stayed at the Grand Hyatt in Seattle and visited the Grand Hyatt in Kauai, and I must say that this Grand Hyatt does not even come close to measuring up. On the plus side, the service was pretty good, and we got a nice view. On the minus side, it's just old and plain. The bathrooms look really dated, and the TV is still a smallish CRT. The water pressure was terrible, and it went from hot to cold randomly. Our toilet stopped up. And our handicapped room didn't have a safe inside it (which makes no sense). There's really nothing "grand" about this hotel. It's a regular hotel in a good location, and we got a good price for it. We probably won't stay here again unless it is the only place available with a good deal.

review.title: Love to go back
review.reviewText: The food is great, and the staf is very nice, atentive. We had a beautiful time

review.title: Great Vacation
review.reviewText: I decided at the last moment to take the family to SF for a weekend trip. The location is great! Right next to Union Square. Plenty of places to get a fine meal and shop. Hotel staff was courtious and polite. Would stay here again in the future.

review.title: GREAT LOCATION
review.reviewText: GREAT HOTEL AND LOCATION!

review.title: Hyatt Style
review.reviewText: Booked this through Expedia with a "special rate" which was lower than Hyatt.com's "guaranteed lowest" - did not want to risk the Hyatt guarantee offer in case there was something in the small print I had not realised! The saving with Expedia was significant! Despite a request being put on the booking and my Hyatt frequent traveller number being included, this was not passed to the hotel, or they did not action it as my invoice showed no FT number and offered to enroll me! Got a room on the 4th floor (low) so it was quite noisy at night, however, the room was beautiful and the beds were very comfortable. Great amenities, everything you could want really. A very comfortable stay at a very good rate, and only a few metres away from Union Square itself.

review.title: Great holiday shopping overnight stay
review.reviewText: Nice overnight stay for shopping and a theater event. We were allowed to check in to our room at 10 a.m. and received a 2:00 late check out the next day - which was great! The front desk provided us with umbrellas. We will definitely stay there again for Christmas shopping and shows.

review.title: Great hotel for Holiday Shopping. Right in the heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at the Grand Hyatt Union Square. We had a beautiful room overlooking the ice rink in the square and a spectacular view of all the Holiday lights and decorated trees in the surrounding stores. The only minor negative is that we were suppose to get a food credit as part of our package, when I checked in they said it wasn't included. I did raise the issue again the next morning and they did then find that it was suppose to be included. All in all we had a great stay. The rooms were great and we all had a fanatastic time.

review.title: Royalty For A Weekend
review.reviewText: My husband planned this trip to celebrate my birthday. We were treated like royalty, above and beyond our expections. The location is centrally perfect and so is the view from the restaurant and lounge. Wow! We will return for sure!

review.title: Manage Your Own Luggage upon Check-in
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It's in a great central location and the room was clean and quiet. We found the staff in the Regency Club Lounge to be very friendly and helpful, as was the bellman who assisted us with our luggage upon check-out. We were disappointed however that at check-in, instead of the bellmen being there on the kerb waiting to assist arriving guests, they were inside the lobby (further in than Reception) chatting and expecting you to put your luggage on their trolleys when you had already done the work of getting your luggage into the hotel.

review.title: Most customer friendly
review.reviewText: Stayed all over the world and this has the most customer friendly staff of all. With one or more stationed just inside the front door the staff is anxious to answer any and all questions, resolve problems, give directions, in a warm and friendly way. Could better advertise the coffee "shop" on the mezzanine but a minor flaw.Clean, comfortable and roomy too.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Get location

review.title: Great Choice in San Fran
review.reviewText: The Grand Hyatt is one of our favorite places to stay in the City. It's well-located for shopping, cultural and entertainment uses, close enough to transit, and walkable to a large array of destinations. The staff is accessible and responsive. The rooms are comfortable and the bar has a fun atmosphere. This hotel is a favorite with foreign travelers, too, which adds a fun aspect to the ambiance.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Good Location...

review.title: We travel alot!
review.reviewText: At my price range, as good as you can get. I'm not an expense account person, don't use room service, etc. No issues whatsoever - I highly recommend!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Fine hotel great location and service. No complaints and staff was great. Highly recommended.

review.title: Good Hotel In A Great Location
review.reviewText: Recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt in August 2008. Overall the staff and condition of the hotel was great. I requested extra coffee, bathrobes when I checked in and they arrived within 5 minutes. I arrived early and waited in the rooftop bar for my room. The staff at the bar let me know the minute the room was ready. The hotel was completely full and they managed to provide very good service.

review.title: Good location but pretty ordinary and unmemorable
review.reviewText: Very well located near Union Square and restaurants and much better than the tacky hotels around Fisherman's Wharf. They couldn't give us the bay view we requested but we did get an upper floor. Paid extra for executive room and use of the executive lounge. Had to pay extra for drinks there, which is a bit much having paid the extra premium, but the view from there is lovely. You can take full breakfast in the main dining room on level 36 of hotel or the smaller buffet breakfast in the executive lounge on level 32. Parking charges are ridiculously high. Recommend you use the public car park directly opposite the hotel, although you'll have to park your own car! Overall verdict: ok but pretty impersonal and unmemorable. Advice: book your restaurant and Alcatraz visit well in advance.

review.title: Great hotel and location
review.reviewText: We were in San Francisco for a weeks vacation. The hotel location was great and near all the attractions. Very easy to get around, much within walking distance. Very friendly staff. I wish they had free coffee in the room but a Starbucks is across the street. View from the bar is great. Would stay here again.

review.title: Most bang for the buck!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is ideally located right next to Union Square. Our room had a great view of the East Bay/Financial district, was very comfortable but already showing its age. The staff is what makes this hotel superb! Very friendly, attentive and very efficient! Requests met very promptly (for example, extra pillows & blankets requested delivered in less than 5 minutes!).

review.title: Not Very Clean
review.reviewText: This hotel wasn't as nice as it claimed. When we first arrived, there was gum stuck on one of the armchairs and a bloodstain on the shower curtain. Also, one night we came back to find false eyelashes on the bathroom floor (no one in our room wore false lashes). Additionally, I needed to use the business center and was expecting a a room was many computers and equipment and saw that it only contained two computers and there was a wait. On a brighter note, the location of the hotel is great and the ladies at the concierge were very helpful.

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText: We enjoyed staying in Union Square. This hotel is walking distance to Chinatown, which we visited several times during our stay. The Concierge was very helpful. We booked our Alcatraz tour online, and it was a good thing we did, as it was sold out.

review.title: Very disappointing...
review.reviewText: Our arrival at the hotel set us off in a bad way. We were rushed through the door by a member of staff who clearly had no time for pleasantries. Then the lady who checked us in held us up for 15 minutes as she didn't understand what rooms we had booked. It was impossible to communicate with her. The hotel room itself was quite nice and fairly comfortable but not really what you'd expect from a four-star. The view was the worst part as we looked out at a building and several rooftops, unable to actually San Francisco. We also had to call a plummer to our rooms everyday as the toilets weren't working properly. I would say the best thing about the hotel was the room service. The staff who delivered it were well-mannered and there was a wide selection of food and drinks. The location of the hotel is also fantastic. There is a Starbucks opposite the street; Macy's and Westfield mall are about a 3 and 6 minute walk; Walgreens is just around the corner and the tour buses stop a minute or two down the road. Overall I would say both the hotel and San Francisco were incredibly underwhelming and I wouldn't recommend either. If you are set on going to San Francisco, the Grand Hyatt wouldn't be a bad place to stay if you were planning on being out of the hotel a lot and wanted one in a great location. Just don't expect to feel very welcomed!

review.title: clean, comfy, courteous
review.reviewText: no the jazziest or fanciest of the lot, but the staff were on-pointe, the rooms were clean and comfortable, room service was quick and tasty, and they're right in the heart of union square...cheers!

review.title: Can't wait ti go back
review.reviewText: great hotel, excellent service and the location can't be beat!

review.title: Good SF Hotel
review.reviewText: Right in the heart of the city. Good location. Friendly staff. Valet parketing very expensive $50+ daily. Clean.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The service at the Grand Hyatt was anything BUT grand! I was given a room on the lowest floor facing the back of another building. I was charged for mini-bar items when none were removed and had to bring it to the attention of the staff. The same front desk clerk gave me incorrect information about the hotel amenities and local attractions on all three of my inquiries to here. Nobody at this hotel seems to know what is going on and/or they just don't care.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: We found this a great location for our trip with 2 teenagers. We walked to Chinatown, enjoyed Union Square shops, walked to MOMA and were only a block from cable car route. Bus lines filled in the longer trips. So easy to get around inthis great city.

review.title: Can't wait to go back! Very comfy & convenient hotel
review.reviewText: As another guest posted: LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!! The hotel is quiet, updated, staff are very nice and helpful(especially the doormen)and so many things are just right outside the door. The beds were very comfy and the view was beautiful from floor to ceiling windows on the 26th floor. We did turn our air down to 60 degrees and shut the curtains during the day while we were gone because the sun does heat up the room. It was really neat to turn off all the lights at night before bed to enjoy the night view though. Room was a little small but for two girls on the town who weren't there but to sleep it was perfect. If you pop in for a power nap be sure to put out the privacy sign or housekeeping will knock to check the room bar! That was my fault though. I loved everything about SF and can't wait to visit again.

review.title: Grand Hyatt - San Fran
review.reviewText: excellent hotel and excellent location.

review.title: i'm impressed
review.reviewText: impressed with the quality of food and services of my room service, good food and reasonable prices.....Am really happy that i chose this hotel, will surely come back to stay at The Grand Hyatt...

review.title: I like Hyatts. This one is very well located for a trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Good hotel. Showers could be improved. Room service slow and pricey. Nevertheless, overall is very good. Location is great for San Francisco. Staff is very helpful and friendly. Quality place.

review.title: Honeymoon in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was great... Valet is expensive so we ended up using the parking garage across the street. It is half the cost.

review.title: Nagging Details Brings Rating To Just Average
review.reviewText: Great location, clean, nice room, great view, comfy bedding with polite and professional service. But...the bathroom was a big disappointment. First, the door was a folding one that when closed it left a 4 inch gap, so no privacy there. All the light switches were outside the bathroom. The toilet had an auto flush that sounded like a jet liner taking off. And at 4 am that would certainly wake anyone up that may be there in the same room. It could not be turned off either. The 3 (only-not luscious) towels were placed by the toilet not anywhere near the sink or tub. It was just weird. It felt stark and military like which is not what I look for when I go on vacation. For a 4 star hotel this one lost a star over these nagging details. Oh, and don't forget to bring your own shower cap, etc. They only provide shampoo and conditioner and not much of it. I guess they are cutting back.

review.title: Right on Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is comfortable and clean with excellent service from the staff. It is easy walking to all shopping, theaters and fine restaurants. Can't beat it,

review.title: I'll definitely be back here!
review.reviewText: This is a magnificent location to stay in San Francisco. Union Square is no more than a two minute walk and the choice of shops, restaurants and bars is great. The staff at the Grand Hyatt were excellent. We stayed here for five nights and our choice of hotel was spot on. We didn't use any of the hotel facilities other than the bar, so I can't comment on the food services. I loved San Francisco and the friendly atmosphere in the city. I look forward to my return to this wonderful location and hotel.

review.title: very convenient
review.reviewText: to shopping, chinatown, public transportation. You can print your boarding passes free at the computer by the front desk.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: htel was excellent, service from the staff was by far the best we have ever experienced. beds were very comfortable. location of hotel was great very easy to fing your way around the city. only gripe and its a small one, we have never had to pay for coffee for the in-room coffee machine when we have stayed in the states before.

review.title: Great Hotel in a good city location
review.reviewText: My wife booked this hotel for me for my 40th birthday. The room we had was just like the king room picture on the web site. We were on the 12th floor at the front of the hotel, fantastic view of the City and Bay. I was very pleased. The only complaint I had was no complimentary coffee, however Starbucks was just across the street. The staff were very pleasant and the concierge were extremely helpful with any bookings we required for trips, restaurants and transport. Ideal location as on Union Square, shops galore and public transport was easily accessible, buses running all over the place and only $1.50. The underground and Bart system were not far on Powell Street. We love the American public transport and as such see no need to hire a car when we are visiting. If we do go back to San Francisco we would love to stay at the Grand Hyatt again, however other than this holiday we are always on a tight budget, so would most likely stay in a cheaper two star hotel :-(. All I can say is I loved the Grand Hyatt.

review.title: Nice surprise
review.reviewText: When I booked our room at the Grand Hyatt I was a little hisitent because it was downtown and some of my past experience with these older hotels wasn't good, but from the time I stopped at the valet parking until I got to my room I continued to be impressed. The rooms where clean and newly decorated. The beds where outstanding and the consierge was very helpful in pointing us in the right direction as far a dining. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitly come back again.

review.title: Fabulous place to stay at
review.reviewText: The service in the Grand Hyatt was fantastic. Nothing was never too much to please us. All Staff were lovely and very helpful at all times.

review.title: not entirely clean
review.reviewText: found a hair in tub when we arrived and there was a half toothpick outside our door for 3 days

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: We have stayed in this hotel many times, it remains clean and well cared for. The staff is helpful and courteous..it is extremely convenient to all shopping, theaters and many fine restaurants. I would recommend it.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location at the edge of China Town in the financial district. Good restraunts close by. The lounge on the 36th floor is a great place to have a few cocktails.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel had a nice and convenient location. Rooms were somewhat dated but clean and nice. Room Service was not great and with so many food options so close next time I will not bother with room service.

review.title: Great location, very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: The most important things in a hotel on business for me are comfort, cleanliness, location, and internet in room. This hotel excels at all of these.

review.title: Convenient location; helpful staff
review.reviewText: Located in a very good location immediately north of Union Square. We requested a smoking room by calling the hotel directly a couple days prior, but it apparently never got noted on our reservation and we received a non-smoking room instead. Not too big of a deal, I suppose. One quirky thing about the room was that the router for wired internet service was controlled by a switch that also powered a lamp on and off. (A helpful IT guy they had on-site came to the room and showed us what the problem was.) The conceirge was helpful in helping us find our way around the city (although you'll probably want to spend a couple bucks to get a large map of the city as well). Also booked a towncar back to SFO (the BART trip to the hotel from SFO was a little sketchy at 11 p.m.) through the conceirge without any problems. All in all, I'd more than likely stay there again on my next trip to SF.

review.title: Easy Access
review.reviewText: We've stayed at the Grand Hyatt right off of Union Square for 3 years during the Holidays and it is always great! You will probably have to pay $20. fee per day for car valet parking though. But the hotel has all the amenities and an incredible top of the hotel restaurant. Also, during the holidays the decor and miniature Xmas collection in the windows is something to see.

review.title: Will stay here again!
review.reviewText: This hotel is conveniently located, especially for those who like to shop and dine. It is only a cable car ride away from the Wharf. Service staff is polite and friendly. Room is clean with a great view (I was on the 23rd floor). Will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Good stay
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay both for the convienient location and the most comefortable beds. Service was prompt and courteous. This is our second stay and we will probbly return next year.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: It is nicely located in Union square: walking distance to high ended shopping areas (within 5 mins range), easy access to Starbucks, bars, restaurants. Hotel is ok with reasonable good services. However, Parking is expensive, $50 plus a 24 hr period. I found it is so close to China town and great food!

review.title: Not worthy the Grand Hyatt name
review.reviewText: Great location in Union Square. The bed is very comfortable. Room is definitely showing its age. Definitely not worth being called a Grand Hyatt. Internet cost $10 per day. Parking is $47.50 per day if you are driving. You do the math. There are better options in SF for similar price.

review.title: Great hotel to stay in & convenient location
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at the Grand Hyatt. We check in a little late and they upgraded us to a VIP room with a fantastic view of Union Square. Beautiful christmas decoration and warm cookies & milk really set the holiday mood. We will definitely go back again.

review.title: Great hotel for a stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The staff at this hotel made it, along with the position of the hotel, right on Union Square. The staff were so friendly, and helpfull. Always ready to answer any question you may have. You were so close to all the main shops, and not far by tram to the waterfront. If thinking of going to stay in San Francisco dont hesitate in booking this hotel you will have a great time.

review.title: Could hear rats in the walls.
review.reviewText: We stood in RM 523 and were unable to sleep on account of the sound of rats running back and forth within the wall. I told the front desk and they blew it off saying that the building was old. Funny that we did not hear anything on our first night but on the second night the noise was very loud and kept us awake.

review.title: Very good place to stay
review.reviewText: The location is perfect for the holidays and close to the business district, which is one or two BART stops away. We could walk to many downtown San Francisco stores and museums. The restaurants at the hotel were wonderful and the one on the top floor provided wonderful, wonderful views. The room was very comfortable and the room service was great. However, there was gum in one part of the rug, which was puzzling. And during checkout time, part of our party waited for 20 minutes for an elevator. The charge for parking is comparable to other nearby hotels, but still expensive. Our view was of rooftops, further blocked by the back of a very tall building.

review.title: Wonderful Weekend - Great Location
review.reviewText: Stayed 12/7-9/2007 for a romantic getaway from Vegas. The hotel is located right off union square. Walking distance to China Town (2 blocks) and taxis and cable cars galore. Only two negatives - noise from union square echos up to rooms facing union square and can get annoying and water temp/pressure not 100%. Restaurant at top was not "top notch" - food was mediocre, bar a little pricey but views are amazing. Would definately stay again. San Fran locals very friendly! Use the Starbucks across the street for a great quick breakfast and skip the $40 bgel and coffee in the hotel.

review.title: Great Concierge Services
review.reviewText: I was able to e-mail the concierge desk and they took very good care of me! They made excellent dining choices and reservations and helped us book some sight seeing tours that were fabulous. Rooms were comfortable and staff was very attentive.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: This hotel offers visitors to San Francisco a fantastic base from which to explore this amazing city. It has arguably the best location with amazing views from its top floor restaurant/bar over the city skyline. The staff are extremly efficient and curtious and the rooms are spacious and clean throughout with all the necessary facilities to your disposal. They evem offer free check in facilities for your return flight from the Reception area.

review.title: looking out on the fog
review.reviewText: After a long journey from UK via Chicago, upon arrival at the hotel all I wanted was a warm shower and a comfortable bed. Yet upon check-in, the high standards of service were apparent and the staff welcoming. The receptionist sought out a room with a better view higher up the tower than the one I had booked. I ended up on the 22nd floor with a view across the bay. Yet, unfortuneately for most of my stay it was foggy and I couldn't see beyond Macy's across Union Sq. adjacent to the hotel. Not the hotel's fault! All the staff were courteous,welcoming and paid a great deal of attention to making certain my stay was as comfortable as possible. The beds were very comfortable and the room well laid out and uncluttered. I would suggest that free WIFI internet access comes as part of the cost of the room. Finally, something I do not often say, I would stay here again, definitely.

review.title: grand hyatt sf
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, the restaurant was even nicer the front desk response time was not good until I lied about something being broken then they were there quickly

review.title: Will Stay Here Again
review.reviewText: We loved our stay, the staff was great and wonderful service. The bathrooms need to be updated but that didn't matter too much. We had a beautiful view. The location is wonderful - close to all the shopping and resturants that you could want - quick cab ride to the Warf. We have stayed here before - 8 times, and will on our next visit.

review.title: Would highly recommend, enjoyed the regency lounge, and fitness center
review.reviewText: Enjoyed my stay, hotel staff very friendly, helpful. Only problem was getting a cab to go out to dinner.

review.title: very good hotel centrally located
review.reviewText: I took my own kettle as we did not have a coffee machine for the first night and I did report this to Housekeeping, on the second night they bought one upto the room with another call to them. On checking out we had a bill for the COMPLIMENTARY coffee which we did not pay.

review.title: Will definitely stay at this hotel again!
review.reviewText: The service was excellent!

review.title: Still a good place to stay
review.reviewText: We've stayed at this hotel before and had wonderful times. It's a great location at Union Square. However, this time we were unhappy with the condition of our room. When we arrived, even though the room looked clean, there were sunflower seed shells all over the carpet, a half-empty bottle of coke in the refrigerator and some kind of pill/medication on the floor. How did these items get missed by housekeeping? The worst part was the hair dryer would not stay on for more than approx. 30 minutes - sometimes for only 5 seconds. Had to call twice to get someone to come up. Breakfast up in their restaurant is outrageously overpriced, but we had a deal that included it, so it worked out ok. My husband said he wouldn't stay there again, but I would give it another chance.

review.title: A few hiccups but overall very good...
review.reviewText: The beginning of our trip started off with a few hiccups but overall the Hyatt was a very nice place to stay. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived (we were early) so we asked them to store our bags so we could get a bite to eat while we waited. When we returned 90 minutes later, our bags were on the cart still sitting in the lobby. This was very disconcerting to us as we had all our clothes, electronics, cell phones and travel docs in our luggage. We did consume a few drinks from the mini-bar in our room and found via the tv based billing service that we had been charged $26.04 multiple times during our stay for no apparent reason. Hyatt employees were VERY quick to apologize and correct these charges. It just required us to repeatedly check our bill. I will say the employees and specifically the concierge were PHENOMENAL. The concierge assisted us numerous times during our stay including getting our tickets for Alcatraz rebooked because we missed our scheduled time. This is no easy feat and they pulled it off. Not to mention helping us with restaurants, bars and the Hyatt car service. They were truly amazing.

review.title: Expensive
review.reviewText: Our Hotel stay was good the only negative issues experienced were room service charges to our room which were not ours and the supplied coffee maker did not come with coffee $8 to use it.

review.title: Wonderful!!!!
review.reviewText: Top notch hotel, great location, wonderful staff...book it now...don't bother with anyplace else. Room spacious, clean, great view, great price. Concierge, front door, front desk, top notch! Would go back tomorrow if I could!

review.title: great location, great service
review.reviewText: everything is perfect. i had a great stay there. just a stone's throw away from Union Square -- China Town, Fin District, Theater Area and Shopping centers, SOMA are all close by. It is so convenient. The room service is great.

review.title: Great location for shopping
review.reviewText: This hotel is ideally suited for those wanting to spend some time shopping in San Francisco. The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly. We got an upgraded room with breakfast included for free, which was quite nice. The hotel is very close to a tram stop point, so getting one of those infamous trams up and over the hills is easy to do.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: I would not consider this hotel a 4 star. More like a 3. If you are looking for something newer and more up to date this is not the hotel for you. Not worth the price that we paid.

review.title: great place
review.reviewText: The room was nice. Bed extremely comfortable. service was excellent. the conceige service was excellent. the hotel was 1/2 block off union square. would return and recommend the hotel.

review.title: Grand Hyatt Was Very Grand Indeed!
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel. The staff were more than accomdating to me. The rooms were very comfortable and always clean. I enjoyed the breakfast buffet. I couldn't have asked for a more comfortable stay during my trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Grand Hyatt San Francisco delight
review.reviewText: Our recent stay at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco's Union Square was delightful. The room was spacious, clean and well appointed. The concierges were helpful with tour arrangements and very cordial as were most of the staff. The only complaint would be the poor quality of the complimentary shampoo. It should not take half a bottle of shampoo to work up a lather on short hair. It smelled nice but just did not get the job done efficiently. The location was great as it was close to cable cars, Chinatown and major shopping. Access to all the sights was handily available and I would certainly stay there again.

review.title: Good for early AM flights
review.reviewText: Located along a scenic walkway that's good for a run. Easy drive to the airport.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Centrally-located

review.title: Good hotel at great spot
review.reviewText: I stayed at several hotels in SF in past many years. This is the first time I stay at Grand Hyatt, and I had a good experience. It is conveniently located right next to Union Square, so there are plenty of shopping. There are several bus stops nearby, making it easy to get around. While the room is somewhat small, it is very clean, cozy, and comfortable. It has some nice little perks like TV in the bathroom and coffee machine. View from my room is not great, but I can peek out of the window to see Union Square. I had a good experience there.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is within short walking distance of shopping and several modes of transportation. We had very good advice from the concierge. We were three adults booked into a room with two double beds but front desk was able to provide a room on 16th floor overlooking Union Square that had a king size bed and a very comfortable cot. Lots of room in the bathroom and the room itself. Would highly recommend this hotel based on our four night stay.

review.title: San Fran Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay in union square. Close to all types of transporation. Easy to get around from this hotel. Very friendly staff and nice clean hotel. Would recommend and go back :)

review.title: very good,central location to all
review.reviewText: excellant place to stay in s.f. near all actractions.

review.title: Room was OK
review.reviewText: For a 4 star hotel, things should have been nicer. The room had no padding just carpet, wallpaper kind of cheap. $4.00 for a snickers come on.

review.title: Very enjoyable, great location, pricey
review.reviewText: The hotel is quite nice and ideally located next to union square and very much shopping. It is a nice walk to tourist attractions. The hotel staff were relatively helpful but not fantastic. The rooms are smaller but quite comfortable and nicely set-up. Very clean. I would recommend this hotel

review.title: Great Hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Upgrade to the top floors. Well worth it - view is fabulous and the "Private lounge" with free drinks and food is great. Great location too!

review.title: Good Hotel Great Location
review.reviewText: The Grand Hyatt near Union Square is perfectly located for visiting and shopping in San Francisco. You are within two or three blocks of every department and designer store and always within walking distance of many of the best eating places. For a tourist you cannot locate much better.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is on Union Square which for me is the best location in San Francisco. The view fron the 36th floor is spectacular

review.title: Nice, but not overly impressed
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, but the rooms are average. There is no living area in the rooms, only the standard bed, desk and chair. Bed is also average, not up to the new standards of nicer hotels. Staff is very courteous and helpful. The hotel itself is clean and in good condition. The exercise facilities are top notch and the view from the top level bar is fantastic.

review.title: I'm impressed
review.reviewText: That was a nice view from the restaurant, and really close to the union square in san francisco.

review.title: We found the hotel very nice and would go back again.
review.reviewText: We found the hotel was great and we will revisit it the next trip to San Francisco

review.title: Great stay, great location
review.reviewText: We just stayed for an overnight but enjoyed a beautiful and comfortable room, polite staff, and delicious complimentary American breakfast. Great location in Union Square.

review.title: Best Location to Stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is well maintained and guest are taken care of very well. The entire staff especially the Concierge staff was always helpful in answering all questions as far as using the local transportation system and restaurants around San Francisco. The location is right in the center of the action in the city and steps from Union Square and shopping. The in house bar and restaurant has wonderful food and with its excellent view of the city it cant be beat!!!

review.title: Loved this hotel
review.reviewText: Went here with 6 other moms for Mother's Day weekend. Rooms were very clean and beautiful. Received a great deal through Expedia. None of us women knew how to use the muni transit system but were wonderfully educated by the concierge. These people are amazing! Every direction they gave us was perfect and very professional. Grand Hyatt has the best beds and pillows! Will definitely come here again and refer to everyone I know. Great Union Square location - easy access to shops, food, coffee, transportation. Perfect stay. Perfect location.

review.title: The Not So Grand Hyatt, where Service isn't everything!
review.reviewText: From not getting extra towels, broken remotes, to unchanged linens, and non working hotel keys. My guests and I will never stay here again. For such a beautiful and expensive hotel, I expected quality for what I was paying. I guess it cost extra to get service. We requested towels and 3 calls/3 hours later we got them. Later that night we discovered our TV remote didn't work and requested a new one. No one came. The next morning we called again to replace the remote. The maintenance guy asked why we didn't call sooner. We informed him we did and he said he was never informed by anyone of our request. Well a new cable box later and we had a working TV. Then that morning before we left our room we requested for all our linens and towels to be changed, plus we needed 4 extra towels. Of course later that day when we return the beds were fixed but the linens were not changed and of course no extra towels. Well needless to say we were late to the wedding we were supposed to be at as a result of waiting for extra towels. Last but not least the last straw was when we returned that evening none of our three keys worked to let us in our room. Tired and frustrated we went to the front desk and at that point demanded for a main manager to call us first thing in the morning. It seems that one incident by itself would have been okay but all of these events put together shows me they do not value their customers.

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: The hotel is ideally placed near union sq close to bars, food and cable cars on all lines. The staff were helpful and friendly and the room could not be faulted. would definately recommend this hotel.

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: This Hotel sits right in the middle of everything! Short trips to everything a vacationer wants to see were easily handled by cab, trolley and walking. You won't need a car. The consierge service was excellent. Dinner at the Grand Views was forgettable and expensive, skip it. The room was clean and neat and what can I say, it was a motel room. Go outside! You're in San Francisco!

review.title: Outstanding hotel. Looking forward to going back. Great location and service
review.reviewText: The check-in procedure was smooth and hassle-free. The room was clean and the beds are amazingly comfortable. Another nice touch to the rooms are the windows, which stretch from floor to ceiling, giving you a great view. The location of the hotel is great. It is located right next to Union Square. From the hotel to Fishermans Wharf costs about $8-10 in a taxi and you can pretty much walk everywhere else quickly.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Great location and the hotel service was good but the furnitures and overall feel of the place seemed run-down. Also the bathroom wasn't as clean as I would prefer it to be. I would stay here again just because of the location.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel's location is extraordinary. It is at walking distance of San Francisco's heart, Union Square. Good shopping and restaurants nearby.

review.title: Good Hotel, No complaints
review.reviewText: We went to San Francisco partly to sightsee and partly to visit nearby colleges with my 11th-grade son. We were four people: two teenagers and two parents. I was very happy to receive connecting rooms, which are not guaranteed, but they gave them to us with no problem at all. The rooms were perfectly clean and comfortable. The beds were great, the pillows were comfortable, the bathroom amenities were decent quality (not luxurious, but not low-quality either. Everyone at the hotel was very nice and helpful. On the last day, we had to check our bags in a checkroom while we walked around the city and the checkroom guy was very nice and friendly. He made us feel it was a pleasure to help us out. Also, the concierge desk was really helpful with directions, restaurant and other suggestions. All the info we needed to get around the city was available at the hotel with very little effort. They had a nice and well-kept exercise room with personal TV's in each exercise machine, which I had never seen before.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Ideally located next to cable cars and Union Square. Very comfortable beds. Staff,if anything were overly helpful.

review.title: Don't buy breakfast at Hyatt
review.reviewText: We spend a week in the Grand Hyatt and were very pleased with our room with a view at the 26e floor. What we did not like at all is the breakfast policy. We had vouchers for a business plan continental breakfast, meaning you get pastries, coffee and jus. Only one day we had croissants, all other days there was just a very limited choice of sweet pastries: muffins and cake. You are able to have French bread and cheese but you pay extra and the next they were out of French bread too! When asking for it, the waiter got us toast, to make up. So the service is good but the policy is not. A full, reasonable breakfast with fruit and eggs will cost you around 25 bucks. Way to expensive for what you get!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The Grand Hyatt is in a great location with easy access to shopping and transportation lines. The conceierge staff was particularly helpful and made wonderful recommendations. Some of the staff had difficulty with the English language, which made it difficult to place requests over the phone. Room was clean, well-maintained, and on the small side.

review.title: Terrible, not a four star at all
review.reviewText: Had a terrible experience. Rooms and showers are dated and old. Had to change rooms THREE times in two days because of shower issues (that engineer couldnt fix) and door lock issues. Terrible service, was only offered breakfast and even then, the breakfast manager was not informed and so she ended up charging me!!! I had to chase them down to get my credit. no one really apologized. A terrible hotel in a fantastic city.

review.title: Hot Water Problems
review.reviewText: We experienced problems with the hot water in the morning hours while showering the water would turn cold and stay cold. We notified the fron desk and was told by the desk clerk " there is not much they can do about it" the next morning the hot water turned cold again. The hotel staff are friendly but, will stay at another hotel next time we travel to San Fransico.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Although a nice place to stay, with comfortable rooms. The service was poor: beds not made every day, no tea making facility and had to pay for coffee. Reception staff not very helpful. Despite this, view from bar at top of hotel exceptional.

review.title: Excellent Location in Union Square
review.reviewText: Excellent Hotel in an excellent location right on Union Square within easy walking distance of Chinatown and the cable car turnaround point to Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Grand Hyatt San Fran
review.reviewText: The only thing the hotel lacked was choices of breakfast foods. I am big on breakfast sometimes its the only real meal I get a chance to eat. The hotel was sparkling clean. The staff was Great- very professional and well groomed. The lady cleaning my room (1116)did a wonderful job. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who goes to San Fran.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The views from the 36th floor is spectacular. The rooms lacked some amenities ( no online access. The service was good.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Right in the middle of everything San Francisco, this place was a gem.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Location couldn't be better, right on Union Square. Very comfortable room. Much quieter than some of the other San Francisco hotels I have stayed in. Concierge always recommended excellent restaurants nearby. Check-in took less than 30 seconds. Airline bording pass printer in lobby is really handy for return flight.

review.title: Can't Wait To Go Back
review.reviewText: Staying at the Grand Hyatt downtown San Francisco was one of the best choices I could have made. So convenient to EVERYTHING. The hotel was clean and comfortable. Staff was at your service 24/7. Will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I would stay at this hotel again because of its location to union square and closeness to China town. Getting around town was also easy to do from this location. You are able to catch a trolley to to wharf, cabs, or even the bus to other areas of the city. Plus the staff at the hotel was very helpful and nice.

review.title: My Second Stay
review.reviewText: I've stayed at the Grand Hyatt twice now and found it was even better the second time around. The convenience of location was appreciated as well as the very nice 24 hour access fitness room. The view from the restaurant was fantastic. The drinks were okay, nothing special, but that view was quite dramatic overlooking the city. The rooms were well kept and the bed was extra comfortable.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location for shopping, entertainment and access to public transportation.

review.title: It was wonderful
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time staying at the Grand Hyatt. The concierge desk was very helpful. We were totally new to the city and had no idea where to eat and they gave us 3 choices after we described what type of food we were looking for. I would have liked to have had a lower priced restaurant say for coffee or breakfast, in the hotel rather than such a pricey one.

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean - rooms were comfortable. The location was great.

review.title: Good business hotel choice.
review.reviewText: The hotel has a great location and the beds are wonderful.

review.title: Excellent Location and excellent service
review.reviewText: I stayed there with some friends for New Years and we loved the location of the hotel, it's right in the middle of everything, specially the stores. The service is excellent, everybody was really nice, specially the concierge who helped us with the tours and the restaurant reservations. The only but that i found was the size of the room, it was really small, i don't know if it had something to do that we asked for a smoking room, but it was really small. But other than that I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Excellent view & right on Union Square
review.reviewText: I stayed on the 23rd floor, with a huge window looking out on the financial district skyline. I imagine most rooms here have good views. The location on Union Square is a great convenience. The restaurant upstairs was overpriced, in my opinion. The food was fine, not fabulous, but the view was wonderful.

review.title: Excellent Shopping spot
review.reviewText: Excellent location within walking distance of major shopping areas eg. Chinatown, Westfield mall, Union Square. Clean room but bathroom needs better maintenance. Concierge desk seems to have helpful staff but too busy- could use more help in that desk.

review.title: Christmas at the Hyatt
review.reviewText: I had to open the door with my bags as the doormen talked about there holiday plans, and did not assist me. Coffee was not provided when i checked in and i had to contact housekeeping for replacments.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel accomodations were excellent. I can't wait to come back. There is one doorman that was lazy and would not call us a cab and try to convince us that the limo to go 5 blocks was cheap for $30.00. It cost $6.25 by cab. The lounge also needs help. We could not get any decent service. 1 drink in 3 1/2 hours and it took 45 minutes to get the 1st one.

review.title: It was centrally located
review.reviewText: It was very nice, clean, prompt service and centrally located. The price was right for the room and the service.

review.title: Best hotel stay ever in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The rooms were lovely and clean. We were warmly welcomed by a very friendly staff. The location was great. Only flaw was hotel must have given our rooms away early because there was a knock on the door at 8:30 a.m. by two people who said that we had their room!

review.title: Great central location.
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the SF Grand Hyatt. The location was virtually on Union Square with cable car stops very close as well as bus lines and many cabs. The hotel rooms seemed to have been recently renovated as they were beautiful, new, clean and contemporary. The bedding was quite luxurious (the nicest I've seen in a hotel). There seemed to be a shortage of common area seating both in the lobby as it is very small for the hotel and the bar as well, we didn't stay for a drink as there was no available seating. The staff was very courteous and helpfull. The only strange thing we noticed was that you had to purchase through the mini bar the coffee packet to make coffee in the room. Not a big deal but the first hotel that didn't provide the courtesy packets of coffee next to the coffee maker that I've seen. A little frugal for such a nice hotel I thought, not to worry... Star Bucks is across the street form the main entrance. We had breakfast up at the top floor restaurant, it was delicious and we enjoyed the great views. We'll definatly return to this hotel.

review.title: High Quality Service, Great Location, Great Price
review.reviewText: I have stayed in many hotels in San Francisco, and, for me, the Grand Hyatt offers the very best in terms of service, location and price. Its location puts you very near the financial district, the best shopping, wonderful restaurants, China Town, and the heart-beat of the city. Only one block away from the cable car on Union Square, guests can access San Francisco's Fishermans Wharf and other bayside attractions using the city's most famous attraction.

review.title: Hotel staff needs better training at service
review.reviewText: Overall a great hotel. Staff is friendly but need to pick up better attitudes dealing with customers. There was a codde maker in the bathroom with a note stated that complementary coffee is in the Refreshment center. However the use of the coffee was not complementary - the charge was not a big sum but they gave the wrong impression or even misisnformation.

review.title: Great Location, Needs a Little Work
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel cannot be beat. It is in the middle of almost everything and is within walking distrance of multiple modes of public transit that will get you to everything else. BUT, the rooms could use a bit of updating. Newer Hyatts are much nicer.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: great hotel. can't beat the location....you're right in the heart of union square. nice accomadations.

review.title: Elegant accommodations in a great location
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The room was beautiful and the bed was very comfortable. You could hear a bit of noise from the street because there was so much going on in this desirable location.

review.title: clean, nice and great location
review.reviewText: Location is terrific, near all major shopping, restaurants and sites. the hotel it self was clean and the people were somewhat friendly.

review.title: Very comfortable
review.reviewText: Pleasant service, convenient location to downtown shopping, cable cars and BART. You have to be quick getting to the elevators because they don't dawdle in picking up, but racing the elevator quickly became a game. I will consider staying here again next year.

review.title: Great Location in SF - Long Elevator waits
review.reviewText: GH has one of the best locations for shopping, restaurants, and the cable car stop is a 2 minute walk. We had a great stay and the service was great. We visited during the holidays and my only complaint was the elevators; there were consistently large groups of people in line for elevators in the lobby which was an annoyance. Not sure if this was just holiday volume or lack of elevators.

review.title: Great place!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the Grand Hyatt.. the service was great and the room very comfortable! With the hotel right on Union Square, it was close to everything! We had a wonderful vacation and would definitely recommend the Grand Hyatt!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: If your significant other loves to shop, this would be a great location. You are walking distance from all the stores.

review.title: Our favorite hotel for Christmas shopping in San Francisco.
