review.reviewText: The hotel is well located for shoppng in San Francisco. The staff are friendly and helpful. The Grandview restaurant at the hotel is superb. The new beds they've recently put in are very confortable.

review.title: Good, moderate quality. Consistent
review.reviewText: Found the hotel comfortable, reasonable in price, especially for the location, very close to Union Station. We used services of the concierge, and that was VERY helpful getting dinner set up last moment on a holidiay. The bed was comfortable, but the comforter is too much heat. Blankets suggested. We were a bit put off with the charge for coffee from the mini bar of $3.00 each pot to make our own.

review.title: Excellent location-right on Union Square
review.reviewText: Only stayed one night, so didn't really use any of the services. Check-in was prompt & they offered connecting rooms (we had 2 reserved since we brought kids) w/o me needing to ask, and check-out was easy: could do it over the phone or on the TV, so didn't need to stand in line. Restaurant's view was GORGEOUS, but we didn't eat there (expensive). Xmas decorations in the lobby were REALLY cute; kept my 2 year-old occupied for over an hour!

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Walking easy to stores and restaurants. A STARBUCKS is across the street!! Would go back to this hotel again.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: I would not recomend this hotel to anyone. We had problems with room service twice and the TV in the bathroom had to be fixed to work. The staff was a little rude everytime we interacted with them except when we brought up problems. The room was small. We thought that for the price and the brand name this would be a very nice hotel, but it was far from that.

review.title: I left my heart there
review.reviewText: Convenience to everyting downtown excellent Wonderful beds Great view Helpful staff

review.title: Excellent Location - Excellent Staff and Service!!
review.reviewText: This is a wonderful hotel for any leisure traveler or a business traveler (depending on where your business needs to be conducted). It is ON Union Square, where all the major stores are as well as within a short walk to the famous trolley cars that will take you down to Fisherman's Wharf. In addition it is a short walk into historic Chinatown and a short cab ride anywhere and everywhere you want to visit in SF. The Concierge staff is ABSOLUTELY incredible. Don't go at SF alone! Ask them for recomendations for restaurants, tours, and places to visit. We were there for 5 days, and they were 100% dead on with their recs! Every reccomendation they (different person each time we visited the desk, but equally friendly and helpful) made was absolutely delicious, fun, detailed, and well worth our time and money to do! All in all, enjoy your visit...and remember to bring your camera for some great pictures!

review.title: Location, location, location!
review.reviewText: I can't say enough! Centrally located to cable cars, shopping. the beds were like sleeping on a cloud. the view from the restaurant and bar was breathtaking at dusk and beautiful by day. The staff was friendly, helpful, and the service was excellent. We will definitely be back.

review.title: Definetely will go back to the Hyatt
review.reviewText: Excellent service, the entire staff was extra nice. The room was teriffic. I will only stay at the Hyatt in san francisco.

review.title: nice 3 night stay
review.reviewText: hotel was what i expected. room was nice. easy in/out. cant beat the location.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Hyatt's bed is extremely good, which guarantees a good rest.

review.title: Overlooked Union Square
review.reviewText: We were very satisfied with the hotel, except for one thing. We requested a non-smoking room, (I am allergic to cigarette smoke) which they gave us, but the guests next door smoked and the odor was not good.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: I picked this hotel for the location, probably one of the best locations around union square area. This hotel offers a lot of convince if you want to pay for it. Rooms are very clean and the rest of the hotel as well. If you park cross street from the hotel, you pay around $1.50 each hour, valet parking around $46 + tax + tip :) for the whole day. The hotel does not offer free coffee inside the rooms but Starbuks is inside the hotel and cross street as well. Nice and I would go back there again.

review.title: Going back soon
review.reviewText: The Grans was great. The speed of room service, the valet's & bellman, amazed beyound belief. We've stayed at several top notch locations in the Union Square area but this one definately supprised us w/it attention to detail & overall quality of servce! Thus, we're "Going Back Soon!"

review.title: Very nice but, like San Francisco, costs too much
review.reviewText: Only negative was the 1st night. Had a confirmed reservation but they were over booked and had to put me up in a room with a pull out bed from a couch. Beyond that, very nice. Good location, plush, Scenic on 36th floor restaurant. They were messed upon what I used out of the refrigerator and they refundede me on the departure bill. Enjoyed the wireless accomodation inthe lobby. Over-all, very nice time.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I loved the location but some of the amenities should be included for free with the rates they are charging and the staff is not friendly or accomodating to stuffy for us, we will not stay there again. I do not like that they do not honor the points for the Hyatt rewards if you book thru expedia. We feel if you book with expedia the hotels treat you like it was never a reservation and 2nd rate.

review.title: Loved The Location
review.reviewText: I liked the room and the location. The shower in our room was not that great bad water pressure. I did not care for the bar at the top of the hotel. At night the service sucked. During the day we had lunch the service was great.... The hotel was very close to all the shopping!

review.title: Okay
review.reviewText: If you get a good price, then a good location, but rooms are not updated throughout. I paid for a regency room, and was not put in it the first night due to it being sold out. For my trouble I received a free breakfast, which was good.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: We travel alot, This hotel was in the perfect spot in the city. You can walk to most places and cable car it to others. The staff was very helpful, kind and knowledgeable. They even got me great tickets to the Giants game on short notice. The only draw back is the poor drink quality at the sky lounge (must see though).

review.title: A great place to stay.
review.reviewText: Very conviently located. Within walking distance to great shopping. Nice lounge on the 36th floor with a beautiful view.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent Location. Right in the heart of San Francisco's shopping spot. Located across Starbucks. Close to eateries. Excellent Service. Rooms were clean and mid-size. Will stay there again.

review.title: Overall nice
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, freindly staff, not sold on location. Make sure to walk a couple blocks down if you plan on shopping. I missed that while I was there. Kind of far from North Beach and Fisherman's Warf. Will stay closer next time, but the hotel was nice. Upstairs restuarant has great view.

review.title: Bad Service!!!
review.reviewText: I stayed in Hyatt for 7 nights. The Hotel is in a very nice location. Close to all the stores and transports. Very good fitness center if you compare to other hotels though, no swimming pool. The service of the staff especially from the front desk was not really nice and informative. I upgraded my room to a suite. I was told that the tax will be included in the extra fee and I had confirmed twice. However, it was not the case when I found out on the checkout day. The housekeepers were loud. You can hear them talking or arguing from the room next to you and the table was still dusty after the cleaning (Same Everyday).

review.title: A very good hotel
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. The beds were comfortable, the room was clean , and the temperature in the room was also comfortable. It is conveniently located in the San Francisco shopping district. However, it is also located close to many other attractions. If I go back, I will stay there again.

review.title: Wouldn't recommend this one
review.reviewText: Although it is centrally located near Union Square, the hotel certainly did not meet our expectations. The greeting was poor at best, the room smelled upon arrival, the sheets had stains on them, the toilet did not work properly and the building creeked at night. When questioned about the creeking the staff indicated that we should have been told at arrival and that the creaking was common due to the winds. We'll certainly try a different place when visiting SF next time.

review.title: Luxurious San Francisco
review.reviewText: We spent five luxurious days in the Grand Hyatt. We upgraded to a high floor/great view.Beautiful room. Cocktail lounge with view, superb exercise machines in workout room, excellent service, and our favorite Union Sq. location. We can't wait to return.

review.title: Wonderful Service & Concierge
review.reviewText: We had wonderful service and tips from the concierge. They were great in getting us booked on trips to Sonoma/Napa, the Redwoods/Sausalito, and even found baseball tickets for us the day of the game so we didn't have to stand in line. We were also given wonderful recommendations for dining options in the area.

review.title: Close to Everything! Super Comfortable Beds!
review.reviewText: The Grand Hyatt located on Stockton and Sutter, one block from Union Square shopping, three blocks from BART ($5.15 to SFO), and easy access to safe and clean MUNI buses. The Sealy beds were so comfortable and the down pillows and blankets were and added bonus. The hotel staff were very accomodating and friendly (we received an upgrade because a standard double room was unavailable at the time of our check-in). I had a great time in the city and felt really safe at the Grand Hyatt. I will definitely return to the Grand Hyatt.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is located one block from Union Square. Everything needed was close by, a short walk. The staff were exceptional, and really helpful. I would definetly return to the Grand Hyatt.

review.title: Good location for shopping
review.reviewText: The lounge has only warm softdrings fri.Breakfast OK,but no small food except between kl.5-7pm.

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: The Grand Hyatt in San Francisco is a great place to stay. You can't beat the location...fabulous! The staff can't do enough for you and our room was exactly what we expected..wonderful. One complaint..our room had a great view, but the windows were dirty. They could do better on that area. Otherwise, completely satisfied and we'd stay there again without hesitation.

review.title: Worst of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very old, filthy and unpleasant.I've stayed at other hotels which is couple of blocks away from Grand Hywatt. The cost was about same but the quality was much better. Even cheaper hotels were cleaner and much more comfortable. I looked under the table and found dirt looked like never been cleaned, it was so discusting. I would never recommend this hotel except people I hate. Other than location, there is virtually nothing good about this hotel

review.title: I will definitely return
review.reviewText: The hotel was wonderful. THe rooms were comfortable and clean. The location is perfect. I will definitely stay at the hotel again.

review.title: Know what you are getting
review.reviewText: My biggest concern with a hotel of this size is the fact that there is only one restaurant and lounge - granted each offer spectacular views, if you want a quick and easy dinner in the hotel - you are forced to order room service.

review.title: Great Hotel-
review.reviewText: Great location. Nice size rooms. Staff very friendly & helpful. Only problem we had there is no signs saying pillows & comforters are down. Our friend had a bad astham attack because of this. As soon as we realized this & told housekeeping they came right up & gave her non-allery bedding. We would defintely stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Immaculate room with fabulous view
review.reviewText: Hotel is near the center of shopping and within walking distance (largely uphill) of Chinatown. Walk a block to catch a cable car that will take you to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Best hotel in SF
review.reviewText: Quality and location good.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: overall satisfied.

review.title: Clean, Comfortable, Great Location, Views,Bad Food
review.reviewText: We liked it all, the view from the top floor Bar and restaurant is spectacular. The food was NOT GOOD. It looked good until we started eating. I had crab cakes which were tasty, but the sauces were gross. My mate had a steak, chewy, with a piece of frozen herb butter on top. The clam chowder was good. But the desssert-creme brulee- was cold, like it had just come out of the fridge.Breakfast was OK, but the brewed coffee was horrible. Decent lattes. The room was very nice, clean. Bed was very comfortable. The guy at the front desk was very nice, gave us an upgrade to a view room at no charge. We would go again, but would not eat at the restaurants.

review.title: Hyatt hit's a homer.
review.reviewText: Very comfortable hotel located in the heart of union square. Rooms were clean and service was excellent. I highly reccomend this hotel.

review.title: Regency Club @ Grand Hyatt is a Bargain
review.reviewText: The Regency Club upgrade at the Grand Hyatt, San Francisco is well worth the additional expense. The private club room on the 32nd floor offers spectacular views of Telegraph hill, the Harbor and Alcatraz! There is a free continental breakfast offered in the club room every morning with 3 kinds of fresh juice, coffee, yogurt, fruit, muffins , meat, cheese...etc. In the afternoon there is an honor bar cocktail system with free soft drinks,free hot and cold snacks. The drinks are only $4.00 again with great views of the city. We found the food was usually enough to forego dinner!!

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: Our room was not clean -- large areas of dust on the carpet and on the closet doors. Turned our clothes white. We had 4 people in our room. The hotel repeatedly gave us 3 towels. We had to ask every day for the fourth towel. The hotel in general did not seem welcoming to families with children. At one point, a hotel employee held off our family from an elevator so that he could bring up business people to a function. The business people did not wait for the elevator, while we had too.

review.title: Great stay, fabulous rooftop view restaurant.
review.reviewText: Great stay, fabulous rooftop view restaurant.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: Our whole experience was excellent from the incredibly friendly and helpful staff to the cleanliness of the room.They have won us over.We will go back and stay at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco everytime we are in town.

review.title: Quite Nice
review.reviewText: We were at the hotel for about a week. Unlike some Hyatts, the entire ambiance of the hotel was relaxing. Even though the hotel was full, we never felt crowded or rushed. The staff was very accommodating. For a hotel of this caliber, Internet access should have been free and I didn't appreciate paying $9 for a glass of vodka, but the view from the 36th floor cocktail lounge was almost worth the price of the liquor. I would definitely return.

review.title: Very impressive
review.reviewText: The best value for a hotel in a long time. Staff friendly and helpful. View from the 36th floor breathtaking. Location for business meetings, restaurants, and pleasure outings marvelous.Definitely my pick for next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: The Grand Hyatt San Francisco was conveniently and centrally located to all of our shopping and sightseeing needs. It was very safe, provided expeditious service, friendly employees, a clean room and wonderful view. We vow to return to this hotel whenever we travel to San Francisco.

review.title: Very Ordinary Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is simply "o.k." - nothing more. The serivce was adequate, the room was small (which was not unexpected), and the level of comfort was nothing special. On top of the exhorbitant parking rates, I felt I was overcharged for any extras - internet access, fees to print a document, etc. Not a place I will rush to return to.

review.title: Great place to go back to.
review.reviewText: Great location. Reasonable price. Can only say great things for this hotel. Limo service is luxurious yet comparably priced to taxi.

review.title: Excellent Customer Service
review.reviewText: The concierge service is grerat. All staff memebers are polite and extremely helpful. Grandview Restaurant is a must. Spetacular views and great food. Skip the buffet and have the eggs benidect over CRAB. Or the breakfast sandwich...enough for two.

review.title: Great Room
review.reviewText: Great view from our hotel room...we were on the 30th floor! Only negative...from the 2nd night of our stay, our bathroom started to have a real strong "sewage" smell, coming out of the bath tub pipes...Informed the front desk and they called maintenance right away and fixed the problem! Would recommend this hotel to others! Was in a perfect central area to everything and only a block away from the famous Union Square!!!

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: We booked a two double bed room - it was so very small you could barely get around. The room was not very clean, we had to move the nightstand to use the outlet and my husband was appalled at all the dust and dirt. The tub drain was totally clogged and the tub filled up as you showered, really awful. The air filter in the vent on the ceiling was absolutely filthy. I was really disappointed in the room. I would have to check this one off my list to ever visit again, sorry.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Just up the street from Union Square, and a couple of blocks from Chinatown, it is ideally located close to the cable car line. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful.

review.title: San Francisco's Best Traveler Operating Base
review.reviewText: Great location, views and sevice! Big hotel that has the feel and service of a small, personal hotel. Keeps us coming back.

review.title: Very acccomodating! Will stay there again.
review.reviewText: Feather covers on bed are too warm for sleeping! Otherwise, very happy with accomodations.

review.title: would stay everytime
review.reviewText: Very nice

review.title: Big Rooms
review.reviewText: I've stayed in San Francisco more than a few times and was impressed with the size of the room compared to others. I had a very pleasant experience and the price was more than reasonable.

review.title: Not up to Grand Hyatt Service standards
review.reviewText: From phone service to checking in and checking out service to lobby to transportation service, I was very unimpressed. No spa.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Hotel was an excellent choice to stay in San Francisco. In the heart of Union Square

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel! Clean, friendly staff and awesome location. And, the rooms are a good size. I would definately recommend staying here.

review.title: Great Location at Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel was a great deal for the price in SanFrancisco. My favorite was the bar/resutrant at the top that had an incredible view of The city and bay.

review.title: Good, with small flaws
review.reviewText: Well satisfied overall: + Wish the hotel offered on site child care + Closet door was broken + One server had an attitude + wish the room had a microwave

review.title: Good large hotel experience
review.reviewText: Hotel is in strategic location, close to shopping, business district and Chinatown. Rooms were very clean and bed mattress was firm and bathroom was of reasonable size. Staff was very courteous during a very hectic weekend with Nike Marathon.

review.title: Quality San Fran Hotel Downtown
review.reviewText: Excellent location with numerous shopping places within walking distance. Restaraunt has fantastic view of the bay.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Very good Hotel. Only complaint is room is small but what do you expect in the middle of Union Square?

review.title: Best Location in San Fransico
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel was wonderful. Right in the middle of Union Square and all the stores you can imagine. Perfect for shopping, we would just run up to our room every time the shopping bags would get too heavy and go right back down for more!!! The view was perfect we stayed on the 31st floor and saw right down to the bay, beautiful, would definatley stay here again, walking distance to everything.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: conveniently located near bart, shopping, restaurants.

review.title: Great place to stay. Convenient to everything.
review.reviewText: The Grand Hyatt is in walking distance to China Town, the Financial District, theaters, shopping and terrific restaurants. It's also easy to use the Metro, Bart or the cable car line to get to the wharf and other destinations.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was in a very good location, I was very impressed with that. Although, room was way too small for 3 people and the staff was not very friendly.

review.title: Repeat guest
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt many times while attending an annual trade show at the Moscone Convention Center. The central location, service, price and cleanliness are great!

review.title: No pool
review.reviewText: The hotel is located near Union Square. Great location. When I checked in they had a king room and I had requested 2 double beds. They quicly solved the problem next morning and gave me access to the Regency Room. My only comment... No Pool.

review.title: Would definitely go back
review.reviewText: Very efficient and friendly staff. Housekeeping is wonderful! We very much enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Hotel overall!!! Loved the views! Room service at 3 am was very helpful :)! The only negative is slightly expensive parking (about $45 a day). Other then that, you cant beat the location, the views and service.

review.title: Not Impresssed
review.reviewText: - blocked toilet (2X) during stay - staff's attitude kinda unhelpful

review.title: Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean comfortable and centrally located. Would stay here again. Rooms were small but had a nice view from the 15th floor overlooking the financial District

review.title: Best location, Great Choice!
review.reviewText: Hotel staff is very courteous. We were able to check-in earlier than expected. Hotel is well kept. Our hotel room was comfortable. Hotel is situated within walking distance to EVERYTHING! We would certainly repeat our stay.

review.title: Awesome-Luxury Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was simply fabulous! Very close to Union Square and lots of action. A small deli on the corner is ideal for breakfast and coffee....much cheaper (and far more tasty) than the hotel....they are simply too expensive for food and drinks. The rooms were spacious - complete with a bar and a TV in the bathroom! You won't find a better place....but then again, you pay to be treated like royalty!

review.title: An Oasis in the Middle of Union Square
review.reviewText: Great location! Terrific View! Wonderful Room!  Can't wait to go back!

review.title: The Best Yet
review.reviewText: This hotel is right in the center of everything! Best location and beautiful rooms!

review.title: Perfect location to see San Francisco
review.reviewText: Location made it easy to see everything in San Francisco.  Staff highly professional and service oriented.

review.title: Enjoy our stay and will return
review.reviewText: We do a lot of get aways and we judge the Hotels with strong criticism. Our hotel rooms will make or break our trip. Now after saying all of that, the Grand Hyatt was a delight. We strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who enjoy the comfort and eateries that make this hotel. It is close to the shopping mega and to Chinatown.

review.title: Nice views of the bay
review.reviewText: the grand hyatt is a well run clean hotel. my only complaint would be the rooms are small. i paid extra for their club level, but it wasn't worth it. the "continenal breakfast" was really low budget. great views from their bar on the top floor. overall, i probably would check out another hotel when we go back.

review.title: Bring your own cleaning supplies
review.reviewText: Dirtiest hotel I ever stayed in. Only thing positive was the location of the hotel.

review.title: The best
review.reviewText: Located near Union Square, the Grand Hyatt is the place to be if you're in SF. Easy walking distance within the BART and the Cable Cars, as well as central location with a huge variety of shops and restaurants nearby. Within the hotle, nice, posh ambience combines with friendly service to make one's stay much more than satisfactory. Wide range of amenities too.

review.title: Good Choice
review.reviewText: First of all San Francisco is a great city to visit.  Everything is in close walking distance to tha Grand Hyatt. If you like shopping stores are right outside the hotel.  I would suggest parking in the garage on the opposite corner of the hotel,  much cheaper than parking at the hotel.  I did not eat in the hotel restruarant but I would definetly go upstairs for a drink to see the view.  There were nice touches at the hotel. such as a paper at your door in the morning. Definetly visit San Francisco and the Grand Hyatt is a good choice for a hotel.

review.title: Bad Service
review.reviewText:
After we checked in and went to our room, there was left over dishes outside our door.  Had to call twice to have them come and remove them.  We were registered as 4 guests and only had 3 towels 2 out of the 3 nights we stayed.  Once again I had to call twice before I received the towels along with a blanket that we requested.

Thin walls, neighbors had me up during the night for an hour and a half making noise.

For a Hyatt, I was not happy with our stay. I expected better service than we received.

review.title: very well located
review.reviewText: Steps from Union Square, shops and restaurants, and cable cars nearby.

review.title: Great Location, Clean & Comfortable
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location, just one block from Union Square. The rooms are really nice and really comfortable, with great views of the city too. The rooftop bar and restaurant are a great place to unwind, but are a bit pricey. The staff are very friendly. We only stayed one night, but the doorstaff knew us and welcomed us back each time we returned to the hotel. I will stay at this hotel again!

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: clearly not a 4 star facility. Dining service crowded, too small, too exownsive for srvice or quality. Add-on charges incorrect in the amount of 30 % of bill.

review.title: Great experience-close to shopping & restaurant with a spectacular view
review.reviewText: Hotel was spacious and staff courtieous and helpful.  We were in the heart of shopping district and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel.

review.title: Grand Hyatt San Francisco!!
review.reviewText: Great location!! This hotel is right in the middle of everything in Union Square. The staff is very helpful and professional and the hotel is clean...which is a big plus when staying in this city. Over all I had a great experience and would recommend this hotel to anyone.Worth every dime spent!!

review.title: Fine hotel, great trip....
review.reviewText: Second stay booked through Expedia at this first-class property. Great views from rooms on Financial District and Union Square sides. Excellent location. Attentive service. Rooms modern and very adequate for price.

review.title: Grand Hyatt San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice clean, but smallish room, great location.
